register.name: IoCfgAddr
register.desc: IO-Space Configuration Address. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IO::IoCfgAddr, and IO::IoCfgData are used to access system configuration space, as defined by the PCI specification. IO::IoCfgAddr provides the address register and IO::IoCfgData provides the data port. Software sets up the configuration address by writing to IO::IoCfgAddr. Then, when an access is made to IO::IoCfgData, the processor generates the corresponding configuration access to the address specified in IO::IoCfgAddr. See 2.1.6 [Configuration Space]. IO::IoCfgAddr may only be accessed through aligned, DW IO Reads and Writes; otherwise, the accesses are passed to the appropriate IO link. Accesses to IO::IoCfgAddr and IO::IoCfgData received from an IO link are treated as all other IO transactions received from an IO link. IO::IoCfgAddr and IO::IoCfgData in the processor are not accessible from an IO link.

field.name: ConfigEn
field.desc: configuration space enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=IO Read and Write accesses are passed to the appropriate IO link and no configuration access is generated. 1=IO Read and Write accesses to IO::IoCfgData are translated into configuration cycles at the configuration address specified by this register.

field.name: ExtRegNo
field.desc: extended register number. Read-write. Reset: 0h. ExtRegNo provides bits[11:8] and RegNo provides bits[7:2] of the byte address of the configuration register.

field.name: BusNo
field.desc: bus number. Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the bus number of the configuration cycle.

field.name: Device
field.desc: device number. Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the device number of the configuration cycle.

field.name: Function
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Specifies the function number of the configuration cycle.

field.name: RegNo
field.desc: register address. Read-write. Reset: 00h. See IO::IoCfgAddr[ExtRegNo].

register.name: IoCfgData
register.desc: IO-Space Configuration Data Port. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: Data
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. See IO::IoCfgAddr.

field.name: ApicId
field.desc: APIC ID. Read-only. Reset: XXh. The reset value varies based on core number. See 2.1.11.2.1.3 [ApicId Enumeration Requirements].

field.name: ExtApicSpace
field.desc: extended APIC register space present. Read-only. Reset: 1. 1=Indicates the presence of extended APIC register space starting at Core::X86::Apic::ExtendedApicFeature.

field.name: DirectedEoiSupport
field.desc: directed EOI support. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Directed EOI capability not supported.

field.name: MaxLvtEntry
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: XXh. Specifies the number of entries in the local vector table minus one.

field.name: Version
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 10h. Indicates the version number of this APIC implementation.

field.name: Priority
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This field is assigned by software to set a threshold priority at which the core is interrupted.

field.name: Priority
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 00h. Indicates the current priority for a pending interrupt, or a task or interrupt being serviced by the core. The priority is used to arbitrate between cores to determine which accepts a lowest-priority interrupt request.

field.name: Priority
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 00h. Indicates the core's current priority servicing a task or interrupt, and is used to determine if any pending interrupts should be serviced. It is the higher value of the task priority value and the current highest in-service interrupt.

register.name: EndOfInterrupt
register.desc: End of Interrupt. Write-only. This register is written by the software interrupt handler to indicate the servicing of the current interrupt is complete.

register.name: RemoteRead
register.desc: Reserved. Read-only. Reset: 0000_0000h. Remote Read is deprecated.

field.name: Destination
field.desc: Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 00h. This APIC's destination identification. Used to determine which interrupts should be accepted.

register.name: DestinationFormat
register.desc: Destination Format. Read-write. Reset: F000_0000h. Only supported in xAPIC mode.

field.name: Format
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Fh. Controls which format to use when accepting interrupts with a logical destination mode.

field.name: FocusDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Disable focus core checking during lowest-priority arbitrated interrupts.

field.name: APICSWEn
field.desc: APIC software enable. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=SMI, NMI, INIT, LINT[1:0], and Startup interrupts may be accepted; pending interrupts in Core::X86::Apic::InService and Core::X86::Apic::InterruptRequest are held, but further fixed, lowest-priority, and ExtInt interrupts are not accepted. All LVT entry mask bits are set and cannot be cleared.

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write,Volatile. Reset: FFh. The vector that is sent to the core in the event of a spurious interrupt.

register.name: InService
register.desc: In-Service. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. The in-service registers provide a bit per interrupt to indicate that the corresponding interrupt is being serviced by the core. The first 16 InServiceBits of the first Core::X86::Apic::InService register are Reserved.

field.name: InServiceBits
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. These bits are set when the corresponding interrupt is being serviced by the core.

register.name: TriggerMode
register.desc: Trigger Mode. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. The trigger mode registers provide a bit per interrupt to indicate the assertion mode of each interrupt. The first 16 TriggerModeBits of the each thread's APIC[1F0:180] registers are Reserved.

field.name: TriggerModeBits
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. The corresponding trigger mode bit is updated when an interrupt is accepted. 1=Level-triggered interrupt. 0=Edge-triggered interrupt.

register.name: InterruptRequest
register.desc: Interrupt Request. Read-only. Reset: 0000_0000h. The interrupt request registers provide a bit per interrupt to indicate that the corresponding interrupt has been accepted by the APIC. The first 16 RequestBits of the first Core::X86::Apic::InterruptRequest register are Reserved.

field.name: RequestBits
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000_0000h. The corresponding request bit is set when the an interrupt is accepted by the APIC.

register.name: ErrorStatus
register.desc: Error Status. Writes to this register trigger an update of the register state. The value written by software is arbitrary. Each write causes the internal error state to be loaded into this register, clearing the internal error state. Consequently, a second write prior to the occurrence of another error causes the register to be overwritten with cleared data.

field.name: IllegalRegAddr
field.desc: illegal register address. Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit indicates that an access to a nonexistent register location within this APIC was attempted. Can only be set in xAPIC mode.

field.name: RcvdIllegalVector
field.desc: received illegal vector. Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit indicates that this APIC has received a message with an illegal vector (00h to 0Fh for fixed and lowest priority interrupts).

field.name: SentIllegalVector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit indicates that this APIC attempted to send a message with an illegal vector (00h to 0Fh for fixed and lowest priority interrupts).

field.name: RcvAcceptError
field.desc: receive accept error. Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit indicates that a message received by this APIC was not accepted by this or any other APIC.

field.name: SendAcceptError
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit indicates that a message sent by this APIC was not accepted by any APIC.

field.name: DestShrthnd
field.desc: destination shorthand. Read-write. Reset: 0h. Description: Provides a quick way to specify a destination for a message. If all including self or all excluding self is used, then destination mode is ignored and physical is automatically used.

field.name: RemoteRdStat
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h.

field.name: TM
field.desc: trigger mode. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge triggered. 1=Level triggered. Indicates how this interrupt is triggered.

field.name: Level
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=De-asserted. 1=Asserted.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. In xAPIC mode this bit is set to indicate that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the destination core(s). Software may repeatedly write Core::X86::Apic::InterruptCommandLow without polling the DS bit; all requested IPIs are delivered.

field.name: DM
field.desc: destination mode. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Physical. 1=Logical.

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. The message types are encoded as follows:

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. The vector that is sent for this interrupt source.

field.name: DestinationField
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. The destination encoding used when Core::X86::Apic::InterruptCommandLow[DestShrthnd] is 00b.

field.name: Mode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=One-shot. 1=Periodic.

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Not masked. 1=Masked.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. (Indicates that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the core.)

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: message type. Read-write. Reset: 0h. See2.1.11.2.1.14 [Generalized Local Vector Table].

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector number.

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Not masked. 1=Masked.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. (Indicates that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the core.)

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: message type. Read-write. Reset: 0h. See2.1.11.2.1.14 [Generalized Local Vector Table].

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector number.

register.name: PerformanceCounterLvtEntry
register.desc: LVT Performance Monitor. Reset: 0001_0000h. Interrupts for this local vector table are caused by overflows of: • Core::X86::Msr::PERF_LEGACY_CTL(Performance Event Select [3:0]). • Core::X86::Msr::PERF_CTL(Performance Event Select [5:0]).

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Not masked. 1=Masked.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. (Indicates that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the core.)

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: message type. Read-write. Reset: 0h. See2.1.11.2.1.14 [Generalized Local Vector Table].

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector number.

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Not masked. 1=Masked.

field.name: TM
field.desc: trigger mode. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: RmtIRR
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. If trigger mode is level, remote Core::X86::Apic::InterruptRequest is set when the interrupt has begun service. Remote Core::X86::Apic::InterruptRequest is cleared when the end of interrupt has occurred.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. (Indicates that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the core.)

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: message type. Read-write. Reset: 0h. See2.1.11.2.1.14 [Generalized Local Vector Table].

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector number.

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Not masked. 1=Masked.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. (Indicates that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the core.)

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: message type. Read-write. Reset: 0h. See 2.1.11.2.1.14 [Generalized Local Vector Table].

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector number.

field.name: Count
field.desc: Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. The value copied into the current count register when the timer is loaded or reloaded.

field.name: Count
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. The current value of the counter.

field.name: Div[3:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Div[2] is unused.

field.name: ExtLvtCount
field.desc: extended local vector table count. Read-only. Reset: 04h. This specifies the number of extended LVT registers (Core::X86::Apic::ExtendedInterruptLvtEntries) in the local APIC.

field.name: ExtApicIdCap
field.desc: extended APIC ID capable. Read-only. Reset: 1. 1=The processor is capable of supporting an 8-bit APIC ID, as controlled by Core::X86::Apic::ExtendedApicControl[ExtApicIdEn].

field.name: SeoiCap
field.desc: specific end of interrupt capable. Read-only. Reset: 1. 1=The Core::X86::Apic::SpecificEndOfInterrupt is present.

field.name: IerCap
field.desc: interrupt enable register capable. Read-only. Reset: 1. This bit indicates that the Core::X86::Apic::InterruptEnable are present. See2.1.11.2.1.8 [Interrupt Masking].

field.name: ExtApicIdEn
field.desc: extended APIC ID enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable 8-bit APIC ID; Core::X86::Apic::ApicId[ApicId] supports an 8-bit value; an interrupt broadcast in physical destination mode requires that the IntDest[7:0] == 1111_1111b (instead of XXXX_1111b); a match in physical destination mode occurs when (IntDest[7:0] == ApicId[7:0]) instead of (IntDest[3:0] == ApicId[3:0]).

field.name: SeoiEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable SEOI generation when a Write to Core::X86::Apic::SpecificEndOfInterrupt is received.

field.name: IerEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable writes to the interrupt enable registers.

register.name: SpecificEndOfInterrupt
register.desc: Specific End Of Interrupt. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: EoiVec
field.desc: end of interrupt vector. Read-write. Reset: 00h. A Write to this field causes an end of interrupt cycle to be performed for the vector specified in this field. The behavior is undefined if no interrupt is pending for the specified interrupt vector.

field.name: InterruptEnableBits
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. The interrupt enable bits can be used to enable each of the 256 interrupts.

register.name: ExtendedInterruptLvtEntries
register.desc: Extended Interrupt Local Vector Table. Reset: 0001_0000h. Assignments conventions: • APIC500 provides a local vector table entry for IBS. • APIC510 provides a local vector table entry for error thresholding. See Core::X86::Msr::McaIntrCfg[ThresholdLvtOffset]. • APIC520 provides a local vector table entry for Deferred errors. See MCi_CONFIG[DeferredIntType].

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Not masked. 1=Masked.

field.name: DS
field.desc: interrupt delivery status. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send pending. (Indicates that the interrupt has not yet been accepted by the core.)

field.name: MsgType
field.desc: message type. Read-write. Reset: 0h. See2.1.11.2.1.14 [Generalized Local Vector Table].

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector number.

register.name: LargFuncNum
register.desc: Processor Vendor and Largest Standard Function Number. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_000Dh.

field.name: LFuncStd
field.desc: largest standard function. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_000Dh. The largest CPUID standard function input value supported by the processor implementation.

register.name: ProcVendEbx
register.desc: Processor Vendor (ASCII Bytes [3:0]). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6874_7541h. Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendEbx and Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendExtEbx return the same value.

field.name: Vendor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6874_7541h. ASCII Bytes [3:0] ("h t u A") of the string "AuthenticAMD".

register.name: ProcVendEcx
register.desc: Processor Vendor (ASCII Bytes [11:8]). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,444D_4163h. Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendEcx and Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendExtEcx return the same value.

field.name: Vendor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,444D_4163h. ASCII Bytes [11:8] ("D M A c") of the string "AuthenticAMD".

register.name: ProcVendEdx
register.desc: Processor Vendor (ASCII Bytes [7:4]). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6974_6E65h. Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendEdx and Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendExtEdx return the same value.

field.name: Vendor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6974_6E65h. ASCII Bytes [7:4] ("i t n e") of the string "AuthenticAMD".

register.name: FamModStep
register.desc: Family, Model, Stepping Identifiers. Read-only. Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStep and Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStepExt return the same value. Family: Is an 8-bit value and is defined as: Family[7:0]=({0000b,BaseFamily[3:0]}+ExtendedFamily[7:0]). • E.g., If BaseFamily[3:0] == Fh and ExtendedFamily[7:0] == 08h, then Family[7:0] = 17h. Model: Is an 8-bit value and is defined as: Model[7:0]={ExtendedModel[3:0],BaseModel[3:0]}. • E.g., If ExtendedModel[3:0] == 1h and BaseModel[3:0] == 8h, then Model[7:0] = 18h. • Model numbers vary with product. Model numbers are are assigned a letter, 0h = "A", 1h = "B", and so on. Model and Stepping form the Revision. E.g., B1.

field.name: ExtFamily
field.desc: extended family. Read-only. Reset: 08h. See Family above.

field.name: ExtModel
field.desc: extended model. Read-only. Reset: 1h. See Model above.

field.name: BaseFamily
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fh. See Family description above.

field.name: BaseModel
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Xh. Model numbers vary with product.

field.name: Stepping
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1h. Processor stepping (revision) for a specific model.

field.name: LocalApicId
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: XXh. Initial local APIC physical ID.

field.name: LogicalProcessorCount
field.desc: logical processor count. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,(Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] + 1). Specifies the number of threads in the processor as Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] + 1.

field.name: CLFlush
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,08h. CLFLUSH size in quadwords.

register.name: FeatureIdEcx
register.desc: Feature Identifiers. Read-only. These values can be over-written by Core::X86::Msr::CPUID_Features.

field.name: RDRAND
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. RDRAND instruction support.

field.name: F16C
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Half-precision convert instruction support.

field.name: AVX
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. AVX instruction support.

field.name: OSXSAVE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 1=The OS has enabled support for XGETBV/XSETBV instructions to query processor extended states. OS enabled support for XGETBV/XSETBV.

field.name: XSAVE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Support provided for the XSAVE, XRSTOR, XSETBV, and XGETBV instructions and the XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK register. XSAVE (and related) instruction support.

field.name: AES
field.desc: AES instruction support. Read-only. Reset: X. AES instruction support.

field.name: POPCNT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. POPCNT instruction.

field.name: MOVBE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. MOVBE instruction support.

field.name: X2APIC
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. x2APIC capability.

field.name: SSE42
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SSE4.2 instruction support.

field.name: SSE41
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SSE4.1 instruction support.

field.name: CMPXCHG16B
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. CMPXCHG16B instruction.

field.name: FMA
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. FMA instruction support.

field.name: SSSE3
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Supplemental SSE3 extensions.

field.name: Monitor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: !Core::X86::Msr::HWCR[MonMwaitDis]. Monitor/Mwait instructions.

field.name: PCLMULQDQ
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. PCLMULQDQ instruction support.

field.name: SSE3
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SSE3 extensions.

register.name: FeatureIdEdx
register.desc: Feature Identifiers. Read-only. These values can be over-written by Core::X86::Msr::CPUID_Features.

field.name: HTT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,(Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] != 0). 0=Single thread product (Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] == 0). 1=Multi thread product (Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] != 0). Hyper- threading technology.

field.name: SSE2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SSE2: SSE2 extensions.

field.name: SSE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SSE extensions.

field.name: FXSR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. FXSAVE and FXRSTOR instructions.

field.name: MMX
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. MMX instructions

field.name: CLFSH
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. CLFLUSH instruction.

field.name: PSE36
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page-size extensions.

field.name: PAT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page attribute table.

field.name: CMOV
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Conditional move instructions, CMOV, FCOMI, FCMOV.

field.name: MCA
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Machine check architecture, MCG_CAP.

field.name: PGE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page global extension, CR4.PGE.

field.name: MTRR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Memory-type range registers.

field.name: SysEnterSysExit
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SYSENTER and SYSEXIT instructions.

field.name: APIC
field.desc: advanced programmable interrupt controller (APIC) exists and is enabled. Read-only. Reset: X. Core::X86::Msr::APIC_BAR[ApicEn].

field.name: CMPXCHG8B
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. CMPXCHG8B instruction.

field.name: MCE

field.name: PAE

field.name: MSR

field.name: TSC

register.name: ThermalPwrMgmtEcx

field.name: EffFreq

field.name: FSGSBASE

register.name: ExtTopEnumEax
register.desc: Extended Topology Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: ExtTopEnumEbx
register.desc: Extended Topology Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: ExtTopEnumEcx
register.desc: Extended Topology Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

field.name: ApicId
field.desc: APIC ID. Read-only. Reset: XXh. APIC ID.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEax00
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0007h.

field.name: XFeatureSupportedMask[31:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0007h. Each set bit indicates the corresponding bit in register XCR0[31:0] is settable.

field.name: XFeatureEnabledSizeMax
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: XXXX_XXXXh. Description: Size in bytes of an uncompacted XSAVE/XRSTOR area for all features enabled in the XCR0 register. IF (XCR0[AVX] == 1) Return EBX = 0000_0340h // legacy header + X87/SSE + AVX size ELSIF (XCR0[SSE] == 1) Return EBX=0000_0240h // legacy header + X87/SSE size ELSIF (XCR0[X87] == 1) Return EBX = 0000_0240h END

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEcx00
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0400h.

field.name: XFeatureSupportedSizeMax
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0400h. Size of legacy header + X87/SSE + AVX.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEdx00
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

field.name: XFeatureSupportedMask[63:32]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Each set bit indicates the corresponding bit in register XCR0[63:32] is settable.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEax01
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_000Fh.

field.name: XSAVES
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. XSAVES,XRSTORS, and XSS supported.

field.name: XGETBV
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. XGETBV with ECX = 1 supported.

field.name: XSAVEC
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. XSAVEC and compact XRSTOR supported.

field.name: XSAVEOPT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. XSAVEOPT is available.

field.name: XFeatureEnabledSizeMax
field.desc: Read-only,Volatile. Reset: XXXX_XXXXh. Value is 512 + ((XCR0[AVX]) ? 256 : 0).

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEcx01
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEdx01
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEax02
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0100h.

field.name: YmmSaveStateSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0100h. YMM save state byte size.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEbx02
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0240h.

field.name: YmmSaveStateOffset
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0240h. YMM save state byte offset.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEcx02
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: ProcExtStateEnumEdx02
register.desc: Processor Extended State Enumeration. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: LargExtFuncNum
register.desc: Largest Extended Function Number. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,8000_001Fh.

field.name: LFuncExt
field.desc: largest extended function. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,8000_001Fh. The largest CPUID extended function input value supported by the processor implementation.

register.name: ProcVendExtEbx
register.desc: Processor Vendor (ASCII Bytes [3:0]). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6874_7541h. Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendEbx and Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendExtEbx return the same value.

field.name: Vendor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6874_7541h. ASCII Bytes [3:0] ("h t u A") of the string "AuthenticAMD".

register.name: ProcVendExtEcx
register.desc: Processor Vendor (ASCII Bytes [11:8]). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,444D_4163h. Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendEcx and Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendExtEcx return the same value.

field.name: Vendor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,444D_4163h. ASCII Bytes [11:8] ("D M A c") of the string "AuthenticAMD".

register.name: ProcVendExtEdx
register.desc: Processor Vendor (ASCII Bytes [7:4]). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6974_6E65h. Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendEdx and Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcVendExtEdx return the same value.

field.name: Vendor
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6974_6E65h. ASCII Bytes [7:4] ("i t n e") of the string "AuthenticAMD".

register.name: FamModStepExt
register.desc: Family, Model, Stepping Identifiers. Read-only. Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStep and Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStepExt return the same value. See Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStep.

field.name: ExtFamily
field.desc: extended family. Read-only. Reset: 08h. See Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStep description of Family.

field.name: ExtModel
field.desc: extended model. Read-only. Reset: 1h. See Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStep description of ExtModel.

field.name: BaseFamily
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::FamModStep description of Family.

field.name: BaseModel
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Xh. Model numbers vary with product.

field.name: Stepping
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1h. Processor stepping (revision) for a specific model.

field.name: PkgType
field.desc: package type. Read-only. Reset: Xh. Specifies the package type.

register.name: FeatureExtIdEcx
register.desc: Feature Identifiers. Read-only. These values can be over-written by Core::X86::Msr::CPUID_ExtFeatures.

field.name: MwaitExtended
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: !Core::X86::Msr::HWCR[MonMwaitDis]. 1=MWAITX and MONITORX capability is supported.

field.name: PerfCtrExtLLC
field.desc: Last Level Cache performance counter extensions. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::ChL3PmcCfg and Core::X86::Msr::ChL3Pmc L3 performance counter extensions. L3 performance counter extensions support. See 2.1.14.4 [L3 Cache Performance Monitor Counters] and 2.1.14 [Performance Monitor Counters].

field.name: PerfTsc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Performance time-stamp counter supported.

field.name: DataBreakpointExtension
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates data breakpoint support for Core::X86::Msr::DR0_ADDR_MASK, Core::X86::Msr::DR1_ADDR_MASK, Core::X86::Msr::DR2_ADDR_MASK and Core::X86::Msr::DR3_ADDR_MASK.

field.name: PerfCtrExtDF
field.desc: data fabric performance counter extensions support. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::DF_PERF_CTL and Core::X86::Msr::DF_PERF_CTR.

field.name: PerfCtrExtCore
field.desc: core performance counter extensions support. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::PERF_CTL and Core::X86::Msr::PERF_CTR. See See 2.1.14.3 [Core Performance Monitor Counters] and 2.1.14 [Performance Monitor Counters].

field.name: TopologyExtensions
field.desc: topology extensions support. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates support for Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0 and Core::X86::Cpuid::ExtApicId.

field.name: TCE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Translation cache extension.

field.name: FMA4
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Four-operand FMA instruction support.

field.name: LWP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Lightweight profiling support.

field.name: WDT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Watchdog timer support.

field.name: SKINIT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SKINIT and STGI support.

field.name: XOP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Extended operation support.

field.name: IBS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Instruction Based Sampling.

field.name: OSVW
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. OS Visible Work-around support.

field.name: ThreeDNowPrefetch
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Prefetch and PrefetchW instructions.

field.name: MisAlignSse
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Misaligned SSE Mode.

field.name: SSE4A
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. EXTRQ, INSERTQ, MOVNTSS, and MOVNTSD instruction support.

field.name: ABM
field.desc: advanced bit manipulation. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. LZCNT instruction support.

field.name: AltMovCr8
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. LOCK MOV CR0 means MOV CR8.

field.name: ExtApicSpace
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Extended APIC register space.

field.name: SVM
field.desc: Secure Virtual Mode feature. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicates support for: VMRUN, VMLOAD, VMSAVE, CLGI, VMMCALL, and INVLPGA.

field.name: CmpLegacy
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,(Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] > 0). 0=Single core product (Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] == 0). 1=Multi core product (Core::X86::Cpuid::SizeId[NC] !=0 ). Core multi- processing legacy mode.

field.name: LahfSahf
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. LAHF and SAHF instruction support in 64-bit mode.

register.name: FeatureExtIdEdx
register.desc: Feature Identifiers. Read-only. These values can be over-written by Core::X86::Msr::CPUID_ExtFeatures.

field.name: ThreeDNow
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 3DNow! instructions.

field.name: ThreeDNowExt
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. AMD extensions to 3DNow! instructions.

field.name: LM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Long Mode.

field.name: RDTSCP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. RDTSCP instruction.

field.name: Page1GB
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1-GB large page support.

field.name: FFXSR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. FXSAVE and FXRSTOR instruction optimizations.

field.name: FXSR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. FXSAVE and FXRSTOR instructions.

field.name: MMX
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. MMX instructions.

field.name: MmxExt
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. AMD extensions to MMX instructions.

field.name: NX
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. No-execute page protection.

field.name: PSE36
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page-size extensions.

field.name: PAT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page attribute table.

field.name: CMOV
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Conditional move instructions, CMOV, FCOMI, FCMOV.

field.name: MCA
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Machine check architecture, MCG_CAP.

field.name: PGE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page global extension, CR4.PGE.

field.name: MTRR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Memory-type range registers.

field.name: SysCallSysRet
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SYSCALL and SYSRET instructions.

field.name: APIC
field.desc: advanced programmable interrupt controller (APIC) exists and is enabled. Read-only. Reset: X. Reset is Core::X86::Msr::APIC_BAR[ApicEn].

field.name: CMPXCHG8B
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. CMPXCHG8B instruction.

field.name: MCE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Machine Check Exception, CR4.MCE.

field.name: PAE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Physical-address extensions (PAE).

field.name: MSR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Model-specific registers (MSRs), with RDMSR and WRMSR instructions.

field.name: TSC
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Time stamp counter, RDTSC/RDTSCP instructions, CR4.TSD.

field.name: PSE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Page-size extensions (4 MB pages).

field.name: DE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Debugging extensions, IO breakpoints, CR4.DE.

field.name: VME
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Virtual-mode enhancements.

field.name: FPU
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. x87 floating-point unit on-chip.

register.name: L1Tlb2M4M
register.desc: L1 TLB 2M/4M Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides the processor's first level cache and TLB characteristics for each core.

field.name: L1DTlb2and4MAssoc
field.desc: data TLB associativity for 2-MB and 4-MB pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,FFh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L1DcId[L1DcAssoc].

field.name: L1DTlb2and4MSize
field.desc: data TLB number of entries for 2-MB and 4 MB-pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. The value returned is for the number of entries available for the 2-MB page size; 4-MB pages require two 2-MB entries, so the number of entries available for the 4-MB page size is one-half the returned value.

field.name: L1ITlb2and4MAssoc
field.desc: instruction TLB associativity for 2-MB and 4 MB-pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,FFh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L1DcId[L1DcAssoc].

field.name: L1ITlb2and4MSize
field.desc: instruction TLB number of entries for 2-MB and 4-MB pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. The value returned is for the number of entries available for the 2-MB page size; 4-MB pages require two 2-MB entries, so the number of entries available for the 4-MB page size is one-half the returned value.

register.name: L1Tlb4K
register.desc: L1 TLB 4K Identifiers. Read-only. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L1Tlb2M4M.

field.name: L1DTlb4KAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,FFh. Data TLB associativity for 4-KB pages. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L1DcId[L1DcAssoc].

field.name: L1DTlb4KSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. Data TLB number of entries for 4-KB pages.

field.name: L1ITlb4KAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,FFh. Instruction TLB associativity for 4-KB pages. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L1DcId[L1DcAssoc].

field.name: L1ITlb4KSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. Instruction TLB number of entries for 4-KB pages.

register.name: L1DcId
register.desc: L1 Data Cache Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides first level cache characteristics for each core.

field.name: L1DcSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,32. L1 data cache size in KB.

field.name: L1DcAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,8. L1 data cache associativity.

field.name: L1DcLinesPerTag
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01h. L1 data cache lines per tag.

field.name: L1DcLineSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L1 data cache line size in bytes.

register.name: L1IcId
register.desc: L1 Instruction Cache Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides first level cache characteristics for each core.

field.name: L1IcSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L1 instruction cache size KB.

field.name: L1IcAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,4. L1 instruction cache associativity.

field.name: L1IcLinesPerTag
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01h. L1 instruction cache lines per tag.

field.name: L1IcLineSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L1 instruction cache line size in bytes.

register.name: L2Tlb2M4M
register.desc: L2 TLB 2M/4M Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides the processor's second level cache and TLB characteristics for each core.

field.name: L2DTlb2and4MAssoc
field.desc: L2 data TLB associativity for 2-MB and 4-MB pages. Read-only. Reset: Xh.

field.name: L2DTlb2and4MSize
field.desc: L2 data TLB number of entries for 2-MB and 4-MB pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1536. The value returned is for the number of entries available for the 2-MB page size; 4-MB pages require two 2-MB entries, so the number of entries available for the 4-MB page size is one-half the returned value.

field.name: L2ITlb2and4MAssoc
field.desc: L2 instruction TLB associativity for 2-MB and 4-MB pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6.

field.name: L2ITlb2and4MSize
field.desc: L2 instruction TLB number of entries for 2-MB and 4-MB pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1024. The value returned is for the number of entries available for the 2-MB page size; 4-MB pages require two 2-MB entries, so the number of entries available for the 4-MB page size is one-half the returned value.

register.name: L2Tlb4K
register.desc: L2 TLB 4K Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides the processor's second level cache and TLB characteristics for each core.

field.name: L2DTlb4KAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Xh. L2 data TLB associativity for 4-KB pages.

field.name: L2DTlb4KSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1536. L2 data TLB number of entries for 4-KB pages.

field.name: L2ITlb4KAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6. L2 instruction TLB associativity for 4-KB pages.

field.name: L2ITlb4KSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1024. L2 instruction TLB number of entries for 4-KB pages.

register.name: L2CacheId
register.desc: L2 Cache Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides second level cache characteristics for each core.

field.name: L2Size
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0200h. L2 cache size in KB.

field.name: L2Assoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,6. L2 cache associativity.

field.name: L2LinesPerTag
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. L2 cache lines per tag.

field.name: L2LineSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L2 cache line size in bytes.

register.name: L3CacheId
register.desc: L3 Cache Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides third level cache characteristics shared by all cores of a processor.

field.name: L3Size
field.desc: L3 cache size. Read-only. Reset: XXXXh. The L3 cache size in 512 KB units.

field.name: L3Assoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Xh. L3 cache associativity.

field.name: L3LinesPerTag
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. L3 cache lines per tag.

field.name: L3LineSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L3 cache line size in bytes.

field.name: ScalableMca
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 0=Scalable MCA is not supported. 1=Scalable MCA is supported. See 3.1.1.2 [Machine Check Architecture Extensions] and MCA_CONFIG[McaX] for the respective bank.

field.name: HWA
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Hardware assert supported.

field.name: SUCCOR
field.desc: Software uncorrectable error containment and recovery capability. Read-only. Reset: X. The processor supports software containment of uncorrectable errors through context synchronizing data poisoning and deferred error interrupts; MSR Core::X86::Msr::McaIntrCfg, MCA_STATUS[Deferred] and MCA_STATUS[Poison] exist.

field.name: McaOverflowRecov
field.desc: MCA overflow recovery support. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 0=MCA overflow conditions require software to shutdown the system. 1=MCA overflow conditions (MCi_STATUS[Overflow] == 1) are not fatal; software may safely ignore such conditions. See 3.1 [Machine Check Architecture].

register.name: ApmInfoEcx
register.desc: Advanced Power Management Information. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h.

field.name: CpuPwrSampleTimeRatio
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Specifies the ratio of the compute unit power accumulator sample period to the TSC counter period.

register.name: ApmInfoEdx
register.desc: Advanced Power Management Information. Read-only. This function provides advanced power management feature identifiers.

field.name: RAPL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Running average power limit.

field.name: ConnectedStandby
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Connected Standby.

field.name: ProcPowerReporting
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Core power reporting interface supported.

field.name: ProcFeedbackInterface
field.desc: processor feedback interface. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 1=Indicates support for processor feedback interface; Core::X86::Cpuid::ProcFeedbackCap.

field.name: EffFreqRO
field.desc: read-only effective frequency interface. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicates presence of Core::X86::Msr::MPerfReadOnly and Core::X86::Msr::APerfReadOnly.

field.name: CPB
field.desc: core performance boost. Read-only. Reset: X. 1=Indicates presence of Core::X86::Msr::HWCR[CpbDis] and support for core performance boost.

field.name: TscInvariant
field.desc: TSC invariant. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. The TSC rate is invariant.

field.name: HwPstate
field.desc: hardware P-state control. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Core::X86::Msr::PStateCurLim, Core::X86::Msr::PStateCtl and Core::X86::Msr::PStateStat exist.

field.name: OneHundredMHzSteps
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 100 MHz multiplier Control.

field.name: TM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Hardware thermal control (HTC).

field.name: TTP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. THERMTRIP.

field.name: VID
field.desc: Voltage ID control. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Function replaced by HwPstate.

field.name: FID
field.desc: Frequency ID control. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Function replaced by HwPstate.

field.name: TS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Temperature sensor.

register.name: LongModeInfo
register.desc: Long Mode Address Size Identifiers. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_3030h. This provides information about the maximum physical and linear address width supported by the processor.

field.name: GuestPhysAddrSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Maximum guest physical byte address size in bits.

field.name: LinAddrSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,30h. Maximum linear byte address size in bits.

field.name: PhysAddrSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,30h. Maximum physical byte address size in bits.

register.name: FeatureExtIdEbx
register.desc: Extended Feature Extensions ID EBX. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0007h.

field.name: RstrFpErrPtrs
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=FXSAVE, XSAVE, FXSAVEOPT, XSAVEC, XSAVES always save error pointers and FXRSTOR, XRSTOR, XRSTORS always restore error pointers is supported.

field.name: InstRetCntMsr
field.desc: instructions retired count support. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Core::X86::Msr::IRPerfCount supported.

field.name: CLZERO
field.desc: Clear Zero Instruction. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. CLZERO instruction zero's out the 64-byte cache line specified in RAX. Note: CLZERO instruction operations are cache-line aligned and RAX[5:0] is ignored.

register.name: SizeId
register.desc: Size Identifiers. Read-only. This provides information about the number of threads supported by the processor.

field.name: PerfTscSize
field.desc: performance time-stamp counter size. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h.

field.name: ApicIdSize
field.desc: APIC ID size. Read-only. Reset: Xh. The number of bits in the initial Core::X86::Apic::ApicId[ApicId] value that indicate thread ID within a package.

field.name: NC
field.desc: number of threads - 1. Read-only. Reset: XXh. The number of threads in the package is NC + 1 (e.g., if NC == 0, then there is one thread).

register.name: SvmRevFeatIdEax
register.desc: SVM Revision and Feature Identification. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0001h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[SVM].

field.name: SvmRev
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01h. SVM revision.

register.name: SvmRevFeatIdEbx
register.desc: SVM Revision and Feature Identification. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_8000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[SVM]. This provides SVM revision and feature information.

field.name: NASID
field.desc: number of address space identifiers (ASID). Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_8000h.

register.name: SvmRevFeatIdEdx
register.desc: SVM Revision and Feature Identification. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0001_B4FFh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[SVM]. This provides SVM feature information.

field.name: vGIF
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Virtualized GIF.

field.name: V_VMSAVE_VMLOAD
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Virtualized VMLOAD and VMSAVE.

field.name: AVIC
field.desc: AMD virtual interrupt controller. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Support indicated for SVM mode virtualized interrupt controller; Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::AvicDoorbell.

field.name: PauseFilterThreshold
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. PAUSE filter threshold.

field.name: PauseFilter
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Pause intercept filter.

field.name: DecodeAssists
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Decode assists.

field.name: FlushByAsid
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Flush by ASID.

field.name: VmcbClean
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. VMCB clean bits.

field.name: TscRateMsr
field.desc: MSR based TSC rate control. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates support for TSC ratio Core::X86::Msr::TscRateMsr.

field.name: NRIPS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. NRIP Save.

field.name: SVML
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. SVM lock.

field.name: LbrVirt
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. LBR virtualization.

field.name: NP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Nested Paging.

register.name: L1Tlb1G
register.desc: L1 TLB 1G Identifiers. Read-only. This function provides first level TLB characteristics for 1-GB pages.

field.name: L1DTlb1GAssoc
field.desc: L1 data TLB associativity for 1-GB pages. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,Fh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L2CacheId[L2Assoc].

field.name: L1DTlb1GSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L1 data TLB number of entries for 1-GB pages.

field.name: L1ITlb1GAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,Fh. L1 instruction TLB associativity for 1-GB pages. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L2CacheId[L2Assoc].

field.name: L1ITlb1GSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,64. L1 instruction TLB number of entries for 1-GB pages.

register.name: L2Tlb1G
register.desc: L2 TLB 1G Identifiers. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. This provides 1-GB paging information. The associativity fields are defined by Core::X86::Cpuid::L2Tlb2M4M, Core::X86::Cpuid::L2Tlb4K, Core::X86::Cpuid::L2CacheId and Core::X86::Cpuid::L3CacheId.

field.name: L2DTlb1GAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. L2 data TLB associativity for 1-GB pages. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L2CacheId[L2Assoc].

field.name: L2DTlb1GSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,000h. L2 data TLB number of entries for 1-GB pages.

field.name: L2ITlb1GAssoc
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. L2 instruction TLB associativity for 1-GB pages. See Core::X86::Cpuid::L2CacheId[L2Assoc].

field.name: L2ITlb1GSize
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,000h. L2 instruction TLB number of entries for 1-GB pages.

register.name: PerfOptId
register.desc: Performance Optimization Identifiers. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0003h. This function returns performance related information.

field.name: FP256
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 256-bit AVX instructions are executed with full-width internal operations and pipelines rather than decomposing them into internal 128-bit suboperations.

field.name: MOVU
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. MOVU SSE instructions are more efficient and should be preferred to SSE MOVL/MOVH. MOVUPS is more efficient than MOVLPS/MOVHPS. MOVUPD is more efficient than MOVLPD/MOVHPD.

field.name: FP128
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 128-bit SSE (multimedia) instructions are executed with full-width internal operations and pipelines rather than decomposing them into internal 64-bit suboperations.

register.name: IbsIdEax
register.desc: Instruction Based Sampling Identifiers. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_03FFh. This function returns IBS feature information.

field.name: IbsOpData4
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. IBS op data 4 MSR supported.

field.name: IbsFetchCtlExtd
field.desc: IBS fetch control extended MSR supported. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::IC_IBS_EXTD_CTL.

field.name: OpBrnFuse
field.desc: fused branch op indication supported. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::IBS_OP_DATA[IbsOpBrnFuse].

field.name: RipInvalidChk
field.desc: invalid RIP indication supported. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::IBS_OP_DATA[IbsRipInvalid].

field.name: OpCntExt
field.desc: IbsOpCurCnt and IbsOpMaxCnt extend by 7 bits. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicates support for Core::X86::Msr::IBS_OP_CTL[IbsOpCurCnt[26:20],IbsOpMaxCnt[26:20]].

field.name: BrnTrgt
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Branch target address reporting supported.

field.name: OpCnt
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Op counting mode supported.

field.name: RdWrOpCnt
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Read/Write of op counter supported.

field.name: OpSam
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. IBS execution sampling supported.

field.name: FetchSam
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. IBS fetch sampling supported.

field.name: IBSFFV
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. IBS feature flags valid.

register.name: CachePropEax0
register.desc: Cache Properties (DC). Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0 reports topology information for the DC.

field.name: NumSharingCache
field.desc: number of logical processors sharing cache. Read-only. Reset: XXXh. The number of logical processors sharing this cache is NumSharingCache + 1.

field.name: FullyAssociative
field.desc: fully associative cache. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 1=Cache is fully associative.

field.name: SelfInitialization
field.desc: cache is self-initializing. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Cache is self initializing; cache does not need software initialization.

field.name: CacheLevel
field.desc: cache level. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. Identifies the cache level.

field.name: CacheType
field.desc: cache type. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01h. Identifies the type of cache.

register.name: CachePropEax1
register.desc: Cache Properties (IC). Read-only. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax1 reports topology information for the IC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: NumSharingCache
field.desc: number of logical processors sharing cache. Read-only. Reset: XXXh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[NumSharingCache].

field.name: FullyAssociative
field.desc: fully associative cache. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[FullyAssociative].

field.name: SelfInitialization
field.desc: cache is self-initializing. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[SelfInitialization].

field.name: CacheLevel
field.desc: cache level. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. Identifies the cache level. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheLevel].

field.name: CacheType
field.desc: cache type. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,02h. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheType].

register.name: CachePropEax2
register.desc: Cache Properties (L2). Read-only. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax2 reports topology information for the L2. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: NumSharingCache
field.desc: number of logical processors sharing cache. Read-only. Reset: XXXh. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[NumSharingCache].

field.name: FullyAssociative
field.desc: fully associative cache. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[FullyAssociative].

field.name: SelfInitialization
field.desc: cache is self-initializing. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[SelfInitialization].

field.name: CacheLevel
field.desc: cache level. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,2h. Identifies the cache level. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheLevel].

field.name: CacheType
field.desc: cache type. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03h. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheType].

register.name: CachePropEax3
register.desc: Cache Properties (L3). Read-only. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax3 reports topology information for the L3.

field.name: NumSharingCache
field.desc: number of logical processors sharing cache. Read-only. Reset: XXXh. The number of logical processors sharing this cache is NumSharingCache + 1.

field.name: FullyAssociative
field.desc: fully associative cache. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[FullyAssociative].

field.name: SelfInitialization
field.desc: cache is self-initializing. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[SelfInitialization].

field.name: CacheLevel
field.desc: cache level. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,3h. Identifies the cache level. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheLevel].

field.name: CacheType
field.desc: cache type. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03h. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheType].

register.name: CachePropEax4
register.desc: Cache Properties Null. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax4 reports done/null. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheType
field.desc: cache type. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0[CacheType].

register.name: CachePropEbx0
register.desc: Cache Properties (DC). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01C0_003Fh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0 reports topology information for the DC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumWays
field.desc: cache number of ways. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,007h. Cache number of ways is CacheNumWays + 1.

field.name: CachePhysPartitions
field.desc: cache physical line partitions. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,000h. Cache partitions is CachePhysPartitions + 1.

field.name: CacheLineSize
field.desc: cache line size in bytes. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03Fh. Cache line size in bytes is CacheLineSize + 1.

register.name: CachePropEbx1
register.desc: Cache Properties (IC). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00C0_003Fh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx1 reports topology information for the IC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumWays
field.desc: cache number of ways. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,003h. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CacheNumWays].

field.name: CachePhysPartitions
field.desc: cache physical line partitions. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,000h. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CachePhysPartitions].

field.name: CacheLineSize
field.desc: cache line size in bytes. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03Fh. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CacheLineSize].

register.name: CachePropEbx2
register.desc: Cache Properties (L2). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01C0_003Fh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx2 reports topology information for the L2. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumWays
field.desc: cache number of ways. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,007h. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CacheNumWays].

field.name: CachePhysPartitions
field.desc: cache physical line partitions. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,000h. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CachePhysPartitions].

field.name: CacheLineSize
field.desc: cache line size in bytes. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03Fh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CacheLineSize].

register.name: CachePropEbx3
register.desc: Cache Properties (L3). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03C0_003Fh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx3 reports topology information for the L3. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumWays
field.desc: cache number of ways. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00Fh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CacheNumWays].

field.name: CachePhysPartitions
field.desc: cache physical line partitions. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,000h. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CachePhysPartitions].

field.name: CacheLineSize
field.desc: cache line size in bytes. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,03Fh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEbx0[CacheLineSize].

register.name: CachePropEbx4
register.desc: Cache Properties Null. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax4 reports done/null. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

register.name: CachePropEcx0
register.desc: Cache Properties (DC). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_003Fh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx0 reports topology information for the DC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumSets
field.desc: cache number of sets. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_003Fh. Cache number of sets is CacheNumSets + 1.

register.name: CachePropEcx1
register.desc: Cache Properties (IC). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_00FFh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx1 reports topology information for the IC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumSets
field.desc: cache number of sets. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_00FFh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx0[CacheNumSets].

register.name: CachePropEcx2
register.desc: Cache Properties (L2). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_03FFh. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx2 reports topology information for the L2. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumSets
field.desc: cache number of sets. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_03FFh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx0[CacheNumSets].

register.name: CachePropEcx3
register.desc: Cache Properties (L3). Read-only. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx3 reports topology information for the L3.

field.name: CacheNumSets
field.desc: cache number of sets. Read-only. Reset: 0000_XXXXh. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEcx0[CacheNumSets].

register.name: CachePropEcx4
register.desc: Cache Properties Null. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax3 reports done/null. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheNumSets
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Cache number of sets.

register.name: CachePropEdx0
register.desc: Cache Properties (DC). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx0 reports topology information for the DC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheInclusive
field.desc: cache inclusive. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Cache is not inclusive of lower cache levels. 1=Cache is inclusive of lower cache levels.

field.name: WBINVD
field.desc: Write-Back Invalidate/Invalidate. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=WBINVD/INVD invalidates all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache. 1=WBINVD/INVD not ensured to invalidate all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache.

register.name: CachePropEdx1
register.desc: Cache Properties (IC). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx1 reports topology information for the IC. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheInclusive
field.desc: cache inclusive. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx0[CacheInclusive].

field.name: WBINVD
field.desc: Write-Back Invalidate/Invalidate. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=WBINVD/INVD invalidates all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache. 1=WBINVD/INVD may not invalidate all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx0[WBINVD].

register.name: CachePropEdx2
register.desc: Cache Properties (L2). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0002h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx2 reports topology information for the L2. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheInclusive
field.desc: cache inclusive. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx0[CacheInclusive].

field.name: WBINVD
field.desc: Write-Back Invalidate/Invalidate. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=WBINVD/INVD invalidates all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache. 1=WBINVD/INVD may not invalidate all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache.

register.name: CachePropEdx3
register.desc: Cache Properties (L3). Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0001h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx3 reports reports topology information for the L3. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

field.name: CacheInclusive
field.desc: cache inclusive. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEdx0[CacheInclusive].

field.name: WBINVD
field.desc: Write-Back Invalidate/Invalidate. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 0=WBINVD/INVD invalidates all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache. 1=WBINVD/INVD may not invalidate all lower level caches of non-originating cores sharing this cache.

register.name: CachePropEdx4
register.desc: Cache Properties Null. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_0000h. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax3 reports done/null. See Core::X86::Cpuid::CachePropEax0.

register.name: ExtApicId
register.desc: Extended APIC ID. Read-only. Enable: (Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions] && Core::X86::Msr::APIC_BAR[ApicEn]). If Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions] == 0 then CPUID Fn8000001E_E[D,C,B,A]X are Reserved. If (Core::X86::Msr::APIC_BAR[ApicEn] == 0) then Core::X86::Cpuid::ExtApicId[ExtendedApicId] is Reserved.

field.name: ExtendedApicId
field.desc: extended APIC ID. Read-only. See 2.1.11.2.1.3 [ApicId Enumeration Requirements]. Reset: Core::X86::Msr::APIC_BAR[ApicEn] ? Fixed,{00_0000h , Core::X86::Apic::ApicId[ApicId]} : Fixed,0000_0000h.

register.name: CoreId
register.desc: Core Identifiers. Read-only. Enable: Core::X86::Cpuid::FeatureExtIdEcx[TopologyExtensions]. See Core::X86::Cpuid::ExtApicId.

field.name: ThreadsPerCore
field.desc: threads per core. Read-only. Reset: XXh. The number of threads per core is ThreadsPerCore + 1.

field.name: CoreId
field.desc: core ID. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,XXh.

field.name: NodesPerProcessor
field.desc: Node per processor. Read-only. Reset: XXXb.

field.name: NodeId
field.desc: Node ID. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,XXh.

register.name: SecureEncryptionEax
register.desc: AMD Secure Encryption EAX. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0000_000Fh.

field.name: SevEs
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Secure Encrypted ES.

field.name: VmPgFlush
field.desc: VM Page Flush MSR is supported. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. See Core::X86::Msr::VMPAGE_FLUSH.

field.name: SEV
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Secure Encrypted Virtualization supported.

field.name: SME
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Secure Memory Encryption supported.

field.name: MemEncryptPhysAddWidth
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 000XXXb. Reduction of physical address space in bits when memory encryption is enabled (0 indicates no reduction).

field.name: CBit
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 2Fh. Page table bit number used to enable memory encryption.

register.name: SecureEncryptionEcx
register.desc: AMD Secure Encryption ECX. Read-only. Reset: 0000_000Fh.

field.name: NumEncryptedGuests
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000_000Fh. Indicates the maximum ASID value that may be used for an SEV-enabled guest.

field.name: MinimumSEVASID
field.desc: Minimum SEV enabled, SEV-ES disabled ASID. Read-only. Reset: 0000_000Xh. Indicates the minimum ASID value that must be used for an SEV-enabled, SEV-ES-disabled guest.

register.name: TSC
register.desc: Time Stamp Counter. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. The TSC uses a common reference for all sockets, cores and threads.

field.name: TSC
field.desc: time stamp counter. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. The TSC increments at the P0 frequency. The TSC counts at the same rate in all P-states, all C states, S0, or S1. A read of this MSR in guest mode is affected by Core::X86::Msr::TscRateMsr. The value (TSC/TSCRatio) is the TSC P0 frequency based value (as if TSCRatio == 1.0) when (TSCRatio != 1.0).

field.name: ApicBar[47:12]
field.desc: APIC base address register. Read-write. Reset: 0_000F_EE00h. Specifies the base address, physical address [47:12], for the APICXX register set in xAPIC mode. See 2.1.11.2.1.2 [APIC Register Space].

field.name: ApicEn
field.desc: APIC enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable Local Apic. 1=Local APIC is enabled in xAPIC mode. See 2.1.11.2.1.2 [APIC Register Space].

field.name: BSC
field.desc: boot strap core. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: X. 0=The core is not the boot core of the BSP. 1=The core is the boot core of the BSP.

register.name: EBL_CR_POWERON
register.desc: Cluster ID. Writes to this register result in a GP fault with error code 0.

field.name: ClusterID
field.desc: Read,Error-on-write. Reset: 0h. The field does not affect hardware.

field.name: PatchLevel
field.desc: Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. This returns an identification number for the microcode patch that has been loaded. If no patch has been loaded, this returns 0.

register.name: MPERF
register.desc: Max Performance Frequency Clock Count. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h.

field.name: MPERF
field.desc: maximum core clocks counter. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. Incremented by hardware at the P0 frequency while the core is in C0. This register does not increment when the core is in the stop-grant state. In combination with Core::X86::Msr::APERF, this is used to determine the effective frequency of the core. A Read of this MSR in guest mode is affected by Core::X86::Msr::TscRateMsr. This field uses software P-state numbering. See Core::X86::Msr::HWCR[EffFreqCntMwait], 2.1.4 [Effective Frequency].

register.name: APERF
register.desc: Actual Performance Frequency Clock Count. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h.

field.name: APERF
field.desc: actual core clocks counter. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. This register increments in proportion to the actual number of core clocks cycles while the core is in C0. The register does not increment when the core is in the stop-grant state. See Core::X86::Msr::MPERF.

field.name: MtrrCapWc
field.desc: write-combining memory type. Read,Error-on-write. Reset: 1. 1=The write combining memory type is supported.

field.name: MtrrCapFix
field.desc: fixed range register. Read,Error-on-write. Reset: 1. 1=Fixed MTRRs are supported.

field.name: MtrrCapVCnt
field.desc: variable range registers count. Read,Error-on-write. Reset: 08h. Specifies the number of variable MTRRs supported.

field.name: SysEnterCS
field.desc: SYSENTER target CS. Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Holds the called procedure code segment.

field.name: SysEnterESP
field.desc: SYSENTER target SP. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Holds the called procedure stack pointer.

field.name: SysEnterEIP
field.desc: SYSENTER target IP. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Holds the called procedure instruction pointer.

field.name: McgCtlP
field.desc: MCG_CTL register present. Read-only,Error-on-write. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=The machine check control registers (MCi_CTL) are present. See 3.1 [Machine Check Architecture].

field.name: Count
field.desc: Read-only,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: XXh. Indicates the number of error reporting banks visible to each core.

register.name: MCG_STAT
register.desc: Global Machine Check Status. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. See 3.1 [Machine Check Architecture].

field.name: MCIP
field.desc: machine check in progress. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0. 1=A machine check is in progress. Machine check progress.

field.name: EIPV
field.desc: error instruction pointer valid. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0. 1=The instruction pointer that was pushed onto the stack by the machine check mechanism references the instruction that caused the machine check error.

field.name: RIPV
field.desc: restart instruction pointer valid. Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0. 0=The interrupt was not precise and/or the process (task) context may be corrupt; continued operation of this process may not be possible without intervention, however system processing or other processes may be able to continue with appropriate software clean up. 1=Program execution can be reliably restarted at the EIP address on the stack.

register.name: MCG_CTL
register.desc: Global Machine Check Exception Reporting Control. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. This register controls enablement of the individual error reporting banks; see 3.1 [Machine Check Architecture]. When a machine check register bank is not enabled in MCG_CTL, errors for that bank are not logged or reported, and actions enabled through the MCA are not taken; each MCi_CTL register identifies which errors are still corrected when MCG_CTL[i] is disabled.

field.name: MCnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. 1=The MC0 machine check register bank is enabled.

field.name: PB
field.desc: performance monitor pin control. Read-write. Reset: 0h. This field does not control any hardware.

field.name: BTF
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable branch single step.

field.name: LBR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable last branch record.

register.name: BR_FROM
register.desc: Last Branch From IP. Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h.

field.name: LastBranchFromIP
field.desc: Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. Loaded with the segment offset of the branch instruction.

register.name: BR_TO
register.desc: Last Branch To IP. Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h.

field.name: LastBranchToIP
field.desc: Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. Holds the target RIP of the last branch that occurred before an exception or interrupt.

register.name: LastExcpFromIp
register.desc: Last Exception From IP. Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h.

field.name: LastIntFromIP
field.desc: Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. Holds the source RIP of the last branch that occurred before the exception or interrupt.

register.name: LastExcpToIp
register.desc: Last Exception To IP. Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h.

field.name: LastIntToIP
field.desc: Read,Error-on-write,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000_0000_0000h. Holds the target RIP of the last branch that occurred before the exception or interrupt.

register.name: MtrrVarBase
register.desc: Variable-Size MTRRs Base. Each MTRR (Core::X86::Msr::MtrrVarBase, Core::X86::Msr::MtrrFix_64K through Core::X86::Msr::MtrrFix_4K_7, or Core::X86::Msr::MTRRdefType) specifies a physical address range and a corresponding memory type (MemType) associated with that range. Setting the memory type to an unsupported value results in a #GP. The variable-size MTRRs come in pairs of base and mask registers (MSR0000_0200 and MSR0000_0201 are the first pair, etc.). Variables MTRRs are enabled through Core::X86::Msr::MTRRdefType[MtrrDefTypeEn]. A core access--with address CPUAddr--is determined to be within the address range of a variable-size MTRR if the following equation is true: CPUAddr[47:12] & PhyMask[47:12] == PhyBase[47:12] & PhyMask[47:12]. For example, if the variable MTRR spans 256 KB and starts at the 1-MB address the PhyBase would be set to 0_0010_0000h and the PhyMask to F_FFFC_0000h (with zeros filling in for bits[11:0]). This results in a range from 0_0010_0000h to 0_0013_FFFFh.

field.name: PhyBase
field.desc: base address. Read-write. Reset: X_XXXX_XXXXh.

field.name: MemType
field.desc: memory type. Read-write. Reset: XXXb. Address range from 00000h to 0FFFFh.

field.name: PhyMask
field.desc: address mask. Read-write. Reset: X_XXXX_XXXXh.

field.name: Valid
field.desc: valid. Read-write. Reset: X. 1=The variable-size MTRR pair is enabled.

register.name: MtrrFix_64K
register.desc: Fixed-Size MTRRs. See Core::X86::Msr::MtrrVarBase for general MTRR information. Fixed MTRRs are enabled through Core::X86::Msr::MTRRdefType[MtrrDefTypeFixEn,MtrrDefTypeEn]. For addresses below 1-MB, the appropriate Fixed MTRRs override the default access destination. Each fixed MTRR includes two bits, RdDram and WrDram, that determine the destination based on the access type. Writing Reserved MemType values causes an Error-on-write.

field.name: RdDram_64K_70000
field.desc: Read DRAM. 0=Read accesses to the range are marked as MMIO. 1=Read accesses to the range are marked as destined for DRAM. AccessType: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? Read-write : Read,Error-on-write-1. Reset: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? X : Fixed,0.

field.name: WrDram_64K_70000
field.desc: Write DRAM. 0=Write accesses to the range are marked as MMIO. 1=Write accesses to the range are marked as destined for DRAM. AccessType: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? Read-write : Read,Error-on-write-1. Reset: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? X : Fixed,0.

field.name: MemType_64K_70000
field.desc: memory type. Read-write. Reset: XXXb.

field.desc: Read DRAM. 0=Read accesses to the range are marked as MMIO. 1=Read accesses to the range are marked as destined for DRAM. AccessType: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? Read-write : Read,Error-on-write-1. Reset: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? X : Fixed,0.

Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramEn,MtrrFixDramModEn] masks Reads of the stored value. AccessType: Core::X86::Msr::SYS_CFG[MtrrFixDramModEn] ? Read-write : Read,Error-on-write-1. register.name: MtrrFix_4K_6

For addresses below 1-MB, the appropriate Fixed MTRRs override the default access destination. Each fixed MTRR includes two bits, RdDram and WrDram, that determine the destination based on the access type. Writing Reserved MemType values causes an Error-on-write.
