field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No GA entry Written to the GA log by the IOMMU. 1=GA request entry Written to the GA log by the IOMMU. An interrupt is generated when GA_INT == 1 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[GA_INT_EN] == 1. Cleared on Writing to 1.

field.name: GA_OVERFLOW
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=No GA log overflow has occurred.IOMMU GA log overflow has occurred.

field.name: GA_RUN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=GA requests are discarded without logging. 1=GA requests are logged as they occur. When GA_OVERFLOW == 1, the IOMMU does not Write new GA log entries even when GA_RUN == 1. When halted, GA request logging is restarted by using IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[GA_LOG_EN].

field.name: PPR_RUN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=PPR requests are discarded without logging. 1=PPR requests are logged as they occur. When PPR_OVERFLOW == 1, the IOMMU does not Write new PPR log entries even when PPR_RUN == 1. When halted, PPR request logging is restarted by using IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[PPR_LOG_EN].

field.name: PPR_INT
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=No PPR entry Written to the PPR log by the IOMMU. 1=PPR request entry Written to the PPR log by the IOMMU.. An interrupt is generated when PPR_INT == 1 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[PPR_INT_EN] == 1. Cleared on Writing to 1.

field.name: PPR_OVERFLOW
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=No PPR log overflow has occurred. 1=IOMMU PPR log overflow has occurred. This bit is set when a new peripheral page service request is to be Written to the PPR log and there is no usable entry in the PPR log, causing the new information to be discarded. An interrupt is generated when PPR_OVERFLOW == 1 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[PPR_INT_EN] == 1. No new PPR log entries are Written while this bit is set. Cleared on Writing to 1.

field.name: CMD_BUFRUN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=IOMMU has stopped fetching new commands. 1=Commands may be fetched from the command buffer. The IOMMU freezes command processing after COMMAND_HARDWARE_ERROR or ILLEGAL_COMMAND_ERROR errors. When frozen, command fetching is restarted by using IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[CMD_BUF_EN].

field.name: EVENT_LOGRUN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Event reports are discarded without logging. 1=Events are logged as they occur. When EVENT_OVERFLOW == 1, the IOMMU does not Write new event log entries even when EVENT_LOGRUN == 1. When halted, event logging is restarted by using IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[EVENT_LOG_EN].

field.name: COMWAIT_INT
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=COMPLETION_WAIT command not run or not completed. 1=1=COMPLETION_WAIT command completed. This bit is only set if the [i] bit is set in the COMPLETION_WAIT command. An interrupt is generated when COMWAIT_INT == 1 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[COM_WAIT_INTEN] == 1. Cleared on Writing to 1.

field.name: EVENT_LOGINT
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=No event entry Written to the event log by the IOMMU. 1=Event entry Written to the event log by the IOMMU. An interrupt is generated when EVENT_LOGINT == 1 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[EVENT_INT_EN] == 1. Cleared on Writing to 1.

field.name: EVENT_OVERFLOW
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=No IOMMU event log overflow has occurred. 1=IOMMU event log overflow has occurred. This bit is set when a new event is to be Written to the event log and there is no usable entry in the event log, causing the new event information to be discarded. An interrupt is generated when EVENT_OVERFLOW == 1 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_CNTRL_0[EVENT_INT_EN] == 1. No new event log entries are Written while this bit is set. Cleared on Writing to 1.

field.name: PPR_HDPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the PPR log base address register that is Read next by software. Software must increment this field, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Reading a PPR request entry from the PPR event log. If software advances the head pointer beyond the tail pointer, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If software sets the PPR log head pointer to an offset beyond the length of the PPR log, the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: PPR_TAILPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the PPR log base address register that is Written next by the IOMMU when a PPR request is detected. The IOMMU increments this register, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Writing a PPR request to the PPR log. If this register is Written while IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_STATUS_0[PPR_RUN] == 1, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If software sets the PPR log tail pointer to an offset beyond the length of the PPR log, defined by iIOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PPR_BASE_1[PPR_LEN], the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: GA_HDPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the GA log base address register that is Read next by software. Software must increment this field, rolling over at the end of the buffer, after Reading a GA request entry from the GA event log. If software advances the head pointer beyond the tail pointer, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If software sets the GA log head pointer to an offset beyond the length of the GA log, the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: GA_TAILPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Guest virtual APIC log tail pointer. Specifies the 8-byte aligned offset from IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_GA_LOG_BASE_0 that is Written next by the IOMMU when an undelivered virtual interrup request needs to be entered into the log. The IOMMU increments this register, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Writing an entry into the log.

field.name: PPR_B_HDPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the PPR log base address register that is Read next by software. Software must increment this field, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Reading a PPR request entry from the PPR event log. If software advances the head pointer beyond the tail pointer, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If software sets the PPR log head pointer to an offset beyond the length of the PPR log, the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: PPR_B_TAILPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the PPR log base address register that is Written next by the IOMMU when a PPR request is detected. The IOMMU increments this register, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Writing a PPR request to the PPR log. If this register is Written while IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_STATUS_0[PPR_RUN] == 1, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If software sets the PPR log tail pointer to an offset beyond the length of the PPR log, defined by IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PPR_BASE_1[PPR_LEN], the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: EVENT_B_HDPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the event log B base address register that is Read next by software. Software must increment this field, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Reading an event from the event log. If software advances the head pointer beyond the tail pointer, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If software sets the event log head pointer to an offset beyond the length of the event log, the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: EVENT_B_TAILPTR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the 128-bit aligned offset from the event log B base address register that is Written next by the IOMMU when an event is detected. The IOMMU increments this register, rolling over at the end of the buffer and after Writing an event to the event log. If this register is Written while IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_STATUS_0[EVENT_LOGRUN] == 1, the IOMMU behavior is undefined. If this register is set by software to a value outside the length specified by IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_EVENT_BASE_1[EVENT_LEN], the IOMMU behavior is undefined.

field.name: PPR_Auto_resp_mask_gn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No Mask. 1=1=Mask GN bit and PASID to 0. Mask GN bit and PASID to 0 for Auto Response, or else return fields from PPR request.

field.name: PPR_Auto_resp_code
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Programable PPR code for Auto Response. 0=SUCCESSFUL on Default.

field.name: PPR_Overflow_early_en
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Enable PPR early overflow mechanism in hardware.

field.name: PPR_Overflow_early_int_en
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Enable PPR early overflow interrupt.

field.name: PPR_Overflow_early_threshold
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Number of entries prior to overflow that hardware should signal early overflow.

field.name: PPR_B_Overflow_early_en
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Enable PPR early overflow mechanism in hardware.

field.name: PPR_B_Overflow_early_int_en
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Enable PPR early overflow interrupt.

field.name: PPR_B_Overflow_early_threshold
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Number of entries prior to overflow that hardware should signal early overflow.

field.name: N_COUNTER_BANKS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,02h. Description: The number of counter banks supported by the IOMMU. Each bank contains two or more counter and control registers as specified by NCounter. For each counter bank, a corresponding control bit is in IOMMU Counter PASID Bank-Lock Register IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_PASID_BANK_LOCK_0, IOMMU Counter Domain Bank-Lock Register IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_DOMAIN_BANK_LOCK_0 and IOMMU Counter DeviceID Bank-Lock Register IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_DEVID_BANK_LOCK_0. Each supported event counter bank is in a distinct, consecutive 4K-byte page. NOTE: IOMMU event counter banks are numbered starting with 0.

field.name: N_COUNTER
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,4h. Description: Reports the number of individual counters in each IOMMU counter bank. Each counter bank contains the same number of counters. 0=No counters supported. 1=Reserved 2-15=number of counters in each counter bank.

field.name: PASID_LOCK_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Description: PASID lock enable. For each bit in PASID_LOCK_LO, the corresponding PASID-match registers in an IOMMU counter bank may be changed. See IOMMU PASID Match Registers - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_1. Bit positions above the value reported in IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS] are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with zero (See IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS]), are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with zero; PASID_LOCK_LO[0] controls bank 0, etc.

field.name: PASID_LOCK_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Description: PASID lock enable. For each bit in PASID_LOCK_HI, the corresponding PASID-match registers in an IOMMU counter bank may be changed. See IOMMU PASID Match Registers - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_PASID_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_1. Bit positions above the value reported in IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS] are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with 32 (See IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS]), are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with 32; PASID_LOCK_HI[0] controls bank 32, etc.

field.name: DOMAIN_LOCK_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Description: Domain lock enable. For each bit in DOMAIN_LOCK_LO, the corresponding Domain-match registers in an IOMMU counter bank may be changed. See IOMMU Domain Match Registers - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_1. Bit positions above the value reported in IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS] are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with zero (See IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS]), are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with zero; DOMAIN_LOCK_LO[0] controls bank 0, etc.

field.name: DOMAIN_LOCK_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Description: Domain lock enable. For each bit in DOMAIN_LOCK_HI, the corresponding Domain-match registers in an IOMMU counter bank may be changed. See IOMMU Domain Match Registers - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_1. Bit positions above the value reported in IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS] are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with 32 (See IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS]), are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with 32; DOMAIN_LOCK_HI[0] controls bank 32, etc.

field.name: DEVID_LOCK_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Description: DeviceID lock enable. For each bit in DEVID_LOCK_LO, the corresponding DeviceID-match registers in an IOMMU counter bank may be changed. See IOMMU DeviceID Match Registers - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_1. Bit positions above the value reported in IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS] are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with zero (See IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS]), are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with zero; DEVID_LOCK_LO[0] controls bank 0, etc.

field.name: DEVID_LOCK_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Description: DeviceID lock enable. For each bit in DEVID_LOCK_HI, the corresponding DeviceID-match registers in an IOMMU counter bank may be changed. See IOMMU DeviceID Match Registers - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_0_CNT_3_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_0_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_1_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_2_1, - IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_0 and IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_DOMAIN_MATCH_BANK_1_CNT_3_1. Bit positions above the value reported in IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS] are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with 32 (See IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_CONFIG_0[N_COUNTER_BANKS]), are ignored when Written and return zero when Read. The counter banks are numbered starting with 32; DEVID_LOCK_HI[0] controls bank 32, etc.

field.name: ICOUNTER_0_0_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Reports the counter value (bits[31:0]). The counter counts up continuously, wrapping at the maximum value. There is no overflow indicator.

field.name: ICOUNTER_0_0_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Reports the counter value (bits[47:32]). The counter counts up continuously, wrapping at the maximum value. There is no overflow indicator. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_BANK_0_CNT_0_0.

field.name: CAC_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Architectural counter input group. 1=Custom input group. Counter source architectural or custom.

field.name: COUNT_UNITS_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Counter counts events (level). 1=Counter counts clocks (edges). Count Units.

field.name: CSOURCE_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Counter source. Selects event counter input from the choices provided.

field.name: PASMEN_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PASID is ignored. 1=Filtered PASID must match to count an event. PASID Match enable. An event with no PASID tag is only counted when PASMEN_0_0 == 0.

field.name: PASID_MATCH_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. PASID match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming PASID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if PASID_MATCH_0_0 is exactly equal to the masked incoming PASID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: PASID_MASK_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. PASID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the PASID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: DOMMEN_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Domain is ignored. 1=Filtered Domain must match to count an event. Domain Match enable.

field.name: DOMAIN_MATCH_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Domain Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming Domain of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DOMAIN_MATCH_0_0 is exactly equal to the masked incoming Domain. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DOMAIN_MASK_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Domain Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the Domain of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: DIDMEN_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=DeviceID is ignored. 1=Filtered DeviceID must match to count an event. DeviceID Match enable.

field.name: DEVICEID_MATCH_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DEVICEID_MATCH_0_0 is exactly equal to the masked incoming DeviceID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DEVICEID_MASK_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_0_0_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Event Note (bits[31:0]). When IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_0_CNT_0_1[CERE_0_0] == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_0_0[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. EVENT_NOTE_0_0[51:0] = {EVENT_NOTE_0_0_LO,IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_0_CNT_0_ 1[EVENT_NOTE_0_0_HI]}

field.name: CERE_0_0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No event report when counter wraps to zero. 1=IOMMU Writes an EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry when the counter wraps to zero. Description: Counter Event Report Enable. The counter-wrap event is treated like any other event. SOFTWARE NOTE: The counter-wrap event is delivered promptly but there is no defined latency expectation.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_0_0_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0_0000h. Event Note (bits[51:32]). When CERE_0_0 == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_0_0[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_0_CNT_0_0.

field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DEVICEID_MATCH_1_1 is exactly equal to the masked incoming DeviceID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DEVICEID_MASK_1_1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_1_1_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Event Note (bits[31:0]). When IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_1_1[CERE_1_1] == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_1_1[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. EVENT_NOTE_1_1[51:0] = {EVENT_NOTE_1_1_LO,IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_1_ 1[EVENT_NOTE_1_1_HI]}

field.name: CERE_1_1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No event report when counter wraps to zero. 1=IOMMU Writes an EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry when the counter wraps to zero. Description: Counter Event Report Enable. The counter-wrap event is treated like any other event. SOFTWARE NOTE: The counter-wrap event is delivered promptly but there is no defined latency expectation.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_1_1_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0_0000h. Event Note (bits[51:32]). When CERE_1_1 == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_1_1[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_1_0.

field.name: ICOUNTER_1_2_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Reports the counter value (bits[31:0]). The counter counts up continuously, wrapping at the maximum value. There is no overflow indicator.

field.name: ICOUNTER_1_2_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Reports the counter value (bits[47:32]). The counter counts up continuously, wrapping at the maximum value. There is no overflow indicator. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_BANK_1_CNT_2_0.

field.name: CAC_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Architectural counter input group. 1=Custom input group. Counter source architectural or custom.

field.name: COUNT_UNITS_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Counter counts events (level). 1=Counter counts clocks (edges). Count Units.

field.name: CSOURCE_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Counter source. Selects event counter input from the choices provided.

field.name: PASMEN_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PASID is ignored. 1=Filtered PASID must match to count an event. PASID Match enable. An event with no PASID tag is only counted when PASMEN_1_2 == 0.

field.name: PASID_MATCH_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. PASID match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming PASID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if PASID_MATCH_1_2 is exactly equal to the masked incoming PASID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: PASID_MASK_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. PASID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the PASID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: DOMMEN_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Domain is ignored. 1=Filtered Domain must match to count an event. Domain Match enable.

field.name: DOMAIN_MATCH_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Domain Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming Domain of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DOMAIN_MATCH_1_2 is exactly equal to the masked incoming Domain. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DOMAIN_MASK_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Domain Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the Domain of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: DIDMEN_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=DeviceID is ignored. 1=Filtered DeviceID must match to count an event. DeviceID Match enable.

field.name: DEVICEID_MATCH_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DEVICEID_MATCH_1_2 is exactly equal to the masked incoming DeviceID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DEVICEID_MASK_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_1_2_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Event Note (bits[31:0]). When IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_2_1[CERE_1_2] == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_1_2[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. EVENT_NOTE_1_2[51:0] = {EVENT_NOTE_1_2_LO,IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_2_ 1[EVENT_NOTE_1_2_HI]}

field.name: CERE_1_2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No event report when counter wraps to zero. 1=IOMMU Writes an EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry when the counter wraps to zero. Description: Counter Event Report Enable. The counter-wrap event is treated like any other event. SOFTWARE NOTE: The counter-wrap event is delivered promptly but there is no defined latency expectation.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_1_2_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0_0000h. Event Note (bits[51:32]). When CERE_1_2 == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_1_2[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_2_0.

field.name: ICOUNTER_1_3_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Reports the counter value (bits[31:0]). The counter counts up continuously, wrapping at the maximum value. There is no overflow indicator.

field.name: ICOUNTER_1_3_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Reports the counter value (bits[47:32]). The counter counts up continuously, wrapping at the maximum value. There is no overflow indicator. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_BANK_1_CNT_3_0.

field.name: CAC_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Architectural counter input group. 1=Custom input group. Counter source architectural or custom.

field.name: COUNT_UNITS_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Counter counts events (level). 1=Counter counts clocks (edges). Count Units.

field.name: CSOURCE_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Counter source. Selects event counter input from the choices provided.

field.name: PASMEN_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PASID is ignored. 1=Filtered PASID must match to count an event. PASID Match enable. An event with no PASID tag is only counted when PASMEN_1_3 == 0.

field.name: PASID_MATCH_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. PASID match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming PASID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if PASID_MATCH_1_3 is exactly equal to the masked incoming PASID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: PASID_MASK_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. PASID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the PASID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: DOMMEN_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Domain is ignored. 1=Filtered Domain must match to count an event. Domain Match enable.

field.name: DOMAIN_MATCH_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Domain Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming Domain of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DOMAIN_MATCH_1_3 is exactly equal to the masked incoming Domain. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DOMAIN_MASK_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Domain Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the Domain of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: DIDMEN_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=DeviceID is ignored. 1=Filtered DeviceID must match to count an event. DeviceID Match enable.

field.name: DEVICEID_MATCH_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Match. This value is compared with the masked (filtered) value of the incoming DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event. The event is counted if DEVICEID_MATCH_1_3 is exactly equal to the masked incoming DeviceID. The event is not counted if they are not equal.

field.name: DEVICEID_MASK_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DeviceID Mask. This bit-mask is ANDed with the DeviceID of the transaction to decide to count the corresponding event.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_1_3_LO
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Event Note (bits[31:0]). When IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_3_1[CERE_1_3] == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_1_3[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. EVENT_NOTE_1_3[51:0] = {EVENT_NOTE_1_3_LO,IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_3_ 1[EVENT_NOTE_1_3_HI]}

field.name: CERE_1_3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No event report when counter wraps to zero. 1=IOMMU Writes an EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry when the counter wraps to zero. Description: Counter Event Report Enable. The counter-wrap event is treated like any other event. SOFTWARE NOTE: The counter-wrap event is delivered promptly but there is no defined latency expectation.

field.name: EVENT_NOTE_1_3_HI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0_0000h. Event Note (bits[51:32]). When CERE_1_3 == 1 and the corresponding counter is incremented and wraps to zero, EVENT_NOTE_1_3[51:0] is reported in the EVENT_COUNTER_ZERO event log entry. See also IOMMUMMIO::IOMMU_MMIO_COUNTER_RPT_BANK_1_CNT_3_0.

field.name: DmaCh0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DMA1 channel 0 base and current address.

field.name: DmaCh1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DMA1 channel 1 base and current address.

field.name: DmaCh2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DMA1 channel 2 base and current address.

field.name: DmaCh3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. DMA1 channel 3 base and current address.

field.name: DmaStatus
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the DMA status register for channels[3:0] for reads and specifies the DMA control register for channels[3:0] for writes.

field.name: DmaWriteRequest
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Request register.

field.name: DmaWriteMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA channel mask register.

field.name: DmaWriteMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA mode register.

field.name: DmaClear
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Channel[3:0] DMA clear byte pointer.

field.name: DmaMasterClr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Write: Channel[3:0] master clear register. Read: Intermediate register.

field.name: DmaClrmask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Channel[3:0] DMA clear mask.

field.name: DmaAllMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. General mask register.

field.name: IntrCntrl1Reg1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IRQ[7:0] status and control. Read: IRR, ISR. Write: ICW1, OCW2, OCW3.

field.name: IntrCntrl1Reg2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IRQ[7:0] status and control. Read: IMR. Write: ICW2, ICW3, ICW4, OCW1.

field.name: ImcrIndex
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Index port for IMCR register. See FCH::IO::IMCRData.

field.name: ImcrData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Data port for IMCR register. The actual IMCR register is located at index 70h and it is at bit[0].

field.name: SmnIndex
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Index port for IMCR register. See FCH::IO::IMCRData.

field.name: SmnData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Data port for IMCR register. The actual IMCR register is located at index 70h and it is at bit[0].

field.name: TimerCh0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. 8254 Timer 1 Counter 0 Data Port.

field.name: TimerCh1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. 8254 Timer 1 Counter 1 Data Port.

field.name: TimerCh2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. 8254 Timer 1 Counter 2 Data Port.

register.name: Tmr1CntrlWord
register.desc: Tmr1CntrlWord. Write-only. Reset: 00h. This is the control register for 8254 timer 1. If a counter is programmed to read or write two-byte counts, the following precaution applies: Software must not transfer control between writing the first and second byte to another routine which also writes into that same counter; otherwise, the counter is be loaded with an incorrect value. The count must always be completely loaded with both bytes. Reads of this register always returns 0xFF.

field.name: CounterSelect
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0h.

field.name: CommandSelect
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0h.

field.name: ModeSelect
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0h.

field.name: CntDownSelect
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=Binary countdown. 1=BCD countdown.

field.name: ParityErrNmi
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. NMI is caused by parity error (either PERR# or SERR#).

field.name: IoChkNmi
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. NMI is triggered by serial IOCHK.

field.name: SpkrClk
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. The output of 8254 timer counter 2.

field.name: RefClk
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. The output of 8254 timer counter 1.

field.name: IoChkNmiEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable IoChk to NMI generation. 1=Disable IoChk to NMI generation.

field.name: ParityErrNmiEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable Parity Error to NMI generation (from SERR# or PERR#). 1=Disable Parity Error to NMI generation and clear bit[7].

field.name: SpkrTmrEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Speaker timer off. 1=Speaker timer on.

field.name: SpkrEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable counter 2. 1=Enable counter 2.

field.name: NmiMask
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=NMI enabled. 1=NMI masked.

field.name: RtcAddrPort
field.desc: RTC Address Port. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This is used with either the internal RTC or external RTC. This port specifies the index to access RTC time registers and the CMOS RAM space. FCH::IO::RTCA[DV0] should be programmed first to select bank when accessing the CMOS RAM space. See FCH::IO::RTCSeconds.

field.name: RtcDataPort
field.desc: RTC Data Port. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This is used with either the internal RTC or external RTC in conjunction with FCH::IO::RtcAddrPortNmiMask.

field.name: AlternatRTCAddrPort
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This is used with the internal RTC. This port allows the user to specify the full 8-bit address (instead of bank0/bank1 indexing) to access the 256 bytes of RTC RAM.

field.name: AlternatRTCDataPort
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This is used with the internal RTC in conjunction with FCH::IO::AltRTCAddrPort.

register.name: RTCSeconds
register.desc: RTC Seconds. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x00.

field.name: Seconds
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. The value range for this register is 00 through 59. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by the RTC logic once per second. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RtcSecAlarm
register.desc: RTC Seconds Alarm. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x01.

field.name: SecondsAlarm
field.desc: Seconds Alarm. Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), the Seconds Alarm register never matches FCH::IO::RTCSeconds. Else, if (bits[7:6] == 11b) the RTC Seconds Alarm register always matches RTC Seconds register and causes an RTC alarm event to be generated once per second. See FCH::IO::RTCC[AF]. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when power up first time.

register.name: RTCMinutes
register.desc: RTC Minutes. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x02.

field.name: Minutes
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. The value range for this register is 00 through 59. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by the RTC logic, once per second. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCMinutesAlarm
register.desc: RTC Minutes Alarm. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x03.

field.name: MinutesAlarm
field.desc: Minutes Alarm. Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), the RTC Minutes Alarm register never matches FCH::IO::RTCMinutes. Else, if (bits[7:6] == 11b), the RTC Minutes Alarm register always matches RTC Minutes register and causes an RTC alarm event to be generated once per minute. See FCH::IO::RTCC[AF]. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCHours
register.desc: RTC Hours. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x04.

field.name: Hours
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. The value range for this register is 00 through 23. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register can be set by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by the RTC logic once per second. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCHoursAlarm
register.desc: RTC Hours Alarm. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x05.

field.name: HoursAlarm
field.desc: Hours Alarm. Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), the RTC Hours Alarm register never matches FCH::IO::RTCHours. Else, if (bits[7:6] == 11b) the RTC Hours Alarm register always matches with the RTC Hours register and causes an RTC alarm event to be generated once per hour. See FCH::IO::RTCC[AF]. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCDayofWeek
register.desc: RTC Day of Week. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x06.

field.name: DayOfWeek
field.desc: Day of Week. Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. The value range for this register is 01 through 07 (Sunday = 1). Leap year correction is performed by software. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by hardware. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCDateofMonth
register.desc: RTC Date of Month. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x07.

field.name: DateOfMonth
field.desc: Date of Month. Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. The range is 01 through 31. Leap year correction is performed by software. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by hardware. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCMonth
register.desc: RTC Month. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x08.

field.name: Month
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. The range is 01 through 12. Leap year correction is performed by software. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by hardware. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCYear
register.desc: RTC Year. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x09.

field.name: Year
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. Range is 00 through 99. No leap year correction capability. Leap year correction must be done by software. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is updated by hardware. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCA
register.desc: RTC Register A. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x0A.

field.name: UIP
field.desc: Update In Progress. Read-only. Reset: X. 0=The update transfer does not occur for at least 244 us. 1=The update transfer occurs soon. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), UIP is cleared. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: DV0
field.desc: Bank Selection. Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Select bank 0 when accessing the RTC CMOS RAM space through FCH::IO::RtcAddrPortNmiMask and FCH::IO::RtcDataPort. 1=Select bank 1 when accessing the RTC CMOS RAM space through FCH::IO::RtcAddrPortNmiMask and FCH::IO::RtcDataPort. The FCH has an alternate way to access the RAM without the use of bank select bit. FCH::IO::AltRTCAddrPort and FCH::IO::AltRTCDataPort provides indexed access to the full 256 bytes of RAM. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: RS[3:0]
field.desc: Rate Selection. Read-write. Reset: Xh. These four rate selection bits select one of the 13 taps on the 15- stage frequency divider or disable the divider output (flat output signal). The tap selected can be used to generate a periodic interrupt. See the following table for the frequency selection. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCB
register.desc: RTC Register B. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x0B.

field.name: SET
field.desc: Set new time. Read-write. Reset: X. 0=The RTC time registers are updated every second. 1=No internal updating for RTC time registers occurs. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: PIE
field.desc: Periodic Interrupt Enable. Read-write. Reset: X. 1=Enable the FCH::IO::RTCC[PF] bit to assert the IRQ. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: AIE
field.desc: Alarm Interrupt Enable. Read-write. Reset: X. 1=Enable the FCH::IO::RTCC[AF] bit to assert the IRQ. When the alarm time is written in the appropriate hours, minutes, and seconds alarm registers, the alarm interrupt is initiated at the specified time each day if AIE == 1. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: UIE
field.desc: Update Ended Interrupt Enable. Read-write. Reset: X. 1=Enable the FCH::IO::RTCC[UF] bit to assert the IRQ. If [SET] == 1, UIE is cleared. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: HourMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=12 hour mode. 1=24 hour mode. The value of this register is undefined/non- deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: DaylightSavingEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. Init: BIOS,0. 1=RTC daylight saving is enabled. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCC
register.desc: RTC Register C. Read-only. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x0C.

field.name: IRQF
field.desc: Interrupt Request Flag. Read-only. Reset: X. 1=The IRQ# pin is driven low. IRQF=(PF*PIE)+ (AF*AIE)+(UF*UIE). Reading RTC Register C clears the IRQF bit. The value of this register is undefined/non- deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: PF
field.desc: Periodic Interrupt Flag. Read-only. Reset: X. 1=An edge is detected on the selected tap (through RS3 to RS0) of the frequency divider. Reading RTC Register C clears PF bit. The value of this register is undefined/non- deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: AF
field.desc: Alarm Interrupt Flag. Read-only. Reset: X. 1=FCH::IO::RTCSeconds, FCH::IO::RTCMinutes, FCH::IO::RTCHours and FCH::IO::RTCDateofMonth match FCH::IO::RtcSecAlarm, FCH::IO::RTCMinutesAlarm, FCH::IO::RTCHoursAlarm, and FCH::IO::RTCDateAlarm respectively. Reading RTC Register C clears AF bit. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: UF
field.desc: Update Ended Interrupt Flag. Read-only. Reset: X. 1=Update cycle complete. Reading RTC Register C clears UF. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCDateAlarm
register.desc: RTC Date Alarm. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x0D.

field.name: VRT
field.desc: Valid RAM and Time. Read-only. Reset: X. 0=RTC date, time, and CMOS RAM are invalid due to low RTC battery being monitored. 1=RTC date, time, and CMOS RAM are valid. See FCH::PM::VRT_T1 and FCH::PM::VRT_T2. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: ScratchBit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. Scratch bit.The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: DateAlarm
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXXXXb. If (DateAlarm != 0), then DateAlarm is considered for alarm generation. DateAlarm is in BCD format. 0=DateAlarm is not compared for alarm generation. 1=DateAlarm is compared for alarm generation. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCAltCentury
register.desc: RTC AltCentury. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x32.

field.name: AltCentury
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. Leap year correction is performed by hardware. This register is accessed only when (FCH::IO::RTCA[DV0] == 0) and (FCH::PM::RTCCtl[CenturyEn] == 1). If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is automatically updated by hardware every century. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCCentury
register.desc: RTC Century. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x48.

field.name: Century
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. BCD format. Leap year correction is done through hardware. This register is accessed only when (FCH::IO::RTCA[DV0] == 1). If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 1), this register is programmed by software and hardware updating is disabled. If (FCH::IO::RTCB[SET] == 0), this register is automatically updated by hardware every century. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCExtRAMAddrPort
register.desc: RTC Extended RAM Address Port. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x50.

field.name: ExtendedRamAddrPort
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXXXXXb. Because only 7 address bits are used in FCH::IO::RtcAddrPortNmiMask[RtcAddrPort], only the lower 128 bytes at offset 7Fh:00h are accessible through FCH::IO::RtcDataPort. Extended RAMs are physically located at addresses 80h to FFh. In order to access these addresses, an address offset should be programmed into this register and access to them is done through FCH::IO::RTCExtRAMDataPort. An offset of 80h is automatically added to this 7-bit address. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCExtRAMDataPort
register.desc: RTC Extended RAM Data Port. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x53.

field.name: ExtendedRamDataPort
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. Extended RAM data port. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCTimeClear
register.desc: RTC Time Clear. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x7E.

field.name: RtcTimeClear
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 1=Clear the RTC second and stop RTC time. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

register.name: RTCRAMEn
register.desc: RTC RAM Enable. Read-write. Precondition (data port): AltRTCAddrPort = x7F.

field.name: RtcRamEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 1=Enable access to the RTC RAM. The value of this register is undefined/non-deterministic when powered up for the first time.

field.name: PostCode[7:0]
field.desc: BIOS post code. Read-write. Reset: 00h. BIOS post code register. This can be 32 bits for Writes (using IOx008[3:1]) and 8 bits for Reads.

field.name: A20EnB
field.desc: A20 Enable Bar bit. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=A20M# function is disabled.

field.name: FastInit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Before another INIT pulse can be generated via this register, this bit must be written back to a 0. 1=Generate INIT assertion for approximately 4 ms. This bit provides a fast software executed processor reset function.

field.name: IntrCntrl2Reg1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IRQ[15:8] status and control. Read: IRR, ISR. Write: ICW1, OCW2, OCW3.

field.name: IntrCntrl2Reg2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IRQ[15:8] status and control. Read: IMR. Write: ICW2, ICW3, ICW4, OCW1.

field.name: Dma2Ch4Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[4] base and current address.

field.name: Dma2Ch4Cnt
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[4] base and current count.

field.name: Dma2Ch5Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[5] base and current address.

field.name: Dma2Ch5Cnt
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[5] base and current count.

field.name: Dma2Ch6Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[6] base and current address.

field.name: Dma2Ch6Cnt
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[6] base and current count.

field.name: Dma2Ch7Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[7] base and current address.

field.name: Dma2Ch7Cnt
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel[7] base and current count.

field.name: Dma2Status
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 status register.

field.name: Dma2WriteRequest
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 request register.

field.name: Dma2WriteMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 channel mask register.

field.name: Dma2WriteMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 mode register.

field.name: Dma2Clear
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Channel[7:4] clear byte pointer.

field.name: Dma2MasterClear
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Write: Channel[7:4] DMA master clear. Read: Intermediate register.

field.name: Dma2ClrMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Channel[7:4] DMA clear mask.

field.name: Dma2AllMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. DMA2 mask register.

register.name: NCPErr
register.desc: NCP Error. Read,Write-once. Reset: Cold,00h. Writes to this port assert IGNNE# if FERR# is TRUE. If FERR# is FALSE, writes to this port do not assert IGNNE#. The first write sets WarmBoot.

field.name: WarmBoot
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: Cold,0. 0=Cold. 1=Warm. Warm or cold boot indicator.

field.name: IRQ15Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ14Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ12Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ11Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ10Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ9Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ8Control
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Always edge.

field.name: IRQ7Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ6Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ5Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ4Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ3Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ1Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: IRQ0Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: PciIntrApic
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=IRQ routing to PIC. 1=IRQ routing to IOAPIC.

field.name: PciIntrIndex
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. PCI interrupt index. Selects which PCI interrupt to map.

field.name: PciIntrData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. PCI interrupt data.

register.name: PciIntMap
register.desc: PCI INT[H#,G#,F#,E#,D#,C#,B#,A#] Map. Read-write. Reset: 1Fh. Precondition (data port): PciIntrIndex = x00.

field.name: Pci2IntrMap
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1Fh. If (FCH::IO::PciIntrIndex[PciIntrApic] == 1), then Pci2IntrMap specifies mapping of INT[H#:A#] to APIC interrupt number. If (FCH::IO::PciIntrIndex[PciIntrApic] == 0), then Pci2IntrMap specifies mapping of INT[H#:A#] to PIC interrupt number.

register.name: IntrMiscMap
register.desc: Intr_Misc_Map. Read-write. Reset: 00h. Precondition (data port): PciIntrIndex = x08.

field.name: Pci2Intr15Map
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: Pci2Intr14Map
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: PciIntrIrq12
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=IMC as IRQ12 input source. 1=Serial IRQ or PCI devices as IRQ12 input source.

field.name: PciIntrIrq8
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=RTC is IRQ8 input source. 1=Serial IRQ or PCI devices as IRQ8 input source.

field.name: PciIntrIrq1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=IMC as IRQ1 input source. 1=Serial IRQ or PCI devices as IRQ1 input source.

field.name: PciIntrIrq0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=8254 timer as IRQ0 input source. 1=Serial IRQ or PCI devices as IRQ0 input source.

register.name: IntrMisc0Map
register.desc: Intr_Misc0Map. Read-write. Reset: E7h. Precondition (data port): PciIntrIndex = x09.

field.name: IntrDelay
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. INTR 600 ns delay.

field.name: IRQ12FilterEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. IRQ12 filter enable.

field.name: IRQ1FilterEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. IRQ1 filter enable.

field.name: IrqInputEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Mask off IRQ input. 1=Enable IRQ input.

field.name: MaskIrq1Irq12
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable IRQ1 and IRQ12. 1=Mask off IRQ1 and IRQ12.

field.name: Merge_Ec_irq12
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Route serial IRQ12 to USB IRQ12 input. 1=Route IMC IRQ12 to USB IRQ12 input.

field.name: Merge_Ec_irq1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Route serial IRQ1 to USB IRQ1 input. 1=Route IMC IRQ1 to USB IRQ1 input.

field.name: IntMap
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=INT0 in IOAPIC comes from IRQ0 in PIC, INT2 in IOAPIC comes from INTR in PIC. 1=INT2 in IOAPIC comes from IRQ0 in PIC, INT0 in IOAPIC comes from INTR in PIC.

register.name: IntrMisc1Map
register.desc: Intr_Misc1Map. Read-write. Reset: 00h. Precondition (data port): PciIntrIndex = x0A.

field.name: HPET
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. FCH::IO::IntrMisc1Map updates the lower 8 bits. FCH::IO::IntrMisc2Map updates the upper 8 bits.

register.name: IntrMisc2Map
register.desc: Intr_Misc2Map. Read-write. Reset: 00h. Precondition (data port): PciIntrIndex = x0B.

field.name: HPET
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. FCH::IO::IntrMisc1Map updates the lower 8 bits, FCH::IO::IntrMisc2Map updates the upper 8 bits.

register.name: PCIInterruptMap
register.desc: PCIInterruptMap. Read-write. Reset: 1Fh. Precondition (data port): PciIntrIndex = x0C.

field.name: Pci2IntrMap
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1Fh. If (FCH::IO::PciIntrIndex[PciIntrApic] == 1), then Pci2IntrMap specifies the APIC interrupt number that the corresponding PCI interrupt maps to. If (FCH::IO::PciIntrIndex[PciIntrApic] == 0), then Pci2IntrMap specifies the PIC interrupt number that the corresponding PCI interrupt maps to. See FCH::IO::PciIntrIndex for the PCI interrupt list.

field.name: PerrNmi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. Enable NMI generation from PERR#.

field.name: SerrNmi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. Enable NMI generation from SERR#.

field.name: PerrNmiStatus
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 1=NMI generation is enabled and PERR# is asserted due to a PCI data parity error. This bit is cleared by writing FCH::IO::NmiStat[2] = 1.

field.name: SerrNmiStatus
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 1=NMI generation is enabled and SERR# is asserted due to a PCI error. This bit is cleared by writing FCH::IO::NmiStat[2] = 1.

field.name: Pm2Index
field.desc: Power management 2 index register. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register specifies the index of the power management 2 register.

field.name: Pm2Data
field.desc: Power management 2 data register. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register specifies the data Read from/Written to the power management 2 register pointed by FCH::IO::PM2Index.

field.name: BiosRamIndex
field.desc: BIOS RAM index register. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register specifies the index in the 256- byte BIOS RAM. Data in this RAM is preserved until RSMRST# is asserted or S5 power is lost.

field.name: BiosRamData
field.desc: BIOS RAM data register. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register specifies the data Read from/Written to the BIOS RAM pointed by FCH::IO::BiosRAMIndex.

field.name: PmIndex
field.desc: Power management index register. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register specifies the index of the power management register. See 9.2.10.2 [Power Management (PM) Registers].

field.name: PmData
field.desc: Power management data register. Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register specifies the data Read from or Written to the power management register pointed by FCH::IO::PmIndex. See 9.2.1 [Legacy Block Configuration Registers (IO)].

register.name: SysReset
register.desc: System Reset Register. Reset: 00h. This register can be accessed through FCH::PM::CF9Shadow.

field.name: FullRst
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Assert reset signals only. 1=Place system in S5 state for 3 to 5 seconds.

field.name: RstCmd
field.desc: Read-write,Volatile. Reset: 0. 1=Generate reset as specified by FullRst and SysRst.

field.name: SysRst
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Send an INIT HT message. 1=Reset as specified by FullRst.

field.name: DEV_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 7813h. Device ID.

field.name: VEND_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1022h. Vendor ID.

field.name: Det_Perr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. This bit is set by the device whenever it detects a parity error, even if parity error handling is disabled (as controlled by bit[6] in the Command register).

field.name: Sig_SysErr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Set whenever the device asserts SERR#.

field.name: Rec_Mabort
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. This bit is set by a master device whenever its transaction (except for Special Cycle) is terminated with Master-Abort.

field.name: Rec_Tabort
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. This bit is set by a master device whenever its transaction is terminated with Target-Abort.

field.name: Sig_Tabort
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. This bit is set by a target device whenever it terminates a transaction with Target-Abort.

field.name: DEVSEL_Timing
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. Medium timing.

field.name: Master_DPerr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Master Data Parity Error.

field.name: Fast_B2B_Cap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow Fast Back-to-Back capability.

field.name: PCI_ST_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: En_66MHz
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Indicating 66MHz capable.

field.name: Cap_List
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Indicating no Capabilities Linked List available.

field.name: Int_status
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Reflects the state of the interrupt in the device/function.

field.name: PCI_ST_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: PCI_CMD_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Fixed,00h. Reserved.

field.name: Int_Dis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enables the assertion of the device/function's INTx# signal. 1=Disable. INTx# signal enable.

field.name: Fast_B2B_En
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Hard-wired to 0, indicating fast back-to-back transactions only to the same agent are allowed.

field.name: SERRB_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable the SERR# driver. 1=Enable the SERR# driver. SERR# driver enable.

field.name: PCI_CMD_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: Parity_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Parity check disabled. 1=Device must take action when a parity error is dected. Parity check enabled.

field.name: VGA_Pal_Access
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow snoop VGA palette cycles.

field.name: MemWr_Inv_Cmd
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow Memory Write and Invalidate command.

field.name: Special_Cycle
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Special cycle recognition enable.

field.name: Bus_Master
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow the device to behave as a bus master.

field.name: Mem_Space_Access
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Memory Space access enable.

field.name: IO_Space_Access
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. IO Space access enable.

field.name: BC
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 08h. Base Class Code. Hard-wired to 08h, indicating general peripheral.

field.name: SC
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 05h. Sub Class Code. Hard-wired to 05h, indicating SD Host controller.

field.name: PI
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 01h. Programming Interface Code. Hard-wired to 01h for Standard host supporting DMA.

field.name: Revision_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01h. Revision ID.

field.name: BIST
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Hard-wired to 00h, indicating no built-in BIST support.

field.name: Header_Type
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,80h. Bit[23] hard-wired to 1, indicating a single-function device. Bits[22:16] are hard-wired to 00h.

field.name: Latency_Timer
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Latency_Timer_HW (bits[10:8]) is hard-wired to 000b, resulting in a timer granularity of at least eight clocks. This field specifies, in units of PCI bus clocks, the value of the Latency Timer for this PCI bus master.

field.name: Latency_Timer_HW
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Specifies the value of the Latency Timer in units of PCICLKs.

field.name: Cache_Size
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This Read-write field specifies the system cacheline size in units of DWORDs and must be initialized to 00h.

field.name: BAR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00_0000h. Base Address. Specifies the 64-bit starting base address.

field.name: BAR_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: PM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Prefetch memory. A constant value of 0 indicates that there is no support for prefetchable memory.

field.name: TP1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1h. 2'b1 indicates that the base register is 64-bit width.

field.name: TP0
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Reserved.

field.name: IND
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Resource Type Indicator. A constant value of 0 indicates that the operational registers of the device are mapped into memory space of the main memory of the PC host system.

field.name: BAR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00_0000h. Base Address. Specifies the upper 15 bits of the 32-bit starting base address.

field.name: BAR_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: PM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Prefetch memory. A constant value of 0 indicates that there is no support for prefetchable memory.

field.name: TP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 2h. 10b indicates that the base register has a 64-bit width.

field.name: IND
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Resource Type Indicator. A constant value of 0 indicates that the operational registers of the device are mapped into memory space of the main memory of the PC host system.

field.name: UBAR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Upper 32 bits of the Base Address.

field.name: Sub_System_ID
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 7806h. Can only be written once by software.

field.name: Sub_Vendor_ID
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1022h. Can only be written once by software.

field.name: CAP_PTR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 80h. The first pointer of Capability block. Points to the FLR register.

field.name: MAX_LAT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Hardwired to 00h to indicate no major requirements for the settings of Latency Timers.

field.name: MIN_GNT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Hardwired to 00h to indicate no major requirements for the settings of Latency Timers.

field.name: Int_Pin
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 01h. Hard-wired to 01h, corresponding to using INTA#.

field.name: Int_Line
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. The Interrupt Line register used to communicate interrupt line routing information.

field.name: Slot_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: Num_Of_Slot
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Hardwired to 000h to indicate only 1 slot.

field.name: Slot_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: First_BAR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Hardwired to 000b to indicate BAR0 (Base address 10h).

field.name: CAP_NXT_PTR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 90h. Pointer to the next item in the capabilities list.

field.name: CAP_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 05h. 05h indicates MSI.

field.name: MSI_CTRL_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Reserved.

field.name: Extend_Addr_En
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 64-bit address capable.

field.name: Mul_Msg_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Multiple message enable.

field.name: Mul_Msg_Cap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Multiple message capable.

field.name: MSI_Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. MSI enable.

field.name: Msg_Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Message address.

field.name: MSI_ADDR_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: Msg_Upper_Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Message upper address. Msg_Addr={Msg_Upper_Addr,FCH::EMMC::EMMC_MSI_ADDR[Msg_Addr]}

field.name: Msg_Data
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Message data.

field.name: CAP_NXT_PTR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Pointer to the next item in the capabilities list.

field.name: CAP_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 01h. Power management.

field.name: PME_Support
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,10h. This 5-bit field indicates the power states in which the function may assert PME#. A value of 0 for any bits indicates that the function is not capable of asserting the PME# signal while in that power state.

field.name: D2_Support
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. D2 Power Management state.

field.name: D1_Support
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. D1 Power Management state.

field.name: Aux_Current
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. 3.3 Vaux auxiliary current requirements.

field.name: DSI
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Device specific initialization.

field.name: PMC_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: PME_Clock
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. If PME depends on PCI clock.

field.name: PMC_Version
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,3h. 011b indicates compliance with revision 1.2 of the PCI PM Interface specification.

field.name: PME_Status
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Set when the function normally asserts the PME# signal independent of the state of PME# Enable.

field.name: Data_Scale
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Indicates the scaling factor to be used when interpreting the value of the Data register. The value and meaning of this field varries depending on which data value has been selected by the DataSelect field.

field.name: Data_Select
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Selects which data is to be reported through the Data register and DataScale field.

field.name: PME_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PME# assertion is disabled. 1=Enable the function to assert PME#. PME# Enable.

field.name: PMCSR_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: No_Soft_Reset
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates that devices transitioning from D3hot to D0 because of power state commands do not perform an internal reset.

field.name: PMCSR_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: PowerState
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Initiates power state.

field.name: BPCC_En
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Bus Power/Clock Control enable.

field.name: B2_B3
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. B2/B3 support for D3hot.

field.name: PMC_BSE_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Reserved.

field.name: PMC_Data
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Reports the state dependent data requested by the DataSelect field. The value of this register is scaled by the value reported by the DataScale field.

field.name: I_PARAM_INCREMENT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 32h. Next step search value, when first search fails. Next jump step search value. Good value setting will reduce initial time when first lock searching. Typical value = start_point.

field.name: I_PARAM_START_POINT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 32h. Initial DLL search value. Good value setting decreases initial time when first lock searching. Assumes every delay cell == 0.1 ns. For 200MHz, set <VALUE> = 50 (32h). For 100MHz, set <VALUE> = 100 (64h).

field.name: I_DELAY
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 3Fh. DLL delay select. (I_BYPASS == 0) ? (This register is used to phase shift setting. 7Fh=Full cycle delay; 2Fh=1/4 cycle delay; 80h=Before one cycle; ...) : (This register is used to staticly delay the cell select.)

field.name: I_BYPASS
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=Enabled. DLL bypass. When enabled, the delay cell value is I_DELAY (bits[15:8]).

field.name: I_RESYNC
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Re-sync. DLL re-sync dll slave line.

field.name: SOFT_RESET
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Reset. DLL reset. Active is low.

field.name: DLL_ENABLE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. DLL enable. Default is off for saving power.

field.name: O_LOCK_VALUE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 2Fh. DLL lock value, which can be obtained by software to view the DLL state.

field.name: O_LOCK
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=DLL not locked. 1=DLL locked. DLL lock flag. When asserted, the DLL is locked, then software can do next things.

field.name: SYS_ADDR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. By updating this register, DMA_WAIT will be cleared. System Address. It indicates system memory address for DMA. When DMA transfer detects the DMA Buffer Boundary specified by the Host DMA Buffer Boundary in the Block Size register, SD controller asserts DMA_WAIT. Also SD controller generates DMA interrupt at this time in the case that corresponding bits in the Normal Interrupt Status Enable register and Normal Interrupt Signal Enable register are set. While ADMA is enabled, this regiseter will not be used.

field.name: BLK_CNT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Block Count. It indicates the block count of multiple data transfers. It is enabled when the Block Count Enable bit (D01) in the Transfer Mode Register is set to 1. It is decremented after each block data transmission. During infinite data transmission, setting of this bit is meaningless. Block Size and Block Count.

field.name: SDMA_BUF_BNDRY
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Host DMA Buffer Boundary. Indicates the contiguos buffer size in the system memory. Internally, when this boundary is reached, DMA interrupt will be generated.

field.name: BLK_SIZE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 000h. Transfer Data Length (Maximum block size is 2K bytes). When the CE- ATA enable bit of the CE-ATA control register is set, a value of 0x000 indicates block size of 4K bytes.

field.name: ARGUMENT1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Command Argument. Command arguments specified as bits[39-8] of the command format.

field.name: CMD_IDX
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Command index.

field.name: CMD_TYPE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Command type.

field.name: DATA_PRSNT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No data. 1=Data. Data Present Select. Indicates that data is present and will be transferred on the DAT line. When a command is issued with this bit enabled, the internal buffer will be cleared.

field.name: CMD_IDX_CHK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Command Index Check enable.

field.name: CRC_CHK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Command CRC Check enable.

field.name: RESP_TYPE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Response type select.

field.name: MULTI_BLK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Single block. 1=Multiple blocks. Multiple/Single block select.

field.name: DATA_DIR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Write. 1=Read. Data Transfer Direction.

field.name: ACMD_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Auto CMD Enable.

field.name: BLK_CNT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Block Count Enable.

field.name: DMA_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. DMA Enable.

field.name: RESPONSE1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[39:24] of the response is saved in this field. The response value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE0
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[23:8] of the response is saved in this field.

field.name: RESPONSE3
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[71:56] of the response is saved in this field. The response value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[55:40] of the response is saved in this field.

field.name: RESPONSE5
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[103-88] of the response is saved in this field. The response value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE4
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[87:72] of the response is saved in this field.

field.name: RESPONSE7
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[127:120] of the response or R[39:24] of the Auto CMD12 response is saved in this field. The response value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE6
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[119:104] of the response or R[23:8] of the Auto CMD12 response is saved in this field.

field.name: DATA_BUF_PORT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Data Buffer. Data will be accessed through this register. Data which exceeds the size designated by the Block Size Register will not be written in the data buffer.

field.name: DAT_LEVEL2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. DAT[7:4].

field.name: CMD_LEVEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. CMD Line Signal Level. Reflects signal level of CMD line. This is used for testing.

field.name: DAT_LEVEL1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. DAT Line Signal level. Reflects signal level of DAT line. This is used for testing.

field.name: WP_LEVEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Write protected. 1=Write enable. Write Protect Switch level.

field.name: CD_LEVEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No card present. 1=Card present. Card Detect Pin level. This bit is used for testing.

field.name: CARD_STABLE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Not stable (debouncing or resetting). 1=Card stable. Card state stable. Indicats Card Detect signal level is stable. This bit is used for testing.

field.name: CARD_INSERT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No card inserted or debouncing state or resetting. 1=Card inserted. Card inserted.

field.name: BUF_RD_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Read disable. 1=Read enable. Buffer Read Enable. Indicates buffer is ready for reading.

field.name: BUF_WR_EN
