field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Write disable. 1=Write enable. Buffer Write Enable. Indicates buffer is ready for Writing.

field.name: RD_TX_ACT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No data transferring. 1=Read data transferring. Read Transfer Active. Indicates duration of Read data transfer.

field.name: WR_TX_ACT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No data transferring. 1=Write data transferring. Write Transfer Active. Indicates duration of Write data transfer.

field.name: DAT_LINE_ACT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=DAT line inactive. 1=DAT line active. DAT Line Active. Indicates the DAT line on SD Bus is active.

field.name: CMD_INHIBIT_DAT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Can issue commands which use the DAT line. 1=Cannot issue any commands which use the DAT line. Command Inhibit (DAT). Indicates that commands which also use the DAT line can be issued.

field.name: CMD_INHIBIT_CMD
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Can issue commands which use the CMD line. 1=Cannot issue any commands. Command Inhibit (CMD). Indicates that commands which use only the CMD line can be issued.

field.name: WAKEUP_RM_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Card Removal Wakeup.

field.name: WAKEUP_INS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Card Insertion Wakeup.

field.name: WAKEUP_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Card Interrupt Wakeup.

field.name: BG_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Interrupt at Block Gap. Enable interrupt detection during 4-bit block transmission.

field.name: RD_WAIT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Read Wait Control. Indicates Read Wait will be inserted when needed.

field.name: CONT_REQ
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Restart. Continue Request. Writing 1 to this bit triggers restart of halted data transaction with current register setting. Once this bit is 1, the internal buffer will be cleared and data transfer sequence will be restarted.

field.name: BG_STOP_REQ
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Transfer. 1=Stop. Stop at Block Gap Request. Writing 1 to this bit triggers halting of the current data transfer after the next block gap. For using this request, the Read Wait function is necessary in a Read transaction. Even if the Auto CMD12 enable bit is set to 1, Auto CMD12 is not issued in case this bit is set to 1. This bit is cleared by not only writing 0 to this bit, but also issuing abort commands.

field.name: BUS_VOLT_SEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Reserved. Not used in EMMC. Use FCH::EMMC::MMIO::EMMCHC_ACMD_ERR_CTRL2[VOL18_EN] instead.

field.name: BUS_PWR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Off. 1=On. SD Bus Power. When card is removed, this bit is cleared automatically.

field.name: CD_SIG_SEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=IO pin. 1=SD_TEST_LEVEL. Card Detect Signal selection. This is for testing.

field.name: CD_TEST_LEVEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Card removed. 1=Card inserted. Card Detect Test Level. This is for testing.

field.name: EXT_WIDTH
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Use width set by DAT_XFER_WIDTH. 1=8-bit width. Extended Data Transfer Width (MMC).

field.name: DMA_SEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. DMA Select. Valid only when DMA is enabled.

field.name: HS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Normal speed. 1=High-speed. High Speed Enable. When disabled, SD controller outputs commands and data on the falling edge of the SD clock (Up to 25 MHz SD clock can be supported). When enabled, SD controller outputs commands and data on the rising edge of the SD clock (Up to 50 MHz SD clock can be supported).

field.name: DAT_XFER_WIDTH
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=1-bit. 1=4-bit. Data Transfer Width.

field.name: LED_CTRL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Off. 1=On. LED control. Drives the LED_ON output.

field.name: SRST_DAT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Reset DAT Line.

field.name: SRST_CMD
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Reset CMD Line.

field.name: SRST_ALL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Reset all.

field.name: DAT_TO_CNT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Data Timeout Counter Value. By using this counter value, DAT line timeouts are detected.

field.name: CLK_FREQ_SEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. SDCLK Frequency Select. If multiple bits are set, most significant bit will be selected.

field.name: CLK_FREQ_SEL_UP
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Upper Bits of SDCLK Frequency Select.

field.name: CLK_GEN_SEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Divided Clock mode. 1=Programmable Clock mode. Clock Generator select.

field.name: CLK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Clock Enable. SDCLK Frequency Select can be changed when this bit is 0. When card is removed, this bit is cleared to 0 automatically.

field.name: INTNCLK_STABLE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Unstable. 1=Stable. Internal clock stable.

field.name: INTNCLK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Internal clock enable.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. CE-ATA Error.

field.name: SDMA_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. SDMA Error.

field.name: TUNING_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Tuning Error.

field.name: ADMA_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. ADMA Error.

field.name: ACMD_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 Error. Loginal OR of Auto CMD12 Error Status register.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Reserved.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Data CRC Error.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Data CRC Error.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Data Timeout Error.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Command Index Error. Mismatch of Command Index and index of response.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Command End Bit Error.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Command CRC Error. If both CMD_TO_ERR and CMD_CRC_ERR set, this indicates Command Conflict Error.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Command Timeout Error. Response not returned within 128 SDCLK cycles.

field.name: ERR_INT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Error Interrupt.

field.name: RE_RUNING
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Re-Tuning Event. This status is set if Re-Tuning Request in the Present State register changes from 0 to 1.

field.name: INT_C
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. INT_C. This Status is set if INT_C is enabled and INT_C# pin is in low level.

field.name: INT_B
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. INT_B. This Status is set if INT_B is enabled and INT_B# pin is in low level.

field.name: INT_A
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. INT_A. This Status is set if INT_A is enabled and INT_A# pin is in low level.

field.name: CARD_INT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. SDIO Card Interrupt. Writing 1 to this register does not clear this bit. For clearing this bit, interrupt factor of SDIO cards should be cleared. The value of this bit is latched internally as long as the Card Interrupt bit (D08) in the Normal Interrupt Status Enable Register is 1.

field.name: CARD_RM
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Card Removal.

field.name: CARD_INS
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Card Insertion.

field.name: BUF_RD_RDY
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Buffer Read Ready. In case that Auto CMD12 is enabled and last block has been transferred, Auto CMD12 will be issued prior to this bit being set to 1. Clearing this bit should be done before buffer reading, because SD controller has dual buffer and the next Buffer Read Ready interrupt may occur immediately.

field.name: BUF_WR_RDY
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Buffer Write Ready. Clearing this bit should be done before buffer writing, because SD controller has dual buffer and the next Buffer Write Ready interrupt may occurr immediately.

field.name: DMA_INT
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. DMA Interrupt. It is set when the internal counter reaches the value designated by Host DMA Buffer Boundary. It should be cleared by Host Driver after System Address Register is updated.

field.name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Block Gap Event. It indicates the timing of next block gap, which is requested by the Stop At Block Gap Request. In case of a write transaction, this interrupt will be generated before busy completion.

field.name: XFER_DONE
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Data Transfer Complete. Indicates the timing for completion of data transaction which includes the completion at the block gap by the Stop At Block Gap Request. When some errors are detected during data transaction, this bit will not be set. In case that Auto CMD12 is enabled, Auto CMD12 will be issued prior to this bit being set to 1.

field.name: CMD_DONE
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Command Complete. The end bit of the command response is received. In the case of commands with no response, the end of the command.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. CE-ATA Error Status enable.

field.name: SDMA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. SDMA Error Status enable.

field.name: ADMA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. ADMA Error Status enable.

field.name: ACMD_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Auto CMD12 Error Status enable.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Current Limit Error Status enable.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Data End Bit Error Status enable.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Data CRC Error Status enable.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Data Timeout Error Status enable.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command Index Error Status enable.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command End Bit Error Status enable.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command CRC Error Status enable.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command Timeout Error Status enable.

field.name: RE_RUNING_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Re-Tuning Event Status enable.

field.name: INT_C_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. INT_C Status enable.

field.name: INT_B_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. INT_B Status enable.

field.name: INT_A_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. INT_A Status enable.

field.name: CARD_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Card Interrupt Status enable.

field.name: CARD_RM_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Card Removal Status enable.

field.name: CARD_INS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Card Insertion Status enable.

field.name: BUF_RD_RDY_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Buffer Read Ready Status enable.

field.name: BUF_WR_RDY_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Buffer Write Ready Status enable.

field.name: DMA_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. DMA Interrupt Status enable.

field.name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Block Gap Event Status enable.

field.name: XFER_DONE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Transfer Complete Status enable.

field.name: CMD_DONE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command Complete Status enable.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. CE-ATA Error Signal enable.

field.name: SDMA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. SDMA Error Signal enable.

field.name: ADMA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. ADMA Error Signal enable.

field.name: ACMD_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Auto CMD12 Error Signal enable.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Current Limit Error Signal enable.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Data End Bit Error Signal enable.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Data CRC Error Signal enable.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Data Timeout Error Signal enable.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command Index Error Signal enable.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command End Bit Error Signal enable.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command CRC Error Signal enable.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command Timeout Error Signal enable.

field.name: RE_RUNING_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Re-Tuning Event Signal enable.

field.name: INT_C_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. INT_C Signal enable.

field.name: INT_B_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. INT_B Signal enable.

field.name: INT_A_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. INT_A Signal enable.

field.name: CARD_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Card Interrupt Signal enable.

field.name: CARD_RM_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Card Removal Signal enable.

field.name: CARD_INS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Card Insertion Signal enable.

field.name: BUF_RD_RDY_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Buffer Read Ready Signal enable.

field.name: BUF_WR_RDY_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Buffer Write Ready Signal enable.

field.name: DMA_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. DMA Interrupt Signal enable.

field.name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Block Gap Event Signal enable.

field.name: XFER_DONE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Transfer Complete Signal enable.

field.name: CMD_DONE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enable. Command Complete Signal enable.

field.name: RESET_VAL_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Preset value enable.

field.name: ASYN_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Asynchronous Interrupt enable.

field.name: SAMPLING_CLK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Sampling Clock select.

field.name: EXE_TUNING
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Execute tuning. Execute tuning.

field.name: DRV_STR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Driver strength select.

field.name: VOL18_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1.8V Signaling Enable; this bit controls voltage 3.3/1.8v select. we should setting this bit first when use emmc

field.name: UHS_MODE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. UHS mode select.

field.name: NOT_ISSUE_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Command not issued by Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: IND_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 Index error.

field.name: END_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 End Bit error.

field.name: CRC_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 CRC error.

field.name: TO_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 Timeout error.

field.name: NOT_EXE_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 not executed error.

field.name: SLOT_TYPE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Slot type.

field.name: ASYN_INT_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Asynchronous Interrupt support.

field.name: SYS_BUS64_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 64-bit System Bus support.

field.name: V18_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Voltage support 1.8V.

field.name: V30_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Voltage support 3.0V.

field.name: V33_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Voltage support 3.3V.

field.name: SUS_RES_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Suspend/Resume support.

field.name: SDMA_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. SDMA support.

field.name: HS_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. High-speed support.

field.name: ADMA2_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. ADMA2 support.

field.name: WIDTH_8_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 8-bit support for Embedded Device.

field.name: MAX_BLK_LEN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 2h. Max block length.

field.name: BASE_CLK_FREQ
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 18h. Base clock frequency for SD clock.

field.name: TO_CLK_UNIT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Timeout clock unit.

field.name: TO_CLK_FREQ
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 18h. Timeout clock frequency.

field.name: CLK_MULTI
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Clock multiplier.

field.name: RETUNING_MODE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Re-Tuning modes.

field.name: SDR50_TUNING
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Use Tuning for SDR50.

field.name: TO_RETUNING
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Timer Count for Re-Tuning.

field.name: DRV_D_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Driver Type D support.

field.name: DRV_C_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Driver Type C support.

field.name: DRV_A_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Driver Type A support.

field.name: DDR50_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. DDR50 support.

field.name: SDR104_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. SDR104 support.

field.name: SDR50_SUP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. SDR50 support.

field.name: MAX_CURR_V18
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Maximum current for 1.8V.

field.name: MAX_CURR_V30
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Maximum current for 3.0V.

field.name: MAX_CURR_V33
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 64h. Maximum current for 3.3V.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force CE-ATA Error.

field.name: SDMA_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force SDMA error.

field.name: ADMA_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force ADMA error.

field.name: ACMD_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Current Limit error.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Data End Bit error.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Data CRC error.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Data Timeout error.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Command Index error.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Command End Bit error.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Command CRC error.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Command Timeout error.

field.name: ACMD12_ISS_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Command Not Issued By Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: ACMD_IDX_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Auto CMD12 Index error.

field.name: ACMD_END_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Auto CMD12 End Bit error.

field.name: ACMD_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Auto CMD12 CRC error.

field.name: ACMD_TO_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Auto CMD12 Timeout error.

field.name: ACMD12_EXE_ERR
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Force event. Force Auto CMD12 Not Executed error.

field.name: ADDR_LEN_MISMATCH
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0.

field.name: ERR_STATE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. ADMA state when error occured.

field.name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Lower bits of ADMA system address. See also FCH::EMMC::MMIO::EMMCHC_ADMA_SYSADDR_UP.

field.name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Upper bits of ADMA System Address. Before ADMA data transfer, the descriptor address should be set by the Host driver. This address needs to be set with 4-byte alignment, since the descriptor table is 32-bit (4 byte) information formatted.

field.name: CE_ATA_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Unsupported. 1=Supported. CE-ATA support capability. When supported, bits[3:0] can be written.

field.name: CE_ATA_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. CE-ATA enable. When enabled bits[2:0] can be written.

field.name: P_DRIVE_DIS
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. P-Drive disable.

field.name: CMD_COMP_DIS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Wait after command. 1=Issued after command. Command Completion Signal Disable enable.

field.name: CMD_COMP_SIG_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Command Completion Signal enable. When the Command Completion Signal is enabled, the Auto CMD12 Enable bit in the Transfer Mode register becomes of no use.

field.name: DEBOUNCING_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Debouncing enable. This bit should be cleared before starting command or data transfer if debouncing state is not needed in the error cases.

field.name: DEBOUNCING_STATUS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Not debouncing. 1=Debouncing. Debouncing State status. Indicates the card is debouncing. Should not issue any command during debouncing.

field.name: CARD_DETECT_SEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Standard Card Detect mode. 1=DAT3 Card Detect mode. Card Detct Select status.

field.name: DAT3_DETECT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. DAT3 Card Detect control. Disable this bit before writing the Command Register. After Command or Transfer complete, this bit can be re-enabled. During command and data transfer, enabling DAT3 Card Detection is prohibited. This bit is fixed to 1 in Standard Card Detect mode.

field.name: DAT3_CARD_INS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No card inserted. 1=Card inserted. DAT3 Card inserted.

field.name: VENDOR_VERSION
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: C3h. Vendor version.

field.name: SPEC_VERSION
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 02h. Specification version.

field.name: SLOT_INTRPT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Interrupt Signal for each slot. The value of XSLT_INT[7:0] inputs, which indicates the logical OR of the Interrupt signal and Wakeup signal, are inverted and referred by this register. In case of multiple slots, Interrupt signal and Wakeup signal should be logically ORed externally and should be inputted to each of XSLT_INT[7:0].

register.name: IOSel
register.desc: IO Register Select Register. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: IndirectAddressOffset
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Indirect Address Offset to IO Window Register. Determines which register is manipulated during an IO window register Read/Write operation.

field.name: IOWindow
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Mapped by FCH::IOAPIC::IOSel to the designated indirect access register.

register.name: IOAPICID
register.desc: IOAPICID. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register is not used in IOxAPIC PCI bus delivery mode. Precondition (data port): IOSel[IndirectAddressOffset] = indirectaddressoffset00.

field.name: ID
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. IOAPIC device ID.

register.name: IOAPICVersion
register.desc: IOAPICVersion. Read-only. Reset: 0017_8021h. Precondition (data port): IOSel[IndirectAddressOffset] = indirectaddressoffset01.

field.name: MaxRedirectionEntries
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 17h. Indicates 24 entries [23:0].

field.name: PRQ
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. IRQ pin assertion supported.

field.name: Version
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 21h. PCI 2.2 compliant.

register.name: IOAPICArb
register.desc: IOAPICArb. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register is not used in IOxAPIC PCI bus delivery mode. Precondition (data port): IOSel[IndirectAddressOffset] = indirectaddressoffset02.

field.name: ArbitrationID
field.desc: Arbitration ID. Read-only,Volatile. Reset: 0h. Arbitration ID.

field.name: Mask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Unmask. 1=Mask the interrupt injection at the input of this device.

field.name: TriggerMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge. 1=Level.

field.name: RemoteIRR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 1=Interrupt message is delivered. Used for level triggered interrupts only. It is cleared by EOI special cycle transaction or a Write to FCH::IOAPIC::EOI.

field.name: InterruptPinPolarity
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=High. 1=Low.

field.name: DeliveryStatus
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Idle. 1=Send Pending.

field.name: DestinationMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Physical. 1=Logical.

field.name: DeliveryMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector associated with this interrupt input.

field.name: DestinationID
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Bits[19:12] of the address field of the interrupt message.

register.name: IRQPinAssertion
register.desc: IRQ Pin Assertion Register. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: InputIrq
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IRQ number for the requested interrupt. A write to this register triggers an interrupt associated with the redirection table entry referenced by the IRQ number. Currently the redirection table has 24 entries. Writes with IRQ number greater than 17h have no effect.

field.name: Vector
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 00h. Interrupt vector. A write to this register clears the remote IRR bit in the redirection table entry found matching the interrupt vector (see FCH::IOAPIC::RedirectionTabEntryLow32[RemoteIRR]). This provides an alternate mechanism other than the PCI special cycle for EOI to reach IOxAPIC.

field.name: EventStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: XXXX_XXXXh. This is a mirror register of the standard ACPI register FCH::PM::EventStat. Each event status bit is set when the selected event input equals to the corresponding value in FCH::SMI::SciTrig.

field.name: EventEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This is the mirror register of the standard ACPI register FCH::PM::EventEnable. Each bit controls whether ACPI should generate wake up and SCI interrupt.

register.name: SciTrig
register.desc: SciTrig. Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. Each bit in this register controls the way to set each corresponding bit in FCH::SMI::EventStat.

field.name: SmiSciStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0000_0000h. Each bit indicates the corresponding SmiSci status. The input of each bit is controlled by the corresponding FCH::SMI::SciTrig bit. NOTE: This function can be considered as a superset of FCH::SMI::EventStat. When one of the bits is set and its corresponding FCH::SMI::SmiSciEn is also set, it triggers an SMI to call the BIOS. After the BIOS has serviced the SMM and cleared its status, the internal logic automatically sets the corresponding FCH::SMI::EventStat bit and thereby triggering an SCI.

field.name: SmiSciEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Each bit controls if an SMI message is generated when the corresponding FCH::SMI::SmiSciStat bit is set to 1.

field.name: SwSciEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register is used as a software mechanism to trigger the SCI. NOTE: The setting of this bit needs to match with FCH::SMI::SciTrig and FCH::SMI::SciLevl in order to set the status bit.

field.name: SwSciData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This is the software data path to set the corresponding FCH::SMI::EventStat bit when FCH::SMI::SwSciEn is set.

field.name: SciSleepDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register is used to ignore EVENT pins that are powered in

field.name: CapturedData
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: XXXX_XXXXh. This is the buffer to capture Write data for the last transaction that caused an SMI. NOTE: This buffer has no meaning for a Read trap.

field.name: CapturedValid
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Xh. This is the byte valid buffer to signal which byte is captured for the last transaction that caused the SMI.

field.name: StrapBifInternalErrEnFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Internal error enable.

field.name: StrapBifPoisonedAdvisoryNonfatalAFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Poisoned TLP as advisory non-fatal.

field.name: StrapBifAcsDirectTranslatedP2pFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS direct translated P2P enable.

field.name: StrapBifAcsUpstreamForwardingFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS upstream forwarding enable.

field.name: StrapBifAcsP2pCompletionRedirectFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS P2P completion redirect enable.

field.name: StrapBifAcsP2pRequestRedirectFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS P2P request redirect enable.

field.name: StrapBifAcsTranslationBlockingFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS translation blocking enable.

field.name: StrapBifAcsSourceValidationFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS source validation enable.

field.name: StrapBifAcsEnFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ACS enable.

field.name: StrapBifFirstRcvdErrLogFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. First received error log.

field.name: StrapBifEcrcCheckEnFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. ECRC check enable.

field.name: StrapBifEcrcGenEnFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. ECRC generate enable.

field.name: StrapBifCplAbortErrEnFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Completer abort error enable.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreVend0UrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore Vendor 0 error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreTcErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore traffic class error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreMsgErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore message error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreMaxPayloadErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore maximum payload error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreLenMismatchErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore length mismatch error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreIoUrErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore IO UR error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreIoErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore IO error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreEpErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore poisoned TLP error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreCplErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore completion error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreCfgUrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore configuration UR error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreCfgErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore configuration error.

field.name: StrapBifRxIgnoreBeErrFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Ignore byte enable error.

field.name: StrapBifErrReportingDisFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Error reporting disable.

field.name: StrapBifAerEnFch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. AER enable.

field.name: StrapBifStickyOverrideS5
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Values in this register would override straps loaded from EEPROM.

field.name: SIrqIochk
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Serial Iochk error.

field.name: SataPerr
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. SATA controller internal parity error status.

field.name: UmiUncorrectableErr
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. UMI uncorrectable error status.

field.name: UmiCorrectableErr
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. UMIcorrectable error status.

field.name: AbUmiGppPerr

field.name: InternalGPPSerr
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Internal error status: FCH has detected an internal error from upstream bridge.

field.name: InternalPerr
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Internal devices PERR error status.

field.name: InternalSerr
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Internal devices SERR error status.

field.name: SciMap3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the mapping of LPC_PME_L to one of the 32 bits in FCH::SMI::EventStat.

field.name: SciMap2

register.name: SmiPtr
register.desc: SmiPointer. Read-only. Reset: 0000h. This register is meant as a faster mechanism to locate the SMI source. BIOS can examine this register to find out the SMI source instead of reading FCH::SMI::SmiStat0 through FCH::SMI::SmiStat4 individually.

field.name: SmiStatusSource4
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Indicates whether the SMI source is from FCH::SMI::SmiStat4 if the corresponding SMI enable is selected.

field.name: SmiStatusSource2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Indicates whether the SMI source is from FCH::SMI::SmiStat2 if the corresponding SMI enable is selected.

field.name: SmiStatusSource1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Indicates whether the SMI source is from FCH::SMI::SmiStat1 if the corresponding SMI enable is selected.

field.name: SmiStatusSource0
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Indicates whether the SMI source is from FCH::SMI::SmiStat0 if the corresponding SMI enable is selected.

field.name: SmiSciSource
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Indicates whether the SMI source is from FCH::SMI::SmiSciStat.

register.name: SmiTimer
register.desc: SmiTimer. Read-write. Reset: 0000h. There are two SMI timers: the short timer runs at 1 us unit time and the long timer runs at 1 ms unit time. This register is actually made up of two sets of registers depending on the setting of FCH::SMI::SmiTrig0[SmiTimerSel]. If FCH::SMI::SmiTrig0[SmiTimerSel] == 0, then FCH::SMI::SmiTimer is for the short timer. If FCH::SMI::SmiTrig0[SmiTimerSel] == 1, then FCH::SMI::SmiTimer is for the long timer. The default setting selects this register as "SmiShortTimer"; software needs to set the "SmiTimerSel = 1" to select this register as "SmiLongTimer".

field.name: TimerEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable the SMI short Timer or long timer, which is selected by FCH::SMI::SmiTrig0[SmiTimerSel].

field.name: SmiTimerCount
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Actual timer duration = TimerTime + 1 unit.

register.name: SmiTrig0
register.desc: SmiTrig0. Read-write. Reset: 81FF_FFFFh. Bits[23:0] defines the trigger mode for 24 GEVENTS in FCH::SMI::SmiStat0[23:0]. Note these are different from FCH::SMI::SciTrig.

field.name: SmiEnB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable SMI function. 1=Disable.

field.name: SmiTimerSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Select FCH::SMI::SmiTimer to be SmiShortTimer register. 1=Select FCH::SMI::SmiTimer to be SmiLongTimer register.

field.name: Eos
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit is set to 1 by software to enable SMI generation. It is cleared by hardware after an SMI event has occurred. When Eos is clear, subsequent pending SMI event will be blocked.

field.name: TrappingIrqOnPic
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=SMI is generated when trapping IRQ[15:0] of IOAPIC. 1=SMI is generated when trapping IRQ[15:0] of PIC.

field.name: SmiTrig23
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Active low. 1=Active high.

field.name: VendorID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1022h. Vendor ID.

field.name: LegacyCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Legacy replacement interrupt is supported.

field.name: CounterSizeCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=32-bits wide. 1=64-bits wide.

field.name: NumTmrCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 02h. Three timers are supported.

field.name: RevID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 01h. Revision ID.

field.name: CounterClkPeriod
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0429_B17Eh. Specifies the clock period of each HPET timer tick. HPET main counter runs at 14.31818 MHz. The unit is femtosecond (10^-15 seconds). The value of this register can be modified through FCH::TMR::HPET::ClkPeriod.

field.name: LegacyEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Timer0 interrupt goes to IRQ0 of PIC controller, INT2 of IOAPIC; Timer1 interrupt goes to IRQ8 of PIC controller, INT8 of IOAPIC.

field.name: TmrEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Pause main counter and disable all timer interrupts. 1=Allow main counter to run and allow timer interrupts if enabled.

field.name: MainCounterHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IF (FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[HpetWidthSel] == 1) THEN Specifies the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit HPET main counter. Bits [31:0] contain the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit HPET main counter. Should be written to only when it is halted. ELSE Reserved. ENDIF.

field.name: MainCounterLo
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Specified the HPET main counter, incremented by 1 on every clock. Should be written to only when it is halted.

field.name: TmrIntRouteCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00C0_0000h. Indicates which INT entry of IOAPIC can be assigned to the timer interrupt.

field.name: TmrFsbCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 1=Front side bus delivery is supported.

field.name: TmrFsbEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable front side bus delivery of interrupt.

field.name: TmrIntRoute
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This specifies which INT entry of IOAPIC the timer is routed to if FCH::TMR::HPET::Cfg[LegacyEn] == 0.

field.name: Tmr32ModeEn
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=64-bit timer is not supported. 1=64-bit timer is supported.

field.name: TmrSetPer
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Allow software to set the timer's accumulator if the timer is set to periodic mode. The bit is automatically cleared when FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator is written by software.

field.name: TmrSizeCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. The timer is 32-bits wide.

field.name: TmrTypCap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. The timer supports periodic interrupt delivery mode.

field.name: TmrTyp
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Non-periodic. 1=Periodic. Selects the timer interrupt type.

field.name: TmrIntEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the timer interrupt.

field.name: TmrIntTyp
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Edge triggered. 1=Level triggered. Specifies the timer interrupt polarity.

field.name: ComparatorHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IF (FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[HpetWidthSel] == 1) THEN ELSE ENDIF. Specifies the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit timer comparator. Bits [31:0] contain the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit timer comparator. ELSE Reserved. ENDIF.

field.name: ComparatorLo
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. IF (FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerCfgCap[TmrTyp] == 0) THEN Read-write. ELSEIF ((FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerCfgCap[TmrTyp] == 1) && (FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerCfgCap[TmrSetPer] == 1)) THEN Read-write. ELSE Read-only. ENDIF. The comparator is periodically incremented by the value last written to this register. This register is updated by hardware when (FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerCfgCap[TmrTyp] == 1).

register.name: TimerFSBIntData
register.desc: Timer[2:0] FSB Interrupt Data. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: TnFsbIntVal
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Software sets this 32-bit field to specify the write data of Front Side Bus (FSB) Interrupt Message.

register.name: TimerFSBIntAddr
register.desc: Timer[2:0] FSB Interrupt Address. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: TnFsbIntAddr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Software sets this 32-bit field to specify the address of Front Side Bus (FSB) Interrupt Message.

register.name: TimerComparatorBaseShadow
register.desc: Timer[2:0] Comparator Base Shadow. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000_FFFF_FFFFh.

field.name: TmrCompBaseShadowHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IF (FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[HpetWidthSel] == 1) THEN ELSE ENDIF. This is a shadow of the base value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0] [ComparatorHi]. Reading this register returns the base value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0] [ComparatorHi]. Writing the register changes the base value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0] [ComparatorHi].

field.name: TmrCompBaseShadowLo
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. This is shadow of the base value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0][ComparatorLo]. Reading this register returns the base value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0][ComparatorLo]. Writing the register changes the base value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0][ComparatorLo].

field.name: TmrCompShadowHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IF (FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[HpetWidthSel] == 1) THEN ELSE ENDIF. This is a shadow of the current value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0] [ComparatorHi]. Reading this register returns the current value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0] [ComparatorHi]. Writing the register changes the current value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0] [ComparatorHi].

field.name: TmrCompShadowLo
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. This is shadow of the current value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0][ComparatorLo]. Reading this register returns the current value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0][ComparatorLo]. Writing the register changes the current value of FCH::TMR::HPET::TimerComparator_n[2:0][ComparatorLo].

field.name: MainCounterRtcHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IF (FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[HpetWidthSel] == 1) THEN Specifies the shadow of FCH::TMR::HPET::MainCtr[MainCounterHi]. See MainCounterRtcLo. ELSE Reserved. ENDIF.

field.name: MainCounterRtcLo
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This is a shadow of FCH::TMR::HPET::MainCtr[MainCounterLo]. It samples the value of Main Counter at every falling edge of RTC 32 KHz clock for software to Read. When software Writes this register, FCH::TMR::HPET::MainCtr[MainCounterLo] is updated with the same value written to this register, and then enabled counting at the next RTC clock falling edge. The purpose of this register is for the convenience of software save-restore HPET.

field.name: NxtTmrRemainHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. IF (FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[HpetWidthSel] == 1) THEN Specifies the upper 32 bits of the timer ticks remaining before the next enabled comparator interrupt. ELSE Reserved. ENDIF.

field.name: NxtTmrRemainLo
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. Specifies how many timer ticks remaining before the next enabled comparator interrupt.

field.name: WatchdogTrigger
field.desc: Write-1-only. Reset: 0. Writing 1 to this bit triggers the watchdog to start a new count interval, counting down from the value that was last written to FCH::TMR::WDT::WatchdogCnt.

field.name: WatchdogDisable
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. This bit reflects the state of the watchdog timer hardware. This bit reflects the state of FCH::PM::PmDecodeEn[WatchdogTmrEn].

field.name: WatchdogAction
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=System reset. 1=System power off. This bit determines the action to be taken when the watchdog timer expires. The bit is only valid when the watchdog is enabled.

field.name: WatchdogFired
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: Cold,0. 1=The watchdog timer has expired and caused the current restart. The bit is cleared by a power cycle or by the operating system and it must remain cleared for any restart that is not caused by the watchdog timer firing. The bit is only valid when the watchdog is enabled.

field.name: WatchdogRunStopB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Watchdog is in the stopped state. 1=Watchdog is in the running state. This bit is used to control or indicate whether the watchdog is in the running or stopped states. If the watchdog is in the stopped state and a 1 is written to this bit, the watchdog moves to the running state, but a count interval is not started until a 1 is written to WatchdogTrigger. If the watchdog is in the running state, writing 1 to this bit has no effect. The bit is only valid when the watchdog is enabled.

field.name: WatchdogCount
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXXh. Writing this field specifies the countdown time for the counter.

field.name: AcTimerValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. Description: Writing the register with a value other than FFFF_FFFFh starts the AC timer. Reading this register returns the current value of the AC timer. When the AC or DC timer generates a wake up event, this register is reset to FFFF_FFFFh by hardware.

field.name: AcExpiredTimerPolicy
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. When the AC timer expires, the wake signal is asserted if the current power source is AC; the wake signal is not asserted if the current power source is DC. If the power source is switched from DC to AC after the AC timer expired, we wait for the number of seconds defined in this register and then wake up the system. When the AC or DC timer generates a wake up event, this register is reset to FFFF_FFFFh by hardware.

field.name: AcTimerWakeup
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=Wake-up was not caused by AC timer expiration. 1=Wake up was caused by AC timer expiration.

field.name: AcTimerExpired
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=AC timer has not expired. 1=AC timer expired.

field.name: DcTimerValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. Description: Writing the register with a value other than FFFF_FFFFh starts the DC timer. Reading this register returns the current value of the DC timer. When the AC or DC timer generates a wake up event, this register is reset to FFFF_FFFFh by hardware.

field.name: DcExpiredTimerPolicy
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. When the DC timer expires, the wake signal is asserted if the current power source is DC; the wake signal is not asserted if the current power source is AC. If the power source is switched from AC to DC after the DC timer expired, the device waits for the number of seconds defined in this register and then wakes up the system. When the AC or DC timer generates a wake up event, this register is reset to FFFF_FFFFh by hardware.

field.name: DcTimerWakeup
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=Wake-up was not caused by DC timer expiration. 1=Wake- up was caused by DC timer expiration.

field.name: DcTimerExpired
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 0=DC timer has not expired. 1=DC timer expired.

field.name: DcTimerEventEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable DC Timer to wake up system.

field.name: AcTimerEventEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable AC Timer to wake up system.

field.name: Busy
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Right after FCH::TMR::ACDC::AcTimerVal or FCH::TMR::ACDC::DcTimerVal is programmed, the hardware sets this bit to 1. The hardware clears this bit once the programming is done and the corresponding timer is started properly. Before the software writes to FCH::TMR::ACDC::AcTimerVal or FCH::TMR::ACDC::DcTimerVal, it has to read this bit and make sure it is 0. Otherwise, the hardware just ignores the programming action from software. For the registers other than FCH::TMR::ACDC::AcTimerVal or FCH::TMR::ACDC::DcTimerVal, there is no such limitation.

field.name: IsSwControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Hardware controls control signals (PwrRstB, RefClkOk, RstB) to the device. 1=Software controls control signals (PwrRstB, RefClkOk, RstB) to the device. Software must set bit IsSwControl first before programming bits SwPwrOnRstB, SwRefClkOk and SwRstB, otherwise, unpredictable behavior may result.

field.name: SwRstB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=RstB is asserted to the device if IsSwControl == 1. 1=RstB is de-asserted to the device if IsSwControl == 1.

field.name: SwRefClkOk
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=RefClkOk is de-asserted to the device if IsSwControl == 1. 1=RefClkOk is asserted to the device if IsSwControl == 1.

field.name: SwPwrOnRstB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=PwrRstB is asserted to the device if IsSwControl == 1. 1=PwrRstB is de-asserted to the device if IsSwControl == 1.

field.name: PwrOnDev
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Put device in reset state. 1=Put device out of reset state. If SwControl == 0, software can write this bit to trigger a hardware controlled reset sequence to the device. Default value is 0 when N=13-15, 18-24, 29. Default value is 1 when N!=13-15, 18-24, 29.

field.name: DeviceState
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Device power is removed. 1=Device power is applied. Software records the device power state in this field.

field.name: TargetedDeviceState
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. Software records D-State of the device in this field. Default value is 01b when N=0-12, 16-17, 25-28, 30-31. Default value is 00b when N=13-15, 18-24, 29.

register.name: DevD3State
register.desc: Device D3 State. Read-only. Reset: 27h. AOAC=FED8_1E00h

field.name: Stat1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. State of device.

field.name: Stat0
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. State of device.

field.name: ClkOkState
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Specifies the state of device's ClkOk signal.

field.name: D3Cold
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Specifies the state of device's D3 Cold signal.

field.name: DevOffGatingState
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Specifies the state of device's DevOffGating signal.

field.name: RstBState
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Specifies the state of device's RstB signal.

field.name: RefClkOkState
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Specifies the state of device's RefClkOk signal.

field.name: PwrRstBState
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. Specifies the state of device's PwrRstB signal.

field.name: Status
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 3FFF_FFFFh. Reading these bits returns the status of the store or restore action. Each bit represents the status of a device. For each bit, Software can also write this register to 1 or 0. This provides software a way to override the status.

register.name: ShadowRegSRAMAddr
register.desc: Shadow Register SRAM Addr. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: ShadowSRamAddr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Software has indirect access to the SRAM in shadow register block via FCH::AOAC::ShadowRegSRAMAddr and FCH::AOAC::ShadowRegSRAMData. The field specifies the shadow SRAM address to be accessed.

register.name: ShadowRegSRAMData
register.desc: Shadow Register SRAM Data. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: ShadowSRamData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Specifies the data to be written or read for the shadow SRAM address specified by FCH::AOAC::ShadowRegSRAMAddr.

field.name: PllOffReq
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. Read back always 0. SMU can write 1 to this bit to request FCH to shutdown CGPLL.

field.name: IntrBlocked
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=FCH interrupts are not blocked. 1=FCH interrupts are blocked. If the FCH is sending an interrupt message when software or SMU write 1 to InterruptDis, the interrupt is blocked "gracefully". Wait until the interrupt is sent and then block the interrupt. This bit indicates the interrupt blocking status.

field.name: InterruptDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Interrupt from FCH is enabled. 1=Interrupt from FCH is disabled. Software is able to set and clear this bit. Hardware can only set this bit.

field.name: ArbiterDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=FCH upstream arbiter is enabled. 1=FCH upstream arbiter is disabled. Software is able to set and clear this bit. Hardware can only set this bit.

field.name: ShadowTimerWakeSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Shadow Timer did not fire. 1=Shadow Timer fired and caused a wake-up from the S0I3 state. Harware clears this bit during S0I3 entry.

field.name: S0I3Resume
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Set to 1 by S0I3 exit to indicate the system has resumed from the S0I3 state. The bit is cleared by S0I3 entry or write-1-to-cleared by software.

field.name: S0I3Enter
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Indicate the system is in S0 state. 1=Indicate the system is in S0I3 state.

field.name: S0I3Trigger
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. Setting the bit to 1 triggers S0I3 power down sequence.

field.name: S0I3Ready2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=S0I3 can't be entered. 1=S0I3 can be entered. Programmed by Driver.

field.name: S0I3OnSlpS3B
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=SLP_S3# doesn't assert in S0I3 state. 1=SLP_S3# asserts in S0I3 state.

field.name: S0I3Ready
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=S0I3 cannot be entered. 1=S0I3 can be entered. Programmed by BIOS.

field.name: RestoredOffset64
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies a programmable offset to be added to restored HPET 64-bit timer; this is to account for restore time uncertainty.

field.name: RestoredOffset
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies a programmable offset to be added to restored HPET 32-bit timer and ACPI timer; this is to account for restore time uncertainty.

field.name: EarlyCount
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies a programmable offset to be subtracted from the alarm value.

field.name: EarlyCountUnit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=The unit of EarlyCount is 1 RTC clock period. 1=The unit of EarlyCount is 16 RTC clock period.

field.name: ShadowAcpiTimerEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable control to perform store/restore operation for ACPI timer.

field.name: ShadowHpetEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable control to perform store/restore operation from HPET timer.

field.name: SpiPadDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Disable the OE and PU of the SPI pads.

field.name: LpcPadDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Disable the OE and PU of the LPC pads.

field.name: PowerAllPwrIsland
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=When software programs [PG1a/PG2/XHC], ACPI powers up all groups immediately. 1=Indicates that when software programs [PG1a/PG2/XHC], ACPI powers up all power groups sequentially to avoid current surge. If the platform supports AOAC, this bit must be 0 during boot, otherwise, this bit remains set.

field.name: PG2PwrGood
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=PG2 is powered down. 1=PG2 is powered up. Controls the power of Power Group 2. Waking up from S3 or S5 sets this bit to default value.

field.name: PG1aPwrGood
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=PG1a is powered down. 1=PG1a is powered up. Controls the power of Power Group 1a. Waking up from S3 or S5 sets this bit to default value.

field.name: DeviceID
field.desc: Device Identifier. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,790Eh. This 16-bit field is assigned by the device manufacturer and identifies the type of device.

field.name: VendorID
field.desc: Vendor Identifier. Read-only. Reset: 1022h. PCI vendor identifier.

field.name: DetectedParityError
field.desc: Detected Parity Error. Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The FCH detects a parity error. Parity error detection.

field.name: SignaledSystemError
field.desc: Signaled System Error. Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The FCH detects a PCI address parity error. System error detection.

field.name: ReceivedMasterAbort
field.desc: Received Master Abort. Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The FCH acts as a PCI master and aborts a PCI bus memory cycle. Master abort received.

field.name: ReceivedTargetAbort
field.desc: Received Target Abort. Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=An FCH generated PCI cycle (the FCH is the PCI master) is aborted by a PCI target. Target abort received.

field.name: SignaledTargetAbort
field.desc: Signaled Target Abort. Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The FCH signals target abort. Target abort signal.

field.name: DeviceSelectTiming
field.desc: Device Select Timing. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. Indicates DEVSEL# timing when performing a positive decode. DEVSEL# is asserted to meet the medium timing.

field.name: MasterDataParityError
field.desc: Master Data Parity Error. Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The FCH detects PERR# asserted while acting as PCI master regardless whether PERR# was driven by the FCH or not. Master data parity error.

field.name: CapabilitiesList
field.desc: Capabilities List. Read-only. Reset: 0. Always reads 0.

field.name: FastBack2BackEnable
field.desc: Fast Back-to-Back Enable. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Enable fast back-to-back transactions.

field.name: SERREnable
field.desc: SERR# Enable. Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=SERR# is not asserted. 1=The FCH asserts SERR# when it detects an address parity error. SERR# assertion on address parity error.

field.name: SteppingControl
field.desc: Stepping Control. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Stepping control.

field.name: ParityErrorResponse
field.desc: Parity Error Response. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PERR# is not asserted. 1=The FCH asserts PERR# when it is the agent receiving data and it detects a parity error. PERR# (Response) Detection enable bit.

field.name: VGAPaletteSnoop
field.desc: VGA Palette Snoop. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Snoop VGA color palette.

field.name: MemoryWriteAndInvalidateEnable
field.desc: Memory Write and Invalidate Enable. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Enables Memory Write and Invalidate command.

field.name: SpecialCycles
field.desc: Special Cycles. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Controls Special Cycle operations.

field.name: BusMaster
field.desc: Bus Master. Read-only. Reset: 1. 1=Bus master enabled.

field.name: MemorySpace
field.desc: Memory Space. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. Controls a device's response to Memory Space accesses.

field.name: IOSpace
field.desc: IO Space. Read-only. Reset: 1. 1=Enable access to the legacy IDE ports and PCI bus master IDE IO registers are enabled. This bit controls access to the IO space registers.

field.name: ClassCode
field.desc: Class Code. Read-only. Reset: 06_0100h. Indicates an ISA bridge.

field.name: RevisionID
field.desc: Revision ID. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,51h. Indicates the revision level of the design.

field.name: Bist
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. No BIST modes.

field.name: HeaderType
field.desc: Header Type. Read-only. Reset: 80h. Identifies the type of the predefined header in the configuration space. The most significant bit is set to 1 to indicate a multi-function device.

field.name: LatencyTimer
field.desc: Latency Timer. Read-only. Reset: 00h. Specifies the value of the latency timer in units of PCICLKs.

field.name: CacheLineSize
field.desc: Cache Line Size. Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Specifies the size of the cache line.

field.name: BaseAddress0[31:5]
field.desc: Base Address 0. Write-only. Reset: Fixed,7F6_0000h. Read as zero. This register has an internal value used as base address BaseAddress0[31:5] for APIC memory space. Writing to the register changes its internal value. The default internal base address is FEC0_0000h.

field.name: BaseAddress0[4:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. This register has an internal value used as base address BaseAddress0[4:0] for APIC memory space.

register.name: SubsystemIDSubsystemVendorID
register.desc: Subsystem ID and Subsystem Vendor ID. Read,Write-once. Reset: 790E_1022h.

field.name: SubsystemID
field.desc: Subsystem ID. Read,Write-once. Reset: 790Eh. Subsystem identifier.

field.name: SubsystemVendorID
field.desc: Subsystem Vendor ID. Read,Write-once. Reset: 1022h. PCI vendor identifier.

field.name: CapabilitiesPointer
field.desc: Capabilities Pointer. Read-only. Reset: 00h. No capability, always Read 00h.

field.name: EcSemaphore
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=SPI ROM is not locked by External EC. 1=SPI ROM is locked by External EC. SPI ROM locking.

field.name: BiosSemaphore
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=SPI ROM is not locked by Host. 1=SPI ROM is locked by Host. This bit is writable by host to block EC ROM access. Whenever the host needs to lock down ROM access then the host should continue writing the bit to 1 until it reads back 1.

field.name: ExtRomSharingEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable ROM sharing in External mode. 1=Support ROM sharing in External mode.

field.name: VWRomSharingEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable ROM sharing in Virtual write mode. 1=Support ROM sharing in Virtual write mode.

field.name: LegacyDmaEnable
field.desc: Legacy DMA Enable. Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable LPC DMA cycle. Transfer size for channel[3:0] is 8 bits; Transfer size for channel[7:5] is 16 bits. 32-bit DMA is not supported.

register.name: IOPortDecodeEn
register.desc: IO Port Decode Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: AdLibPortEnable
field.desc: Ad-Lib Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for Ad-Lib port, 388h-389h.

field.name: AcpiMicroControllerPortEnable
field.desc: ACPI Micro-Controller Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for ACPI micro-controller port, 62h & 66h.

field.name: KBCPortEnable
field.desc: KBC Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for KBC port, 60h & 64h.

field.name: GamePortEnable
field.desc: Game Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for game port, 200h-20Fh.

field.name: FDCPortEnable1
field.desc: FDC Port Enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for FDC port, 370h-377h.

field.name: FDCPortEnable0
field.desc: FDC Port Enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for FDC port, 3F0h-3F7h.

field.name: MSSPortEnable3
field.desc: MSS Port Enable 3. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MSS port, F40h-F47h.

field.name: MSSPortEnable2
field.desc: MSS Port Enable 2. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MSS port, E80h-E87h.

field.name: MSSPortEnable1
field.desc: MSS Port Enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MSS port, 604h-60bh.

field.name: MSSPortEnable0
field.desc: MSS Port Enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MSS port, 530h-537h.

field.name: MIDIPortEnable3
field.desc: MIDI Port Enable 3. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MIDI port, 330h-331h.

field.name: MIDIPortEnable2
field.desc: MIDI Port Enable 2. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MIDI port, 320h-321h.

field.name: MIDIPortEnable1
field.desc: MIDI Port Enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MIDI port, 310h-311h.

field.name: MIDIPortEnable0
field.desc: MIDI Port Enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for MIDI port, 300h-301h.

field.name: AudioPortEnable3
field.desc: Audio Port Enable 3. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for audio port, 280h-293h.

field.name: AudioPortEnable2
field.desc: Audio Port Enable 2. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for audio port, 260h-273h.

field.name: AudioPortEnable1
field.desc: Audio Port Enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for audio port, 240h-253h.

field.name: AudioPortEnable0
field.desc: Audio Port Enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for audio port, 230h-233h.

field.name: SerialPortEnable7
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 7. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 3E8h-3EFh.

field.name: SerialPortEnable6
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 6. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 338h-33Fh.

field.name: SerialPortEnable5
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 5. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 2E8h-2EFh.

field.name: SerialPortEnable4
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 4. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 238h-23Fh.

field.name: SerialPortEnable3
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 3. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 228h-22Fh.

field.name: SerialPortEnable2
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 2. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 220h-227h.

field.name: SerialPortEnable1
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 2F8h-2FFh.

field.name: SerialPortEnable0
field.desc: Serial Port Enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for serial port, 3F8h-3FFh.

field.name: ParallelPortEnable5
field.desc: Parallel Port Enable 5. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for parallel port, 7BCh-7BFh.

field.name: ParallelPortEnable4
field.desc: Parallel Port Enable 4. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for parallel port, 3BCh-3BFh.

field.name: ParallelPortEnable3
field.desc: Parallel Port Enable 3. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for parallel port, 678h-67Fh.

field.name: ParallelPortEnable2
field.desc: Parallel Port Enable 2. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for parallel port, 278h-27Fh.

field.name: ParallelPortEnable1
field.desc: Parallel Port Enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for parallel port, 778h-77Fh.

field.name: ParallelPortEnable0
field.desc: Parallel Port Enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for parallel port, 378h-37Fh.

register.name: IOMemPortDecodeEn
register.desc: IO/Mem Port Decode Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0000_FF00h.

field.name: WideIO2Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for wide generic IO port 2 defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::WideIO2[IOBaseAddress2].

field.name: WideIO1Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for wide generic IO port 1 defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::PciIoBaseAddrWideGenPort[IOBaseAddress1].

field.name: IOPortEnable6
field.desc: IO port enable 6. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port FD60h- FD6Fh.

field.name: IOPortEnable5
field.desc: IO port enable 5. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port 4700h- 470Bh.

field.name: IOPortEnable4
field.desc: IO port enable 4. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port 80h.

field.name: MemPortEnable
field.desc: Mem port enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the memory range. Port enable for 4K byte memory range defined in FCH::ITF::LPC::MemRng.

field.name: IOPortEnable3
field.desc: IO port enable 3. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port 580h- 5BFh.

field.name: IOPortEnable2
field.desc: IO port enable 2. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port 500h- 53Fh.

field.name: IOPortEnable1
field.desc: IO port enable 1. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port 480h- 4BFh.

field.name: IOPortEnable0
field.desc: IO port enable 0. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for IO port 400h- 43Fh.

field.name: SyncTimeoutCount
field.desc: Synchronization Timeout Count. Read-write. Reset: FFh. When [SyncTimeoutCounterEnable] == 1, this field specifies the number of LPC clocks that the state machine waits during LPC data synchronization before aborting the cycle.

field.name: SyncTimeoutCounterEnable
field.desc: Synchronization Timeout Counter Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=The counter is disabled. 1=LPC sync timeout counter is enabled. This counter is used to avoid a deadlock condition if an LPC device drives sync forever. Timeout count is programmed in [SyncTimeoutCount]. Write 0 to this bit if an LPC device is extremely slow and takes more than 255 LPC clocks to complete a cycle.

field.name: RtcIORangePortEnable
field.desc: RTC IO Range Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for RTC IO range 70h-73h.

field.name: MemoryRangePortEnable
field.desc: Memory Range Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the memory range. Port enable for LPC memory target range defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::PCIMemAddrforLPCTargCyc.

field.name: WideIO0Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for wide generic IO port defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::PciIoBaseAddrWideGenPort[IOBaseAddress0].

field.name: AlternateSuperIOConfigurationPortEnable
field.desc: Alternate Super IO Configuration Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for alternate Super IO configuration port, 4Eh-4Fh.

field.name: SuperIOConfigurationPortEnable
field.desc: Super IO Configuration Port Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the IO range. Port enable for Super IO configuration port, 2Eh-2Fh.

field.name: BaseAddress
field.desc: Base Address. Read-write. Reset: 0_0000h. Specifies a 4K byte memory range from {Base Address, 000h} to {Base Address, FFFh}. The range is enabled by FCH::ITF::LPC::IOMemPortDecodeEn[MemPortEnable].

register.name: RomProtect0
register.desc: ROM Protect 0. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register specifies different ROM ranges to be protected. FCH::ITF::SPI::AltSPICS[SpiProtectEn0] enables the protection ranges. The addresses are within the defined ROM range if: {RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} <= address[31:0] <= ({RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} + (Range << (RangeUnit ? 16 : 12))). For the host, this register can only be written once after hardware reset; subsequent writes have no effect. To enable writing to this register again, one can generate an SMI through FCH or apply hardware reset.

field.name: RomBase
field.desc: ROM Base. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0_0000h.

field.name: WriteProtect
field.desc: Write Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is write- protected and writing to the range has no effect.

field.name: ReadProtect
field.desc: Read Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is read- protected and reading any location in the range returns FFFF_FFFFh.

field.name: RangeUnit
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 0=4 KB. 1=64 KB.

field.name: Range
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 00h. Description: Specifies the protected range. The unit is defined at bit[8] in the same register. NOTE: The protection is limited to 4GB boundary. Base + Range cannot cross 4GB boundary; otherwise, hardware will not behave correctly. BIOS should make sure the values are within a valid range.

register.name: RomProtect1
register.desc: ROM Protect 1. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register specifies different ROM ranges to be protected. FCH::ITF::SPI::AltSPICS[SpiProtectEn0] enables the protection ranges. The addresses are within the defined ROM range if: {RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} <= address[31:0] <= ({RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} + (Range << (RangeUnit ? 16 : 12))). For the host, this register can only be written once after hardware reset; subsequent writes have no effect. To enable writing to this register again, one can generate an SMI through FCH or apply hardware reset.

field.name: RomBase
field.desc: ROM Base. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0_0000h.

field.name: WriteProtect
field.desc: Write Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is write- protected and writing to the range has no effect.

field.name: ReadProtect
field.desc: Read Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is read- protected and reading any location in the range returns FFFF_FFFFh.

field.name: RangeUnit
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 0=4 KB. 1=64 KB.

field.name: Range
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 00h. Description: Specifies the protected range. The unit is defined at bit[8] in the same register. NOTE: The protection is limited to 4GB boundary. Base + Range cannot cross 4GB boundary; otherwise, hardware will not behave correctly. BIOS should make sure the values are within a valid range.

register.name: RomProtect2
register.desc: ROM Protect 2. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register specifies different ROM ranges to be protected. FCH::ITF::SPI::AltSPICS[SpiProtectEn0] enables the protection ranges. The addresses are within the defined ROM range if: {RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} <= address[31:0] <= ({RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} + (Range << (RangeUnit ? 16 : 12))). For the host, this register can only be written once after hardware reset; subsequent writes have no effect. To enable writing to this register again, one can generate an SMI through FCH or apply hardware reset.

field.name: RomBase
field.desc: ROM Base. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0_0000h.

field.name: WriteProtect
field.desc: Write Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is write- protected and writing to the range has no effect.

field.name: ReadProtect
field.desc: Read Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is read- protected and reading any location in the range returns FFFF_FFFFh.

field.name: RangeUnit
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 0=4 KB. 1=64 KB.

field.name: Range
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 00h. Description: Specifies the protected range. The unit is defined at bit[8] in the same register. NOTE: The protection is limited to 4GB boundary. Base + Range cannot cross 4GB boundary; otherwise, hardware will not behave correctly. BIOS should make sure the values are within a valid range.

register.name: RomProtect3
register.desc: ROM Protect 3. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register specifies different ROM ranges to be protected. FCH::ITF::SPI::AltSPICS[SpiProtectEn0] enables the protection ranges. The addresses are within the defined ROM range if: {RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} <= address[31:0] <= ({RomBase, 000_0000_0000b} + (Range << (RangeUnit ? 16 : 12))). For the host, this register can only be written once after hardware reset; subsequent writes have no effect. To enable writing to this register again, one can generate an SMI through FCH or apply hardware reset.

field.name: RomBase
field.desc: ROM Base. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0_0000h.

field.name: WriteProtect
field.desc: Write Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is write- protected and writing to the range has no effect.

field.name: ReadProtect
field.desc: Read Protect. Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 1=The memory range defined by this register is read- protected and reading any location in the range returns FFFF_FFFFh.

field.name: RangeUnit
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 0. 0=4 KB. 1=64 KB.

field.name: Range
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 00h. Description: Specifies the protected range. The unit is defined at bit[8] in the same register. NOTE: The protection is limited to 4GB boundary. Base + Range cannot cross 4GB boundary; otherwise, hardware will not behave correctly. BIOS should make sure the values are within a valid range.

register.name: PCIMemAddrforLPCTargCyc
register.desc: PCI Memory Address for LPC Target Cycles. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register contains the upper 16 bits of the start and end address of the LPC memory target range. The lower 16 bits of MemoryStartAddress are 0000h. The lower 16 bits of MemoryEndAddress are FFFFh. This range can be enabled or disabled using FCH::ITF::LPC::IOMemPortDecodeEn[MemoryRangePortEnable].

field.name: MemoryEndAddress
field.desc: Memory End Address. Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the upper 16 bits of the end address of the LPC target memory range.

field.name: MemoryStartAddress
field.desc: Memory Start Address. Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specifies the upper 16 bits of the start address of the LPC target memory range.

register.name: PciIoBaseAddrWideGenPort
register.desc: PCI IO base Address for Wide Generic Port. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: IOBaseAddress1
field.desc: IO Base Address 1. Read-write. Reset: 0000h. 16-bit PCI IO base address for wide generic IO port range. This function is enabled by FCH::ITF::LPC::IOMemPortDecodeEn[WideIO1Enable]. If FCH::ITF::LPC::AlternativeWideIORngEn[AlternativeWideIO1RangeEnable] == 1, the range is 16 bytes; else the range is 512 bytes.

field.name: IOBaseAddress0
field.desc: IO Base Address 0. Read-write. Reset: 0000h. 16-bit PCI IO base address for wide generic IO port range. This function is enabled by FCH::ITF::LPC::IOMemPortDecodeEn[WideIO0Enable]. If FCH::ITF::LPC::AlternativeWideIORngEn[AlternativeWideIO0RangeEnable] == 1, the range is 16 bytes; else the range is 512 bytes.

register.name: ROMAddrRng1
register.desc: ROM Address Range 1. Read-write. Reset: 000F_0008h. This register contains the upper 16 bits of the start and end address of the ROM address range 1. The lower 16 bits of RomStartAddress1 are 0000h. The lower 16 bits of the RomEndAddress1 are FFFFh. This register is used for both LPC and SPI flash.

field.name: RomEndAddress1
field.desc: ROM End Address 1. Read-write. Reset: 000Fh. Specifies the upper 16 bits of the end address of the ROM memory address range 1. If the strap is disabled, the reset value is 0h.

field.name: RomStartAddress1
field.desc: ROM Start Address 1. Read-write. Reset: 0008h. Specifies the upper 16 bits of the start address of the ROM memory address range 1. If the strap is disabled, the reset value is 0h. Default is set to 512K below 1M.

register.name: ROMAddrRng2
register.desc: ROM Address Range 2. Read-write. Reset: FFFF_FF00h. This register contains the upper 16 bits of the start and end address of the ROM address range 2. The lower 16 bits of RomStartAddress2 are 0000h. The lower 16 bits of RomEndAddress2 are FFFFh. This register is used for both LPC and SPI flash.

field.name: RomEndAddress2
field.desc: ROM End Address 2. Read-write. Reset: FFFFh. Specifies the upper 16 bits of the end address of the ROM memory address range 2. If the strap is disabled, the reset value is 0h.

field.name: RomStartAddress2
field.desc: ROM Start Address 2. Read-write. Reset: FF00h. Specifies the upper 16 bits of the start address of the ROM memory address range 2. If the strap is disabled, the reset value is 0h.

register.name: AlternativeWideIORngEn
register.desc: Alternative Wide IO Range Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h.

field.name: AlternativeWideIO2RangeEnable
field.desc: Alternative Wide IO 2 Range Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit is similar to bit[AlternativeWideIO0RangeEnable], but it applies to the IO range defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::WideIO2[IOBaseAddress2]. See bit[AlternativeWideIO0RangeEnable] for a detailed description.

field.name: AlternativeWideIO1RangeEnable
field.desc: Alternative Wide IO 1 Range Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit is similar to bit[AlternativeWideIO0RangeEnable], but it applies to the IO range defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::PciIoBaseAddrWideGenPort[IOBaseAddress1]. See bit[AlternativeWideIO0RangeEnable] for a detailed description.

field.name: AlternativeWideIO0RangeEnable
field.desc: Alternative Wide IO 0 Range Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Wide IO range defined by FCH::ITF::LPC::PciIoBaseAddrWideGenPort[IOBaseAddress0] is 512 bytes. 1=The range is 16 bytes. To use this feature, address in FCH::ITF::LPC::PciIoBaseAddrWideGenPort[IOBaseAddress0] must be aligned to 16 bytes, i.e., bits[3:0] must be 0. If the address is not aligned to 16 bytes, the IO range is from address[15:0] to {address[15:4], 0xF}.

field.name: LDRQ0_PD_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable the pull-down of LDRQ0 pad. 1=Enable the pull-down of LDRQ0 pad. LDRQ0_PD_EN.

field.name: LDRQ0_PU_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable the pull-up of LDRQ0 pad. 1=Enable the pull-up of LDRQ0 pad. LDRQ0_PU_EN.

field.name: AllowHostInDma
