field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 3h. GPP0 PCIE clock pins (GPP_CLK0P/GPP_CLK0N) output control by CLKREQ0# pin. GPP_CLK0P/GPP_CLK0N pins are powered off when FCH is strapped to use an external clock, and powered on when FCH is strapped to operate in integrated clock mode. When FCH is in integrated clock mode, GPP0 PCIE clock can be powered off according to the CLK_REQ mapping table below, and the selected CLK_REQ0# input can power off the GPP0 PCIE clock output pins if it is asserted.

field.name: XTAL_REFCLK2X_CLKEN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. REFCLK2X clock enable/disable.

field.name: XTAL_CLKGEN_S5_CLKEN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. CLKGEN_S5 RefClk enable/disable.

field.name: XTAL_CLKGEN_S0_CLKEN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. CLKGEN_S0 RefClk enable/disable.

field.name: CG1_REFDIVSRC_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Description: CG1PLL Refclk Source Select Override. This bit is used to override CG1PLL REFCLK source select. By default, Master_die CG1PLL REFCLK source is from 48 MHz CG_XTAL and Slave_die is 100 MHz from external clock chip.

field.name: RefClk_Source_Switch_Mode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Need to apply a PllRstB for switching different REFCLK source. 1=Switch REFCLK source on-the-fly. For PCIe®/USB3/SATA/UFS/SSIC/GBE/DPLL REFCLK source. It can be from either CG_XTAL/CG_PLL generated or external reference source.

field.name: CG1PLL_SpreadSpectrumEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable Spread Spectrum. 1=Enable CG1_PLL Spread Spectrum.

field.name: CG1PLL_fracn_en_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Used with CG1PLL frac-N and SSC clocking only.

field.name: CG1PLL_fcw0_int_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 000h. CG1PLL Override: Integer portion of Frequency Control Word0 (feedback divisor0).

field.name: CG1PLL_refclk_div_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. CG1PLL Override: Reference clock divisor.

field.name: CG1PLL_fcw1_frac_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. CG1PLL Override: Fractional portion of Frequency Control Word1 (feedback divisor1). Intended to be used with frequency ramping. Also used to step PLL frequency and phase for DFT.

field.name: CG1PLL_fcw_slew_frac_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Description: CG1PLL Override: Sets SSC freq ramp rate. Set fractional change in programmed frequency per REFCLK cycle. e.g., 0.5% downspread SSC at 33.3 KHz and FBDIV=80. FCW_slewrate_frac = (2^16) * 0.00485 * 80 / (15us / 10ns) = 17 Need 31.5kHz and -0.375%.

field.name: CG1PLL_gp_coarse_mant_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. CG1PLL Override: Coarse proportional path FP multiply mantissa.

field.name: GppClk3_ClockBufferDrivingStrengthControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. Drive Strength control for GPP_CLK_3 differential Clock Buffers. Drive strength addition/subtraction relative to IMP_CTRL[4:0]. Default: 3'b001.

field.name: GppClk2_ClockBufferDrivingStrengthControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. Drive Strength control for GPP_CLK_2 differential Clock Buffers. Drive strength addition/subtraction relative to IMP_CTRL[4:0]. Default: 3'b001.

field.name: GppClk1_ClockBufferDrivingStrengthControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. Drive Strength control for GPP_CLK_1 differential Clock Buffers. Drive strength addition/subtraction relative to IMP_CTRL[4:0].

field.name: GppClk0_ClockBufferDrivingStrengthControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. Drive Strength control for GPP_CLK_0 differential Clock Buffers. Drive strength addition/subtraction relative to IMP_CTRL[4:0].

field.name: BlinkClkGateOffEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable B-Link Clock Gate Off function. 1=Enable B-Link Clock Gate Off function. B-Link Clock Gate-Off Enable. Internal B-Link clock has two clock trees: one is a free running clock and the other is a gated clock. When all controllers agree to stop the gated B-Link clock and this bit is set, clock gating logic gates off the clock tree from clock root.

field.name: AlinkClkGateOffEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable A-Link Clock Gate-Off function. 1=Enable A-Link Clock Gate-Off function. A-Link Clock Gate-Off Enable. Internal A-Link clock has two clock trees: one is a free- running clock and the other is a gated clock. When all controllers agree to stop the gated A-Link clock and this bit is set, clock gating logic gates off the clock tree from clock root.

field.name: CG1PLL_fcw1_int_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 000h. CG1PLL Override: Integer portion of Frequency Control Word0. Intended to be used with frequency ramping.

field.name: CG1_cfg_update_req
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Setting this bit requests CG1_PLL to load spread related value into CG1_PLL. The bit is cleared by hardware after the request is sent to CG1_PLL.

field.name: CG1_FBDIV_LoadEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Enable loading CG1_PLL FBDIV value form register.

field.name: USB31_CLK_Source
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=343 MHz. 1=400 MHz. Description: USB31 Host Clock Source (in mission mode). USB31 Host Clock can be 400 MHz or 343 MHz. NOTE: In scan mode, there is a TDR bit that can make the selection. TDR default is 0 to select 400 MHz output.

field.name: USB3_Refclk_Drvier_PWDN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=USB3 REFCLK Driver is turned off in S5/S3 state. USB3 REFCLK Driver (differential) Power-Down in S3/S5.

field.name: OscClkSwitchEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=OSC is 12 MHz (48 MHz CG_XTAL divided by 4). 1=OSC is average 14.318 MHz. When this bit is set, the FCH uses the 48 MHz CG_XTAL to generate the average 14 MHz clock as OSC.

field.name: AZ_48MCLK_PWDN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=AZ 48 MHz Clock output driver is enabled. 1= AZ 48 MHz Clock output driver is disabled. AZ 48 MHz Clock Output Driver PWDN. FCH provides 48 MHz clock for Azalia (AZ) ACP.

field.name: The48MXtal_S0i3_PWDN_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Don't enable CG XTAL pad power down for SOi3. 1=Enable powering down CG XTAL pad in S0i3 state. CG 48 MHz XTAL Pad power down enable when in S0i3 state.

field.name: The48MXtal_S5_PWDN_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Don't enable CG XTAL pad power down for S5. 1=Enable to power down CG XTAL pad in S5 state. CG 48 MHz XTAL Pad power down enable when in S5 state.

field.name: The48MXtal_S3_PWDN_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Description: When XTAL_PAD gets powered down, 48 MHz clock is off. (USB3 wake-up clock, ACP 48 MHz clock, and CGPLL REFCLK are from CG_XTAL directly). CG 48 MHz XTAL Pad power down is enabled when in S3 state, and CG XTAL pad can be powered off in following conditions. 1. S3 State with setting of FCH::MISC::MiscClkCntl1[8] == 1. 2. S5 State with setting of FCH::MISC::MiscClkCntl1[9] == 1. 3. S0i3 State (connected standby state) with setting of FCH::MISC::MiscClkCntl1[10] == 1.

field.name: BP_X48M0_Output_Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. BP_X48M0 Clock Output Enable. This is S0 type clock and is OFF in sleep state. When this bit is set, 48 MHz clock is On regardless of S0A3. Programming this bit to 0 turns off the clock when in S0 state.

field.name: CoreSpeedMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Full speed B-Link clock. 1=Slow speed B-Link clock. Slow down Internal Core Clock (B-Link clock) for power saving.

field.name: BP_X48M0_OutputEn_S0i3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Description: BP_X48M0 Clock Output Enable at S0i3 state. This is S0 type clock and is Off in sleep state. If a platform does not use this clock, it can be disabled by programming FCH::MISC::MiscClkCntl1[BP_X48M0_Output_Enable] = 0. If a platform use this clock, but would like this clock always running at S0 regardless S0i3, then program BP_X48M0_Output_En_SOi3 = 1. If a platform uses this clock and would like to disable this clock when at S0i3 state, then program BP_X48M0_Output_En_SOi3 = 0 (default).

field.name: GPP_CLK5_Driver_Impedance_Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 03h. GPP_CLK5 Driver Impedance Control. Driver impedance control. Controls the number of slices to be turned on.

field.name: GPP_CLK4_Driver_Impedance_Control
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 03h. GPP_CLK4 Driver Impedance Control. Driver impedance control. Controls the number of slices to be turned on.

field.name: LowPowerDisplay400MClkEnB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable low power display 400 MHz clock output. 1=Disable. Non-sticky bit.

field.name: LowPowerDisplay300MClkEnB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable low power display 300 MHz clock output. 1=Disable. Non-sticky bit.

field.name: IdleCount
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXh. This returns the idle count from the latest monitored period.

register.name: MemPwrSavCntrl
register.desc: Memory Power Saving Control. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0006h.

field.name: ABBypassMemDsd
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable memory deep sleep and shutdown features. 1=Disable memory deep sleep and shutdown. AB memory BypassMemdsd control.

field.name: SBGBypassMemDsd
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Enable memory deep sleep and shutdown features. 1=Disable memory deep sleep and shutdown. SBG memory BypassMemdsd control.

field.name: CountEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the internal counter to count the number of oscellator (OSC) clocks. When software is not using this function, it should always set it to 0 to conserve power.

field.name: CountIsValid
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 1=OscCountPerSec is valid. Software should always wait for this bit to be set before reading OscCountPerSec.

field.name: OscCountPerSec
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 000_0000h. Number of OSC clocks per 1 second. Whenever [CountEnable] is set, an internal counter starts counting the number of OSC clocks per second and records the count value here.

field.name: PostCode[31:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000_0000h. BIOS' 32-bit writes to FCH::MISC::PostCode go to this internal 32-bit PostCode Register. Reads from FCH::MISC::PostCode return PostCode[7:0].

field.name: PostCodeStack[31:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: FFFF_FFFFh. 32 deep post code STACK Read out window. Reads get 32 bits of PostCode. Unused bytes return 0s. If Write is full, the oldest data is lost and the new data fills in. When software Reads out of the stack, it Reads from new data to old data and doesn't get flushed. Extra Reads produce duplicate data.

field.name: ClkGenStrap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 0=External clocking mode; Uses 100 MHz differential spread clock as the reference clock. 1=Internal clocking mode; Uses 48 MHz crystal clock as the reference clock.

field.name: ShortResetStrap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Generate short reset.

field.name: UseLpcRomStrap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 0=SPI ROM strap. 1=LPC ROM strap. Use LPC ROM.

field.name: Post_rd_ptr_rst
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Software reset bit for Read pointer. When the new turn of Read is needed, set this bit and the Read pointer goes back for the next cycle's Read.

field.name: DisableAuto
field.desc: Read,Write-1-only. Reset: 0. 1=The entire Auto Transaction logic is disabled. Once this bit is set, it cannot be cleared except by system reset.

field.name: AllowECToAutoTransactEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=IMC cannot write to any of the registers (FCH::MISC::AutoTransactionAllowEC, FCH::MISC::AutoAddrLo, FCH::MISC::AutoAddrHi, FCH::MISC::AutoData) in the Auto Transaction Generation logic. 1=IMC can change any of these registers. Only BIOS can change this bit.

field.name: TransactionType
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. PCI Command type used for this auto transaction. See the PCI specification for PCI command types.

field.name: ByteCount
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: DualAddr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Use single address cycle. 1=Use dual address cycle.

field.name: AutoExecute
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Causes the hardware to execute the transaction defined by bits[7:1]. Writing 1 to this bit causes the hardware to execute the transaction defined by bits[7:1]. Once it is written, this bit stays set until the transaction is completed, in which case it returns to 0.

field.name: AutoAddrLow
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Low address to be used by the FCH::MISC::AutoTransactionAllowEC[AutoExecute] operation. See also FCH::MISC::AutoAddrHi[AutoAddrHigh].

field.name: AutoAddrHigh
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. High address to be used by the FCH::MISC::AutoTransactionAllowEC[AutoExecute] operation. This register is only applicable when FCH::MISC::AutoTransactionAllowEC[DualAddr] == 1. AutoAddr = {AutoAddrHigh,FCH::MISC::AutoAddrLo[AutoAddrLow]}.

field.name: AutoData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. If FCH::MISC::AutoTransactionAllowEC[TransactionType] is Read, this register returns the Read data. If the FCH::MISC::AutoTransactionAllowEC[TransactionType] is a Write command, this register contains the Write data. NOTE: The byte is aligned accordingly.

field.name: CG1PLL_kdco_ratio[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h.

field.name: CG1PLL_lock_timer_13_0_override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. CG1PLL Override: Lock timer control.

field.name: CPU_Refclk_Selection_Override
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Description: CPU REFCLK Selection Override (XOR).

field.name: SMU_100M_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. SMU_100M REFCLK Selection.

field.name: PHY_A3_4_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Description: PHY_A3_4 REFCLK Selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select whether EXT_GPP0_SRC is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: PHY_A2_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Description: PHY_A2 REFCLK Selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select whether EXT_GPP0_SRC is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: PHY_A1_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Description: PHY_A1 REFCLK Selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select whether EXT_GPP0_SRC is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: PHY_A0_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Description: PHY_A0 REFCLK Selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select whether EXT_GPP0_SRC is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: GPP5_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. GPP5 REFCLK selection.

field.name: GPP4_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. GPP4 REFCLK selection.

field.name: GPP3_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. GPP3 REFCLK selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select EXT_GPP0_SRC either is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: GPP2_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. GPP2 REFCLK selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select EXT_GPP0_SRC either is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: GPP1_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. GPP1 REFCLK selection. NOTE: FCH::MISC::CGPLLCntrlReg8[EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL] to select EXT_GPP0_SRC either is from GPP0 external input or GPP0 external input with divide-by-2.

field.name: GPP0_Refclk_Selection
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. GPP0 REFCLK selection.

field.name: EXT_BYPASSCLK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. EXT_BYPASSCLK_EN. Enable/Disable REF_BYPASSCLK external input thru GFX0.

field.name: CLK_CGPLL_EXT_PWDN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. CLK_CGPLL_EXT_PWDN. Enable/Disable CGPLL external REFCLK source thru GPP0 input.

field.name: EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=GPP0 external input. 1=GPP0 external input divided-by- 2. EXT_GPP0_REFCLK_SEL.

field.name: CPU_Refclk_Driver_PWDN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. CPU REFCLK driver power down.

field.name: SMU_100M_Refclk_Driver_PWDN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. SMU_100M REFCLK driver power down.

field.name: PHY_USB3_Refclk_Driver_PWDN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. PHY_USB3 REFCLK driver power down in S0i3.

field.name: IoTrappingAdr1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specify the IO address 1, which causes an SMI event.

field.name: IoTrappingAdr0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specify the IO address 0, which causes an SMI event.

field.name: IoTrappingAdr3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specify the IO address 3, which causes an SMI event.

field.name: IoTrappingAdr2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Specify the IO address 2, which causes an SMI event.

field.name: CfgTrappingAdr0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Specify the configuration address 0, which causes an SMI event.

field.name: CfgTrappingRw0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Trap on configuration Read access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::CfgTrapping0[CfgTrappingAdr0]. 1=Trap on configuration Write access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::CfgTrapping0[CfgTrappingAdr0].

field.name: MemTrappingRdOvr0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Set to 1 to force Read data to be replaced by FCH::MISC::MemRdOvrData0.

field.name: MemTrappingRw0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Trap on memory Read access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::MemTrapping0[MemTrappingAdr0]. 1=Trap on memory Write access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::MemTrapping0[MemTrappingAdr0].

field.name: IoTrappingRw3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Trap on IO Read access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping2IoTrapping3[IoTrappingAdr3]. 1=Trap on IO Write access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping2IoTrapping3[IoTrappingAdr3].

field.name: IoTrappingRw2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Trap on IO Read access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping2IoTrapping3[IoTrappingAdr2]. 1=Trap on IO Write access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping2IoTrapping3[IoTrappingAdr2].

field.name: IoTrappingRw1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Trap on IO Read access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping0IoTrapping1[IoTrappingAdr1]. 1=Trap on IO Write access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping0IoTrapping1[IoTrappingAdr1].

field.name: IoTrappingRw0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Trap on IO Read access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping0IoTrapping1[IoTrappingAdr0]. 1=Trap on IO Write access on the address specified in FCH::MISC::IoTrapping0IoTrapping1[IoTrappingAdr0].

field.name: MemTrappingAdr0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Specify the 30-bit memory address 0 which causes an SMI even. Lowest 2 bits are ignored.

field.name: MemTrappingRData0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. The 32-bit data is used as the return data when the memory Read trapping is enabled in FCH::MISC::MemTrapping0, with FCH::MISC::SMITrappingRwRdOvr[MemTrappingRdOvr0] == 1.

field.name: Spare1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pins.

field.name: Spare0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pins.

field.name: BiasCrtEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pbias should be on in Fast/Fast+. To save power, it can be turned off in I2C Standard Mode.

field.name: RSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: RSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: SpikeRcSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=50ns. 1=20ns. Select RC constant for I2C spike suppression.

field.name: SpikeRcEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable RX spike suppression. Enable spike suppression.

field.name: Slewn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=Enabled. Enable changing strength of pre-driver for fall time compensation.

field.name: FallSlewSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Slew rate.

field.name: PdEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pull-down enable for DDCCLK (PADP).

field.name: I2cRxSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. I2C Receiver select.

field.name: NG
field.desc: N Strength Control. Read-write. Reset: 0h. Init: BIOS,Ch. N Strength control. Software should program to 0Ch for normal drive strength.

field.name: Spare1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pins.

field.name: Spare0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pins.

field.name: BiasCrtEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pbias should be on in Fast/Fast+. To save power, it can be turned off in I2C Standard Mode.

field.name: RSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: RSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: SpikeRcSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=50ns. 1=20ns. Select RC constant for I2C spike suppression.

field.name: SpikeRcEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable RX spike suppression. Enable spike suppression.

field.name: Slewn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=Enabled. Enable changing strength of pre-driver for fall time compensation.

field.name: FallSlewSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Slew rate.

field.name: PdEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pull-down enable for DDCCLK (PADP).

field.name: I2cRxSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. I2C receiver select.

field.name: NG
field.desc: N Strength Control. Read-write. Reset: 0h. Init: BIOS,Ch. N Strength Control. Software should program to 0Ch for normal drive strength.

field.name: Spare1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pins.

field.name: Spare0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pins.

field.name: BiasCrtEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pbias should be on in Fast/Fast+. To save power, it can be turned off in I2C Standard Mode.

field.name: RSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: RSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: SpikeRcSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=50ns. 1=20ns. Select RC constant for I2C spike suppression.

field.name: SpikeRcEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable RX spike suppression. Enable spike suppression.

field.name: Slewn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=Enabled. Enable changing strength of pre-driver for fall time compensation.

field.name: FallSlewSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Slew rate.

field.name: PdEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pull-down enable for DDCCLK (PADP).

field.name: I2cRxSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. I2C receiver select.

field.name: NG
field.desc: N Strength Control. Read-write. Reset: 0h. Init: BIOS,Ch. N Strength Control. Software should program to 0Ch for normal drive strength.

field.name: Spare1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pin.

field.name: Spare0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Spare pin.

field.name: BiasCrtEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pbias should be on in Fast/Fast+. To save power, it can be turned off in I2C Standard Mode.

field.name: RSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: RSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases resistance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel1p1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, increases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: CSel0p9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers. When asserted, decreases capacitance by 10% for all RC timers.

field.name: SpikeRcSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=50ns. 1=20ns. Select RC constant for I2C spike suppression.

field.name: SpikeRcEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable RX spike suppression. Enable spike suppression.

field.name: Slewn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=Enabled. Enable changing strength of pre-driver for fall time compensation.

field.name: FallSlewSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Slew rate.

field.name: PdEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Pull-down enable for DDCCLK (PADP).

field.name: I2cRxSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1h. I2C receiver select.

field.name: NG
field.desc: N Strength Control. Read-write. Reset: 0h. Init: BIOS,Ch. N Strength Control. Software should program to 0Ch for normal drive strength.

field.name: SataPortSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: Port1Sts
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. The selected status of Port 1. This status bit indicates the internal status of SATA port 1.

field.name: Port0Sts
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. The selected status of Port 0. This status bit indicates the internal status of SATA port 0.

field.name: WatchDogTimerBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the WatchDog Timer block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the WatchDog Timer block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Watchdog Timer block clock gating.

field.name: AcDcTmrBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the AcDc Timer block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the AcDc Timer block can't be stopped if not being accessed. AcDc Timer block clock gating.

field.name: BiosRamBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the BIOS RAM block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the BIOS RAM block can't be stopped if not being accessed. BIOS RAM block clock gating.

field.name: HwThrotBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the hardware throttling block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the hardware throttling block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Hardware throttling block clock gating.

field.name: CStateBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the C-State block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the C-State block can't be stopped if not being accessed. C-State block clock gating.

field.name: FusionCBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the FusionC block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the FusionC block can't be stopped if not being accessed. FusionC block clock gating.

field.name: OBFFBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the OBFF block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the OBFF block can't be stopped if not being accessed. OBFF block clock gating.

field.name: Smbus0ClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the SMBUS0 block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the SMBUS0 block can't be stopped if not being accessed. SMBUS0 block clock gating.

field.name: VWClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the Virtual Wire block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the Virtual Wire block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Virtual Wire block clock gating.

field.name: AoacRegBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the AOAC register block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the AOAC register block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Always On Always Connected register block clock gating.

field.name: Pmio2RegBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of PMIO2 register block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the PMIO2 register block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Power Management IO 2 register block clock gating.

field.name: PmioRegBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the PMIO register block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the PMIO register block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Power Management IO register block clock gating.

field.name: MIscRegBlkClkGatingDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The clock of the MISC register block can be stopped if not being accessed. 1=The clock of the MISC register block can't be stopped if not being accessed. Miscellaneous register block clock gating.

field.name: HpetMsiEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Expose MSI capability in HPET Capability register.

field.name: HpetWidthSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=HPET is 32 bits. 1=HPET is 64 bits.

field.name: WatchDogOptions
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Enable for normal WatchDog Timer operation.

field.name: WatchDogFreq
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 3h. Defines the clock frequency used by the WatchDog Timer.

field.name: AsfClkSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Specifies the frequency of ASF master clock.

field.name: SmBus0Sel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Specifies the SMBus port selection. There is only one SMBus engine controlling four SMBus ports. This register routes the SMBus engine to the desired port.

field.name: AsfClkSwitch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Change ASF master clock from RTC (32 kHz) to the clock defined in AsfClkSel.

field.name: AsfClkStretchEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable clock stretching support.

field.name: AsfSmMasterEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable ASF SMBus master function.

field.name: SmbusAsfIoBase
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0Bh. Description: Specifiies SMBus and ASF IO base address. • SMBus IO base={Smbus0AsfIoBase[7:0],0x00}. • ASF IO base={Smbus0AsfIoBase[7:0],0x20}. By default SMBus IO base is 0xB00 and ASF IO base is 0xB20.

field.name: WatchdogTmrEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable IOAPIC memory (FEB0_0000h ~ FEB0_0003h) decoding, and enable WatchDog Timer operation.

field.name: HpetEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable HPET memory (FED0_0000h ~ FED0_01FFh) decoding.

field.name: IoApicEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable IOAPIC memory (FEC0_0000h ~ FEC0_007Fh) decoding.

field.name: SmbusAsfIoEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable SMBus and ASF IO decoding. SMBUS and ASF IO ranges are defined in Smbus0AsfIoBase.

field.name: DmaPort80
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Pass IO ports 0x80, 0x81, 0x82, 0x83 to legacy DMA IO range.

field.name: LegacyDmaIoEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable legacy DMA IO range.

field.name: Cf9IoEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable CF9h IO port decoding.

field.name: LegacyIoEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the following IO decoding as described. Description: 0x20, 0x21, 0xA0, 0xA1 (PIC); 0x40, 0x41, 0x42, 0x43, 0x61 (8254 timer); 0x70, 0x71, 0x72, 0x73 (RTC); 0x92.

field.name: ABClkGateEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=Enabled. Master switch for A-Link and B-Link clock gating.

field.name: DmaEnhanceEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable enhancement of legacy DMA.

field.name: ReadShadow
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Allow to Read PIC ICWX, OCWX registers through IO port 21h and A1h.

field.name: MmioEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. Init: BIOS,1. 1=Enable ACPI MMIO range (FED8_0000h-FED8_1FFFh). MmioEn.

field.name: BiosRamEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable BIOS RAM whose base is FED1_0000h (256 bytes).

field.name: ForceSlpStateRetry
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Send out an SMI message before the completion response of IO writes to FCH::PM::PmCtl[SlpTyp]. This is to be used in conjunction with SMI trapping on writes to FCH::PM::PmCtl[SlpTyp].

field.name: AbStallEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Allows the legacy DMA engine to hold the internal bus before completing legacy DMA transaction on the LPC bus. This is only needed for certain old LPC devices.

field.name: ShutDownOption
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Issue Init message upstream when receiving shutdown message. 1=Generate PCI reset when receiving shutdown message.

field.name: MasterNoWait
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PCI Master waits for Slave idle. 1=ACPI PCI Master doesn't wait for Slave idle when it wants to request bus.

field.name: ExtIntrTime
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Specifies the extended interrupt time in 2 microsecond intervals. This is used for preventing APU from re-entering C-state right away when it just breaks out from a C-state.

field.name: BlockAcpiS5IntrSt
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Block ACPI S5 interrupt.

field.name: PicApicArbiter
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable arbitration between PIC request and IOAPIC request.

field.name: ForceSmafMatch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable STPGNT message matching to the expected SMAF.

field.name: NmiMsgSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Encode NMI request as legacy PIC NMI message type. 1=NMI request as NMI message type.

field.name: PicMsgSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Encode PIC interrupt request as Legacy PIC external interrupt (ExtInt) message type. 1=Encode PIC interrupt request as external interrupt (ExtInt) message type.

field.name: MsgIntrEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Deliver legacy PIC interrupt as message type.

field.name: MaskMsgBmStsEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Set to 1 to enable A20#, IGNNE#, INIT#, NMI, SMI# message delivery.

field.name: ToggleAllPwrGoodOnCf9
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Init: BIOS,1. 0=During CF9 reset, PG1_PwrGood stays high; PG1a_PwrGood, PG2_PwrGood and Xhc_PwrGood behavior depend on TogglePG1aPG2PGXhcOnCf9 bit during CF9 reset. 1=De-assert and then assert all PwrGood signals (for PG1, PG1a, PG2 and XHC) during CF9 reset.

field.name: eSPIDevIntrMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FF_FFFFh. Set these bits to mask of eSPI Device IRQ[23:0].

field.name: BootTmrDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. Init: BIOS,1. 1=Boot timer is stopped. Once set it to 1, timer will reset back to 0. When this bit is set back to 0, timer starts counting from 0. This bit will clear itself on any reset (this bit is non-sticky).

field.name: FailBootRstSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: Cold,0. 0=Boot timer has not been fired. 1=Boot timer has been fired. Write-1-to-clear it to 0.

field.name: ExpireBootTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Force boot timer to expire; then, NB PwrGood can be asserted.

field.name: BootTmrStopOnGAlink
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,1. Init: BIOS,0. 0=Enable the boot timer to ensure a good boot. 1=Boot timer stops when FCH observes a good boot after PCI reset or S3/S4/S5 resume. BootTmrStopOnGAlink.

field.name: BootTmrFuncEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,1. Init: BIOS,1. 0=Disable boot timer function. 1=Enable boot timer function. The boot timer will start to count down and toggle NBPwrGood after 1.26s (2**24/(66.6M/5)) if software has not set ExpireBootTmr = 1 after PCI reset or resuming from S3/S4/S5, This bit is persistent through any reset or sleep (this bit is sticky).

field.name: FailBootTimer
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Cold,000_0000h. Description: Specifies the counter of APU boot timer (66.6 MHz/5), which starts counting when the following

field.name: PG1PwrDownDlyTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 59h. PG1 Power Down delay timer.

field.name: XhcPwrEnDlyTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 35h. XHC Power Enable delay timer.

field.name: PG2PwrEnDlyTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 2Bh. PG2 Power Enable delay timer.

field.name: PG1aPwrEnDlyTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 21h. PG1a Power En delay timer.

field.name: I2C5InputThresholdHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Low threshold. 1=High threshold. Configure I2C5 input threshold.

field.name: I2C4InputThresholdHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Low threshold. 1=High threshold. Configure I2C4 input threshold.

field.name: I2C3InputThresholdHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Low threshold. 1=High threshold. Configure I2C3 input threshold.

field.name: I2C2InputThresholdHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Low threshold. 1=High threshold. Configure I2C2 input threshold.

field.name: I2C1InputThresholdHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Low threshold. 1=High threshold. Configure I2C1 input threshold.

field.name: I2C0InputThresholdHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Low threshold. 1=High threshold. Configure I2C0 input threshold.

field.name: ApuPllRstBTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 3Fh. Configure the PllLock assertion time. Unit is 16 usec.

field.name: ApuPllPwrRstBTmr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 3Eh. Configure the PllRstB de-assertion time. Unit is 16 usec.

field.name: SerialIrqEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable the serial IRQ function.

field.name: SerIrqMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Continuous mode. 1=Active (quiet) mode.

field.name: NumSerIrqBits
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0h. Description: Specifies the total number of serial IRQs. The serial IRQ can support 15 IRQ#, SMI#, IOCHK#, INTA#, INTB#, INTC#, and INTD#.

field.name: NumStartBits
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0h. This field specifies the number of clocks in the start frame. Start Frame Width = 4 + 2 * NumStartBits.

field.name: ExtraRtcCmosEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 0=Access to the extra RTC CMOS RAM space is disabled. 1=Software can access the extra 16 bytes of RTC CMOS RAM through FCH::IO::AltRTCAddrPort and FCH::IO::AltRTCDataPort; The extra RAM spaces are located at index 0x00-0x03, 0x40-0x43, 0x80-0x83, 0xC0-0xC3.

field.name: AltCmosMapEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=When accessing the RTC CMOS RAM through FCH::IO::RtcAddrPortNmiMask and FCH::IO::RtcDataPort, Bank 1 of CMOS RAM is changed: Index[0Dh:00h] still returns the time and alarm settings; Index[7Fh:0Eh] returns the absolute offset[FFh:8Eh] which maps to the extended RAM space.

field.name: CenturyEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,1. 1=Enable RTC Century support.

field.name: MaskRtcClkOut
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Disable RtcClk output.

field.name: RtcClkDrive
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,1. 0=HIGHDRIVE is tied low for RtcClkOut pad. 1=HIGHDRIVE is tied high for RtcClkOut pad.

field.name: RtcProtectC0_CF
field.desc: Write-once. Reset: Cold,0. 1=RTC RAM index[CFh:C0h] are locked from Read/Write.

field.name: RtcProtectD0_DF
field.desc: Write-once. Reset: Cold,0. 1=RTC RAM index[DFh:D0h] are locked from Read/Write.

field.name: RtcProtectE0_EF
field.desc: Write-once. Reset: Cold,0. 1=RTC RAM index[EFh:E0h] are locked from Read/Write.

field.name: RtcProtectF0_FF
field.desc: Write-once. Reset: Cold,0. 1=RTC RAM index[FFh:F0h] are locked from Read/Write.

field.name: RtcProtect38_3F
field.desc: Write-once. Reset: Cold,0. 1=RTC RAM index[3Fh:38h] are locked from Read/Write.

field.name: VRT_T1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,01h. This field specifies the time of VRT_Enable being high for RTC battery monitor circuit in milliseconds. To conserve power, the RTC battery is sampled periodically for checking its state of health. VRT_T1 and FCH::PM::VRT_T2[VRT_T2] make up the interval of the checking. When VRT_Enable is high, the battery is being sampled. When VRT_Enable is low, the battery is not being sampled.

field.name: VRT_T2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,FFh. This field specifies the time of VRT_Enable being low for the RTC battery monitor circuit in 4 ms increments. See FCH::PM::VRT_T1 for detailed description.

register.name: RTCShadow
register.desc: RTC Shadow. Read-write. Reset: Cold,00h. NOTE: These four bits don't have any default value. After power on, their values are undetermined. Software has to program PwrFailShadow to give them values.

field.name: PwrFailShadow
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0h. Init: BIOS,4h. Power Fail Shadow.

field.name: AllowWakeS3En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Allow LLB# as wake event in S3. Description: NOTE: LLB (Low low battery) event should trigger an SCI if system is in S0. It should block wake-

field.name: UseAsWakeEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Treat LLB# as wake event.

field.name: BlockWakeEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Block wake event if LLB# is asserted; if (UseAsWakeEn == 1) && (AllowWakeS3En == 1), LLB# and other wake events can wake the system up from S3.

field.name: Index
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,XXh. Specifies the offset of the RTC Extended Register to be Read or Written from FCH::PM::RTCExtData.

field.name: Data
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,XXh. Specifies the Read data or Write data of the RTC Extended Register.

field.name: AcpiPm1EvtBlk
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0000h. Specifies the 16-bit IO range base address[15:2] of the ACPI power management event block.

field.name: AcpiPm1CntBlk
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0200h. Specifies the 16-bit IO base address[15:1] of the ACPI power management control block.

field.name: AcpiPmTmrBlk
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0000h. Specifies the 16-bit IO base address[15:1] of the ACPI power management timer block.

field.name: CpuControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0000h. These bits define the least significant byte of the 16 bit I/O base address of the ACPI power management APU Control block. Bit 3 corresponds to Addr[3] and bit 7 corresponds to Addr[7]. Addr[2:0] are ignored because this register is 6 byte long.

field.name: AcpiGpe0Blk
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0000h. Specifies the 16-bit IO base address[15:2] of the ACPI power management general purpose event block.

field.name: AcpiSmiCmd
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,00B0h. Defines the 16-bit IO base address[15:0] of the ACPI SMI command block.

field.name: AcpiPm2CntBlk
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0000h. Defines the 16-bit IO base address[15:0] of the ACPI power management additional control block.

field.name: RtcWakeAlarm
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 0=Use FCH::IO::RTCC[IRQF] as one of the system wake-up events if IRQF is enabled. 1=Use FCH::IO::RTCC[AF] as one of the system wake-up events if AF is enabled. RTC wake alarm.

field.name: PcieGeventMap
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,1. 1=Route PME message from NB to GEVENT 24, hot plug message from APU to GEVENT 7.

field.name: WakePinAsGevent
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Treat WAKE# pin as GEVENT input.

field.name: PcieWakMask
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Disable the PCIE_WAK_STS and PCIE_WAK_DIS function defined in FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[PciExpWakeStatus] and FCH::PM::Pm1En[PciExpWakeDis].

field.name: PcieNative
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Block PCIe® GPP PME message and hot plug message from generating SCI.

field.name: RstUSBS5
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 0=De-assert Cpl_VDDCR_S5_RESETn = 1. 1=Make Cpl_VDDCR_S5_RESETn = 0 to reset USB, MP2, etc.

field.name: AcpiReducedHwEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=ACPI fixed register interface is enabled. 1=The decoding of ACPI fixed registers and SCI are disabled; In addition, wake function from AcpiPmEvtBlk is disabled as well.

field.name: PwnBtnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable power button support in AcpiPmEvtBlk block.

field.name: BiosRls
field.desc: Read,Write-1-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Writing 1 to this bit generates SMI, NMI or IRQ13 depending on FCH::SMI::SmiCtl4[Smicontrol73].

field.name: TmrEnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Enable the TMR_EN function defined in FCH::PM::Pm1En[TmrEn].

field.name: RtcEnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Enable the RTC_EN function defined in FCH::PM::Pm1En[RtcEn].

field.name: GblEnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Enable the GBL_EN function defined in FCH::PM::Pm1En[GblEn].

field.name: DecEnAcpi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Cold,0. 1=Enable decoding of the standard ACPI registers.

field.name: C1eToC3En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Put APU into C3 state in C1e state. Software needs to program C1eToC3En = 1.

field.name: C1eToC2En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Put APU into C2 state in C1e state.

field.name: SlpEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable LDTSTOP# as an output.

field.name: DlySlpEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Delay recognition of STPGNT# until there is no pending Read in AB.

field.name: FusionSerrEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=FCH C-state coordination logic causes CPU to exit from C-state when there is a system error within the FCH.

field.name: FusionPerrEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=FCH C-state coordination logic causes CPU to exit from C-state when there is a parity error within the FCH.

field.name: TimerTickChgMsgEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=FCH sends a message to APU indicating the latest periodic timer interval. FCH automatically determines which timer (PIT, RTC, or HPET) is being used.

field.name: BattModeChgMsgEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=FCH automatically sends a message to CPU indicating the power mode (AC vs battery); In addition, every time it is changed, FCH generates a message to indicate the update.

field.name: VW_Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=The state machine is disabled. 1=The state machine is enabled. Description: This bit enables the VirtualWire function. It is possible that Virtual Wire state machine is sending Virtual Wire messages when software clears the VW_Enable bit. In that case, finish Virtual Wire message delivery first and then disable Virtual Wire state machine. Reading VW_Enable bit returns the current state of Virtual Wire state machine.

field.name: VW_InvValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Normal polarity. 1=Inverted polarity. This is to change the polarity of the virtual wire value bit in the message.

field.name: VW_SrcActiveLow
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: FF_CEF8h. Each bit configures polarity of the corresponding interrupt wires. These 24 interrupt wires are connected to IOAPIC input and virtual wire input.

field.name: DeferTimerTickValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: ForceTmrTickEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=If (DeferTimerTickEn == 1) && FCH has skipped a timer tick interrupt, FCH immediately generates the timer tick interrupt upon C-state exit.

field.name: DeferTimerTickEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=FCH skips a number of timer tick interrupts based on the value defined in DeterTimeTickValue when CPU is in C-state. When CPU is not in C-state, the FCH does not skip any timer tick interrupt.

field.name: ClkGateCntrl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 2h. These two bits control whether SMBUS module allows clock gating to the internal 66 MHz core clock.

field.name: ClkRunDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Disable this module's ability to support CLKRUN# function from PCIBridge; In other words, this module prevents PCIBridge from stopping the 33 MHz clock. Legacy DMA and serial IRQ logic reside in this module and they are running on the 33 MHz LPCCLK.

field.name: MaskPmeMsgEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=If (PmeMsgEn == 1), PmeAck messages are ignored and ACPI S- state logic solely uses the timeout mechanism to sequence through the S3 state.

field.name: WakePinEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable wake up from WAKE# pin. WAKE# pin enable.

field.name: LongSLPS3
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Extend SLP_S3# assertion to 1 s minimum.

field.name: Therm2SecDelay
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable 2 second delay for thermal clock throttle. This bit affects both hardware and software throttle.

field.name: NoWaitStpGntEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Wait for STPGNT after asserting STPCLK. 1=Do not wait for STPGNT after asserting STPCLK. This bit affects both hardware and software throttle.

field.name: ThermThrotPeriod
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=30 us. 1=244 us. Specifies the clock throttle period for hardware thermal throttle.

field.name: ThrottleControl[3]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable hardware thermal clock throttle. See ThrottleControl[2:0].

field.name: ThrottleControl[2:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Specifies the throttle interval for STPCLK de-assertion in hardware thermal clock throttle.

field.name: RstToCpuPwrGdEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=FCH toggles CpuPwrGd on every reset.

field.name: HwmResetOption
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Hwm function is reset by RsmRst. 1=Hwm function is reset by PciRst.

field.name: SlpTypeControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=FCH::PM::PmCtl[SlpTypeEn] bit has no effect. 1=Enable the function of FCH::PM::PmCtl[SlpTypeEn].

field.name: KbRstEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable KBRST# pin to trigger keyboard reset.

field.name: CpuRstControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: KbPciRstEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Make PCI reset during keyboard reset, which can be triggered by KBRST# pin or IMC. This bit must not be programmed by the software. It should be left with the power up default value of 1.

field.name: SoftResetEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Block any reset request until the system is not in C state.

register.name: S5ResetStat
register.desc: S5/Reset Status. Reset: 0000_0800h. This register shows the source of previous reset.

field.name: SyncFlood
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System reset was caused by a SYNC_FLOOD event which was due to an UE error or caused by a SHUTDOWN command from CPU if FCH::PM::PciCtl[ShutDownOption]. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: RemoteResetFromASF
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System reset was caused by a remote RESET command from ASF. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: WatchdogIssueReset
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: FailBootRst
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: KbReset
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System reset was caused by assertion of KB_RST_L. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: SleepReset
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Reset status from Sleep state (s0i3, S3, S4 or S5) transition. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: Do_k8_Reset
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System reset was caused by CF9 = 0x06. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: Do_k8_Init
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System reset was caused by CF9 = 0x04. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: SoftPciRst
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System reset was caused by writing to FCH::PM::ResetCmd[Reset]. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: UserRst
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Last reset was caused by BP_SYS_RST_L assertion. Bits[27:16] will be cleared by the last reset event, except the associated bit will be set.

field.name: PmeTurnOffTime
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: IntThermalTrip
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System was shutdown due to an internal ThermalTrip event.

field.name: RemotePowerDownFromASF
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. SOC has received a remote Power Off command from ASF.

field.name: Shutdown
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System was shutdown due to ShutDown event (SHUTDOWN# pin).

field.name: FourSecondPwrBtn
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System was shutdown due to 4s PwrButton event.

field.name: ThermalTrip
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. System was shutdown due to BP_THERMTRIP_L assertion.

field.name: ResetEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Writing to bit [Reset] is not allowed. 1=Writing to bit [Reset] is allowed.

field.name: ResetAllAcpi
field.desc: Write-1-only. Reset: 0. Writing 1 to this bit emulates a reset button event.

field.name: ResetButtonEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable Reset button. 1=Enable Reset button. 1=Reset from reset button (SYS_RESET_L) will generate S5Reset. 0=Disable SYS_RESET_L to generate S5Reset, which can be used as GEVENT19/GPIO1.

field.name: ResetPcie
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Release the PCIe® reset. 1=Reset the GPP ports. Set to 1 to reset GPP ports.

field.name: UsrRst2Pll
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Stop the PLL when the reset button is pressed.

field.name: SelectDebug
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Select FCH::PM::S5ResetStat to be S5/Reset Status register. 1=Select FCH::PM::S5ResetStat to be a debug status register.

field.name: MemRstDisable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The memory reset function at DDR_RST# pin is disabled.

field.name: Reset
field.desc: Write-1-only. Reset: 0. Writing 1 to this bit causes a PCI reset. This bit is enabled by the [ResetEn] bit.

field.name: FullRst
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Assert reset signals only. 1=Place system in S5 state for 3 to 5 seconds.

field.name: RstCmd
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. Write to 1 to generate reset as specified by bits [FullRst] and [SysRst]. Always Read as 0.

field.name: SysRst
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Send INIT HT message. 1=Reset as specified by [FullRst].

field.name: ClkIntrVectorOrd
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the value used to identify the clock interrupt.

field.name: ClkIntrVectorOrdEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The system timer interrupt in the IOAPIC is tagged with a value defined by [ClkIntrVectorOrd].

field.name: UseCpuRst
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=System reset causes INIT# instead of CPURST#.

field.name: UseBypassRom
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Override the ROM straps and use BypassRomSel to determine which type of ROM to use. This is for BIOS debugging purposes or for systems having multiple BIOSes on board.

field.name: BypassRomSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. These two bits override the two ROM strap pins if [UseBypassRom] == 1.

field.name: HideSmbus
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Hide the SMBUS PCI configuration space and promote LPC bridge PCI configuration space to function 0.

field.name: IdChangeEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Allow the software to change.

field.name: S5ResetOverride
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Mask off internet PCI reset used in ACPI.

field.name: WriteBackEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The WakeOnRing status bit is written back to HD audio controller upon system power up.

field.name: LlbEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=LLB function is enabled and system won't wake up from ACPI S-State until LLB# is de-asserted.

field.name: TempPolarity
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Temperature polarity control for THRMTRIP and TALERT respectively.

field.name: DisablePciRom
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Disable PCI from strap.

field.name: TwarnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Enable TALERT# pin.

field.name: TDeadEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=GEVENT2 takes up the THRMTRIP function; When THRMTRIP pin is low and [TFatalEn] is set, hardware switches the system to S5 automatically.

field.name: TFatalEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable both the soft PciRst and the THRMTRIP function.

field.name: CpuIoPullDownDrvStrength
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The integrated pull-down drive strength of all CPU IOs are increased by 50%.

field.name: AssertLdtRstB
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Assert LDT_RST# low.

field.name: Alt_addr_width_sel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Alternate address is 32-bit width. 1=Alternate address is 64-bit width.

field.name: Alt_addr_en
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Alternate address disable. 1=Alternate address enable.

field.name: Lower_addr_alt
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Lower bits of base address. Its value only takes effect when alternate address is enabled (FCH::PM::AltAcpiMmioEn[Alt_addr_en] == 1). For example, when it is set as 0xABCD and alternate address width is 32-bit (FCH::PM::AltAcpiMmioEn[Alt_addr_width_sel] == 0), base address is 0xABCD_0000. If it is 64-bit then the base address is 0xFFFF_FFFF_ ABCD_0000.

field.name: Pmio_xDC_SataConfig
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Used by Sata DEVSLP. This register only reset by RsmRstB or UserRstB, BIOS need to clear this register to 0x0 after Warm Reset so that device can response with SATA controller's OOB.

field.name: ABRegBar
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. IO Base address of AB Configuration Registers.

field.name: BlinkControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. This field controls the BLINK pin behavior. BLINK pin can be used to control the on-off state of an LED on the board.

field.name: AbNoBypassEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Init: BIOS,1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Signals the A-Link that the LPC cycle should not be bypassed when a retry has timed out.

field.name: LpcEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable LPC bridge.

field.name: TraceMemoryBaseAddr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 000h. The base address of trace memory. It is 1M memory space.

field.name: TraceMemoryEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable trace memory decoding. 1=Enable trace memory decoding. Set to 1 to enable trace memory decoding.

field.name: TwoRampAlgorithmEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=The two ramp fan control algorithm is enabled.

field.name: FanInputControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 5h.

field.name: TwoRampAlgorithmEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=The two ramp fan control algorithm is enabled.

field.name: FanInputControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 5h.

register.name: Fan0Ctl
register.desc: Fan0Control. Read-write. Reset: 00h. When [AutoMode] == 1, the active duty cycle is controlled by the hardware automatically. • If ActualTemperature < LowTemp{FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Lo}, DutyCycle = 0; • If LowTemp{FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Lo} <= ActualTemperature < MedTemp{FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Lo}, DutyCycle = FCH::PM2::LoDuty0[LowDuty0]. • If MedTemp{FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Lo} <= ActualTemperature < HighTemp{FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Lo}, • If [LinearMode] == 0, DutyCycle = FCH::PM2::MedDuty0[MedDuty]. • If [LinearMode] == 1, DutyCycle = ((ActualTemperature - LowTemp{FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Lo }) * (FCH::PM2::Multiplier0[Multiplier] + 1) >> FCH::PM2::Multiplier0[DutySel]) + FCH::PM2::LoDuty0[LowDuty0]. • If ActualTemperature >= HighTemp{FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Lo}, DutyCycle = 100%. In Automode, the hysteresis limit defined by FCH::PM2::LinearRng0 is applied to keep the fan from oscillating erratically.

field.name: LinearAdjust
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the additional offset to effective duty cycle under linear mode.

field.name: FanPolarity
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=FanOut0 drives low. 1=FanOut0 drives high.

field.name: LinearMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Use step function. 1=Use Linear function. See above description for details.

field.name: AutoMode
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=FanOut0 is controlled by FCH::PM2::LoDuty0. 1=FanOut0 is controlled by the temperature input. See the above description for details on AutoMode.

field.name: FanFreq
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Normally, 4-wire fan runs at 25 KHz and 3-wire fan runs at 100 Hz. FanOut0 frequency is programmed as follows.

field.name: LowDuty0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies Fan0 duty number if (LowTemp{FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Hi, FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Lo} <= temperature < MedTemp{FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Hi, FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Lo}).There are 256 time slots in one fan cycle. Duty number N represents the (N+1)th time slot. Fan actively spins in time slot 0 ~ slot N, and stops from slot (N+1) ~ slot 255.

field.name: MedDuty
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies Fan0 duty number using step function if (MedTemp{FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Hi,FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Lo} <= temperature <= HighTemp{FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Hi, FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Lo}). There are 256 time slots in one fan cycle. Duty number N represents the (N+1)th time slot. Fan actively spins in time slot0 ~ slotN, and stops from slot (N+1) ~ slot255.

register.name: Multiplier0
register.desc: Multiplier0. Read-write. Reset: 00h. • HighTemp0[15:0] = {FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Hi[HighTemp0[15:8]],FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Lo[HighTemp0[7:0]]}. • Hysteresis0[15:0] = FCH::PM2::Fan0Hysteresis[HysteresisHi,HysteresisLo]. • Med2Temp0[15:0] = {FCH::PM2::Med2Temp0Hi[Med2Temp0[15:8]],FCH::PM2::Med2Temp0Lo[Med2Temp0[7:0]]}. • SlopeHi[7:2] are the integer bits and SlopeHi[1:0] are the fractional bits of the ramp slope. • BIOS has to calculate SlopeHi[7:0] using the following equation: • SlopeHi = (16'hFF00 – {FCH::PM2::Med2Duty0[Med2Duty0[7:0]], 8'b0}) / (HighTemp0[15:0] – Hysteresis0[15:0] – Med2Temp0[15:0]) For example, if our setting is: • Med2Duty0[7:0] = 25% = 40h • HighTemp0[15:0] = 90°C = 5A00h • Med2Temp0[15:0] = 40°C = 2800h • Hysteresis0[15:0] = 10°C = 0A00h Then: • SlopeHi = (FF00h – 4000h ) / ( 5A00h – 0A00h – 2800h ) = 48896 / 10240 = 4.775 Converting the number 4.775 into the 8-bit format: 00010011 (13h), BIOS should program the Multiplier0 register as 13h in this example.

field.name: DutySel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. When Fan0 is programmed in AutoMode with linear function being selected, this field selects part of duty to be fed into fan as described in FCH::PM2::Fan0Ctl register description. When Fan0 is programmed in TwoRamp mode, this field specifies the upper 2 bits in Slope[7:0]. See the above register description for detail.

field.name: Multiplier
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. When Fan0 is programmed in AutoMode with linear function being selected, this field specifies the factor to calculate duty number as described in FCH::PM2::Fan0Ctl register description. When Fan0 is programmed in TwoRamp mode, this field specifies the lower 6 bits in Slope[7:0]. See the above register description for detail.

field.name: LowTemp0[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of the low temperature threshold. See also FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Hi[LowTemp0[15:8]].

field.name: LowTemp0[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of the low temperature threshold. LowTemp0 = {LowTemp0[15:8],FCH::PM2::LoTemp0Lo[LowTemp0[7:0]]}.

field.name: MedTemp0[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of the medium temperature threshold. See also FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Hi[MedTemp0[15:8]].

field.name: MedTemp0[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of the medium temperature threshold. MedTemp0 = {MedTemp0[15:8],FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Lo[MedTemp0[7:0]]}.

field.name: HighTemp0[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of the high temperature threshold. See also FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Hi[HighTemp0[15:8]].

field.name: HighTemp0[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of the high temperature threshold. HighTemp0 = {HighTemp0[15:8],FCH::PM2::HiTemp0Lo[HighTemp0[7:0]]}.

field.name: LinearRange
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies a variable range that Fan0 can tolerate. Fan0 is not affected if temperature varies within this range.

field.name: LinearHoldCount
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the fan cycles to wait before the duty cycle can be changed.

field.name: HysteresisHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the hysteresis value (in temperature) of the Two Ramp Fan Control Algorithm. The unit is °C. See FCH::PM2::Multiplier0 on how to program this register.

field.name: HysteresisLo
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This byte should always be programmed as 0.

field.name: Med2Temp0[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IF (FCH::PM2::Fan0InCtl[TwoRampAlgorithmEn] == 1) THEN It specifies the lower byte of the temperature value of the turning point on the ramp. See also FCH::PM2::Med2Temp0Hi[Med2Temp0[15:8]]. ELSE Unused. ENDIF.

field.name: Med2Temp0[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IF (FCH::PM2::Fan0InCtl[TwoRampAlgorithmEn] == 1) THEN It specifies the higher byte of the temperature value of the turning point on the ramp. Med2Temp0 = {Med2Temp0[15:8],FCH::PM2::Med2Temp0Lo[Med2Temp0[7:0]]}. ELSE Unused. ENDIF.

field.name: Med2Duty0[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IF (FCH::PM2::Fan0InCtl[TwoRampAlgorithmEn] == 1) THEN It specifies the fan duty value of the turning point on the ramp. ELSE Unused. ENDIF.

register.name: Multiplier20
register.desc: Multiplier2_0. Read-write. Reset: 00h. • MedTemp0[15:0] = {FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Hi[MedTemp0[15:8]],FCH::PM2::MedTemp0Lo[MedTemp0[7:0]]}. • Med2Temp0[15:0] = {FCH::PM2::Med2Temp0Hi[Med2Temp0[15:8]],FCH::PM2::Med2Temp0Lo[Med2Temp0[7:0]]}. • Multiplier2_0[7:2] are the integer bits and Multiplier2_0[1:0] are the fractional bits of the ramp slope. • BIOS has to calculate Multiplier2_0[7:0] using the following equation: • Multiplier2_0 = ({FCH::PM2::Med2Duty0[Med2Duty0[7:0]], 8'b0} – {FCH::PM2::LoDuty0[LowDuty0[7:0]], 8'b0}) / (Med2Temp0[15:0] – MedTemp0[15:0]) For example, if our setting is: • Med2Duty0[7:0] = 50% = 80h • LowDuty0[7:0] = 25% = 40h • Med2Temp0[15:0] = 70°C = 4600h • MedTemp0[15:0] = 40°C = 2800h Then: • Multiplier2_0 = (8000h – 4000h ) / ( 4600h – 2800h ) = 16384 / 7680 = 2.133 Converting the number 2.133 into the 8-bit format: 00001000b (08h), BIOS should program Multiplier20 register to 08h in this example.

field.name: Multiplier2_0[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. IF (FCH::PM2::Fan0InCtl[TwoRampAlgorithmEn] == 1) THEN Specifies the slope value of ramp1lo and ramp0lo in Fan Control Algorithm. Bits[7:2] are integer bits. Bits[1:0] are fractional bits. ELSE Unused. ENDIF.

field.name: Fan0SpeedTooSlow
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=Fan0 runs slower than the value in the Fan0SpeedLimit{FCH::PM2::Fan0SpeedLimitHi, FCH::PM2::Fan0SpeedLimitLo}. Fan0 speed too slow.

field.name: Fan0INTRoute
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: LinearRangeOutLimit[4:1]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. LinearRangeOutLimit[7:0] = {000b, LinearRangeOutLimit[4:1], 1b}. LinearRangeOutLimit specifies how close the fan duty follows the target duty cycle and is only used when the fan duty is changing. It is different from the FCH::PM2::LinearRng0, which works like a hysteresis and used when fan duty is not changing.

field.name: FanLinearEnhanceEn2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The positive hysteresis of fan duty is removed; FCH::PM2::LinearRng0 only applies to the negative direction; as a result, the fan duty increases once the temperature is increased instead of waiting for a hysteresis.

field.name: SampleFreqDiv
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. This field specifies the sampling rate of Fan Speed.

field.name: FanDebounceCounter[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of the debounce counter when measuring fan speed. See also FCH::PM2::FanDebounceCtrHi[FanDebounceCounter[15:8]].

field.name: FanDebounceCounter[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the high 8 bits of the debounce counter when measuring fan speed. FanDebounceCounter = {FanDebounceCounter[15:8],FCH::PM2::FanDebounceCtrLo[FanDebounceCounter[7:0]]}.

field.name: ShutDownEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The system is shutdown if FCH::PM2::FanStat[Fan0SpeedTooSlow] remains 1 for more than 4 seconds.

field.name: UseAverage
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Do not use average fan0 speed. 1=Use average fan0 speed.

field.name: FanDetectorEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable fan0 speed measurement. 1=Enable fan0 speed measurement.

field.name: FanSpeedLimit[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of Fan0SpeedLimit. See also FCH::PM2::Fan0SpeedLimitHi[FanSpeedLimit[15:8]].

field.name: FanSpeedLimit[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of Fan0SpeedLimit. FanSpeedLimit = {FanSpeedLimit[15:8],FCH::PM2::Fan0SpeedLimitLo[FanSpeedLimit[7:0]]}.

field.name: FanSpeed[7:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of fan0 speed. See also FCH::PM2::Fan0SpeedHi[FanSpeed[15:8]].

field.name: FanSpeed[15:8]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of fan0 speed. FanSpeed = {FanSpeed[15:8],FCH::PM2::Fan0SpeedLo[FanSpeed[7:0]]}.

field.name: TempTsi[7:0]
field.desc: Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of TempTsi. See also FCH::PM2::TempTsiHi[TempTsi[15:8]]. AccessType: FCH::PM2::TempTsiWe[TempTsiWe] ? Read-write,Volatile : Read-only,Volatile.

field.name: TempTsi[15:8]
field.desc: Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of TempTsi. TempTsi = {TempTsi[15:8],FCH::PM2::TempTsiLo[TempTsi[7:0]]}. AccessType: FCH::PM2::TempTsiWe[TempTsiWe] ? Read-write,Volatile : Read-only,Volatile.

field.name: TempTsiLimit[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the lower 8 bits of TempTsiLimit. See FCH::PM2::TempTsiLimitHi[TempTsiLimit[15:8]].

field.name: TempTsiLimit[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Specifies the higher 8 bits of TempTsiLimit. TempTsiLimit[15:0] = {TempTsiLimit[15:8],FCH::PM2::TempTsiLimitLo[TempTsiLimit[7:0]]}.

register.name: TempTsiChangeLimit
register.desc: TempTsiChangeLimit. Read-write. Reset: 00h. If (TempTsiChangeLimit != 0), filtering is applied to TempTsi{FCH::PM2::TempTsiHi, FCH::PM2::TempTsiLo} as below: • If TempTsi_New > (TempTsi_Old + (TempTsiChangeLimit<<6)), then … (Action to take.) • If TempTsi_New < (TempTsi_Old - (TempTsiChangeLimit<<6)), then … (Action to take.) • If (Temp_Old - (TempTsiChangLimit<<6)) <= TempTsi_New <= (TempTsi_Old + (TempChangeLimit<<6)), then … (Action to take.)

field.name: TempTsiChangeLimit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Limit of the chance seen by the temperature sensor to be used when defining actions to be taken on temperature changes.

field.name: TempTsiWe
field.desc: TempTsi Write Enable. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=TempTsi registers, FCH::PM2::TempTsiHi and FCH::PM2::TempTsiLo, are Read-only and updated by hardware with the result from TempTsi sensor. 1=TempTsi registers are Writable only by host and IMC; they are not updated by hardware with the result from the TempTsi sensor.

field.name: TempTsiStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=TempTsi{FCH::PM2::TempTsiHi, FCH::PM2::TempTsiLo} is out of the limit.

field.name: TempTsiControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. TempTsi sensor is enabled if (TempTsiControl != 0).

field.name: TempTsiINTRoute
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h.

field.name: TempTsiRstSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Thermal diode monitoring function is not stopped by reset.

field.name: ThermalTripStatus
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Current temperature is not above ThermalTripLimit. 1=Current temperature is above ThermalTripLimit.

field.name: AlertStatus
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Current temperature is not above AlertLimit. 1=Current temperature is above AlertLimit.

field.name: AlertLimit[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Thermal alert limit lower 8 bits. See also FCH::PM2::AlertLimitHi[AlertLimit[15:8]].

field.name: AlertLimit[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Thermal alert limit upper 8 bits. AlertLimit[15:0] = {AlertLimit[15:8],FCH::PM2::AlertLimitLo[AlertLimit[7:0]]}.

field.name: ThermalTripLimit[7:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Thermal trip limit to enable system shutdown. Lower 8 bit of the trip limit. See also FCH::PM2::ThermTripLimitHi[ThermalTripLimit[15:8]].

field.name: ThermalTripLimit[15:8]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Thermal trip limit upper 8 bits. ThermalTripLimit[15:0] = {ThermalTripLimit[15:8],FCH::PM2::ThermTripLimitLo[ThermalTripLimit[7:0]]}.

field.name: TempSelAlert
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. This field selects which temperature sensor is the event source. It converts the selected Temp input pin into either TAlert or ThermalTrip function.

field.name: AlertControl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Enable ThermalTrip or Talert on the selected Temp input.

field.name: WakeStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The system is in the sleep state and a wake-up event occurs. Wake status.

field.name: PciExpWakeStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The system wake is due to a PCI Express wakeup event. PCI Express® wake status.

field.name: RtcStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=RTC generates an alarm. RTC status, set-by-hardware. If both FCH::PM::Pm1En[RtcEn] and this bit are set to 1, a power management event: SCI, SMI or resume event, is generated.

field.name: PwrBtnStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The Power Button is pressed. Power Button status bit. In the system working state, if FCH::PM::Pm1En[PwrBtnEn] and this bit are both set to 1, an interrupt event is raised. In the sleeping or soft-off state, a wake event is generated when the Power Button is pressed regardless of the setting of FCH::PM::Pm1En[PwrBtnEn].

field.name: GblStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=An SCI is generated due to the BIOS wanting the attention of the SCI handler; Writing 1 to FCH::PM::AcpiCfg[BiosRls] sets this bit. Global status.

field.name: TmrStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. 1=The 31st bit of the 32-bit counter changes from low to high or high to low. Timer status, set-by-hardware. Timer carry status bit. If both FCH::PM::Pm1En[TmrEn] and this bit are set to 1, an interrupt event is raised.

field.name: PciExpWakeDis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Disable the inputs to FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[PciExpWakeStatus] from waking the system.

field.name: RtcEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=A wake event is generated whenever FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[RtcStatus] is also set to 1.

field.name: PwrBtnEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=A power management event (SCI or wake) is generated whenever FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[PwrBtnStatus] is also set to 1.

field.name: GblEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=An SCI is raised whenever FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[GblStatus] is also set to 1.

field.name: TmrEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No interrupt is generated when the FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[TmrStatus] bit is set to 1. 1=An SCI event is generated whenever the FCH::PM::Pm1Stat[TmrStatus] is set to 1. This is the timer carry interrupt enable bit.

field.name: SlpTypeEn
field.desc: Write-1-only. Reset: 0. 1=The system sequences into the sleeping state defined by [SlpTyp] when FCH::PM::ResetCtl1[SlpTypeControl] is set to 1.

field.name: SlpTyp
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Specifies the sleep state the system enters when SlpTypeEn == 1. This design currently implements 5 states: S0, S1, S3, S4, and S5.

field.name: GblRls
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. If FCH::SMI::SmiCtl4[Smicontrol72] is set to 01b, writing 1 to this bit generates SMI and sets FCH::SMI::SmiStat2[GblRlsEvent72].

field.name: SciEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Power management events generate SMI interrupts. 1=Power management events generate SCI interrupts. Selects the power management event to be either an SCI or SMI interrupt for the power management events.

field.name: TmrValue
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: XXXX_XXXXh. It returns the running count of the power management timer (ACPI timer).

field.name: EventStatus
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: XXXX_XXXXh. Each bit represents an ACPI event status. For each bit, configuration for the events are located at FCH::SMI::SciTrig through FCH::SMI::SciMap14. The status bits are also mirrored in FCH::PM::EventStat.

field.name: EventEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Each bit controls whether ACPI should generate wakeup and SCI interrupt. The enable bits are also mirrored in FCH::SMI::EventEn.

field.name: SmiCmdPort
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. When SMI command port is enabled, a Write to this port generates SMI# (only IOW can generate SMI#, MEMW does not generate SMI#). A Read of this address will return the previously Written value but does not generate an SMI.

field.name: SmiCmdStatus
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Used by BIOS and OS.
