register.name: GPIOBank0Ctl
register.desc: GPIO Bank 0 Control Register. Each GPIO pin is controlled by 4 bytes. These registers control GPIO bank 0 pins: GPIO[62:00]. GPIOx000[F8,F4,F0,EC,E8,E4,E0,DC,D8,D4,D0,CC,C8,C4,C0,BC,B8,B4,B0,AC,A8,A4,A0,9C,98,94,90,8C,88,84,80,7C,78,74,70,6C,68,64,60,5C,58,54,50,4C,48, 44,40,3C,38,34,30,2C,28,24,20,1C,18,14,10,0C,08,04,00]; GPIO=FED8_1500h

field.name: Less10secSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 1=The power button is pressed for less than 10 second in S0 state. This bit is only valid for PWR_BTN_L_AGPIO0. For other GPIOs, this bit is Reserved. This bit can be cleared by writing 1 to InterruptSts bit.

field.name: Less2secSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 1=The power button is pressed for less than 2 second in S0 state. This bit is only valid for PWR_BTN_L_AGPIO0. For other GPIOs, this bit is Reserved. When Less2secSts becomes 1, Less10secSts also becomes 1. This bit can be cleared by writing 1 to InterruptSts bit.

field.name: WakeSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin didn't generate a wake event. 1=The pin is a wake source. Wake Status.

field.name: InterruptSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin did not generate an interrupt. 1=The pin is an interrupt source. Interrupt status.

field.name: OutputEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Output is disabled on the pin. 1=Output is enabled on the pin. NOTE: I2C buffers are OD only and cannot support push-pull regardless if they are set in GPIO mode or I2C mode.

field.name: OutputValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Low. 1=High. When selecting I2C pad, OutputValue == don't care. NOTE: I2C buffers are OD only and cannot support push-pull regardless if they are set in GPIO mode or I2C mode.

field.name: PullDownEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Pull-down is disabled on the pin. 1=Pull-down is enabled on the pin. Pull-down enable is not applicable for an I2C pad.

field.name: PullUpEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Pull-up is disabled on the pin. 1=Pull-up is enabled on the pin. Pull-up enable is not applicable for an I2C pad.

field.name: DrvStrengthSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb. 3.3V PAD: x0: Z=40ohms x1: Z=80ohms; 1.8VPAD. NOTE: Drive strengths of 40/60/80 ohms using DrvStrengthSel bit of this GPIO Bank Control Register are not applicable for an I2C pad. I2C pad parameters are controlled by FCH::MISC::I2C3_PadCtrl and FCH::MISC::I2C2_PadCtrl. For example, Drive strength is defined by bits[3:0].

field.name: PinSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 0=The pin is low. 1=The pin is high. This bit is not affected by the debounce logic.

field.name: WakeCntrl[2:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXb. Wake control.

field.name: InterruptEnable[1]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Disable. 1=Enable interrupt delivery.

field.name: InterruptEnable[0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Disable. 1=Enable interrupt status.

field.name: ActiveLevel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: LevelTrig
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Edge trigger. 1=Level trigger.

field.name: DebounceTmrLarge
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. Combined with DebounceTmrOutUnit, this bit changes the unit and max debounce time for the debounce timer. See Table 86 [Debounce Timer Definition].

field.name: DebounceCntrl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: DebounceTmrOutUnit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. DebounceTmrLarge and DebounceTmrOutUnit defines the unit and max debounce time for the debounce timer. See Table 86 [Debounce Timer Definition].

field.name: DebounceTmrOut
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXXb. Specifies the debounce timer out number.

field.name: GpioWakeEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=All GPIO wakes are blocked.

field.name: GpioInterruptEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=All GPIO interrupts are blocked.

field.name: EOI
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=The GPIO interrupt is blocked. 1=Allow GPIO interrupt, hardware clears this bit when interrupt occurs. This software/hardware handshake mechanism is the same as EOS of SMI.

field.name: MaskStsEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable hardware to block all wake/interrupt status generation when software Writes to any debounce registers. The length of blocking depends on mask_sts_length[3:0].

field.name: MaskStsLength[3:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Fh. See MaskStsEn and MaskStsLength[11:4]. The length of blocking = {MaskStsLength[11:0],14'h3FFF}.

field.name: MaskStsLength[11:4]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. See MaskStsEn and MaskStsLength[3:0].

field.name: EnWinBlueBtn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=GPIO0 detects debounced power button; Power button override is 4 sec. 1=GPIO0 detects debounced power button in S3/S5/S0I3, and detects "pressed less than 2 sec" and "pressed 2~10 sec" in S0; Power button override is 10 sec.

field.name: IntrOutActiveHi
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=GPIO controller interrupt output is active low. 1=GPIO controller interrupt output is active high.

field.name: SelGpio0Src
field.desc: Select the source for GPIO0 detection. Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Power button goes to a processing logic first and then goes to GPIO0 detection logic. 1=Power button goes to GPIO0 debounce and then goes to GPIO0 detection logic. The "processing logic" includes 16 ms debounce counter and a logic to detect how long the button has been pressed to generate press_less2s_sts and press_less4s_sts. Only "GPIO0 debounce block" has debounce function.

field.name: IntrOutPulse
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=GPIO controller interrupt output is a level signal. 1=GPIO controller interrupt output is pulse signal. The polarity is defined by IntrOutActiveHi register bit.

register.name: GPIOBank1Ctl
register.desc: GPIO Bank 1 Control Register. Each GPIO pin is controlled by 4 bytes. These registers control GPIO bank 1 pins: GPIO[127:64]. GPIOx001[FC,F8,F4,F0,EC,E8,E4,E0,DC,D8,D4,D0,CC,C8,C4,C0,BC,B8,B4,B0,AC,A8,A4,A0,9C,98,94,90,8C,88,84,80,7C,78,74,70,6C,68,64,60,5C,58,54,50,4C, 48,44,40,3C,38,34,30,2C,28,24,20,1C,18,14,10,0C,08,04,00]; GPIO=FED8_1500h

field.name: WakeSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin didn't generate a wake event. 1=The pin is a wake source. Wake status.

field.name: InterruptSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin didn't generate an interrupt. 1=The pin is an interrupt source. Interrupt status.

field.name: OutputEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Output is disabled on the pin. 1=Output is enabled on the pin. NOTE: I2C buffers are OD only and cannot support push-pull regardless if they are set in GPIO mode or I2C mode.

field.name: OutputValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Low. 1=High. When selecting I2C pad, OutputValue == don't care. NOTE: I2C buffers are OD only and cannot support push-pull regardless if they are set in GPIO mode or I2C mode.

field.name: PullDownEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Pull-down is disabled on the pin. 1=Pull-down is enabled on the pin. Pull-down enable is not applicable for an I2C pad.

field.name: PullUpEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Pull-up is disabled on the pin. 1=Pull-up is enabled on the pin. Pull-up enable is not applicable for an I2C pad.

field.name: DrvStrengthSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb. 3.3V PAD: x0: Z=40ohms x1: Z=80ohms; 1.8VPAD. NOTE: Drive strengths of 40/60/80 ohms using DrvStrengthSel bit of this GPIO Bank Control Register are not applicable for an I2C pad. I2C pad parameters are controlled by FCH::MISC::I2C3_PadCtrl and FCH::MISC::I2C2_PadCtrl. For example, Drive strength is defined by bits[3:0].

field.name: PinSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 0=The pin is low. 1=The pin is high. This bit is not affected by the debounce logic.

field.name: WakeCntrl[2:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXb. Wake control.

field.name: InterruptEnable[1:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb. Enable interrupt status and delivery.

field.name: ActiveLevel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: LevelTrig
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Edge trigger. 1=Level trigger.

field.name: DebounceTmrLarge
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. Combined with DebounceTmrOutUnit, this bit changes the unit and max debounce time for the debounce timer. See Table 86 [Debounce Timer Definition].

field.name: DebounceCntrl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: DebounceTmrOutUnit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. DebounceTmrLarge and DebounceTmrOutUnit defines the unit and max debounce time for the debounce timer. See Table 86 [Debounce Timer Definition].

field.name: DebounceTmrOut
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXXb. Specifies the debounce timer out number.

register.name: GPIOBank2Ctl
register.desc: GPIO Bank 2 Control Register. Each GPIO pin is controlled by 4 bytes. These registers control GPIO Bank 2 pins: GPIO[187:128]. GPIOx002[EC,E8,E4,E0,DC,D8,D4,D0,CC,C8,C4,C0,BC,B8,B4,B0,AC,A8,A4,A0,9C,98,94,90,8C,88,84,80,7C,78,74,70,6C,68,64,60,5C,58,54,50,4C,48,44,40,3C, 38,34,30,2C,28,24,20,1C,18,14,10,0C,08,04,00]; GPIO=FED8_1500h

field.name: WakeSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin did not generate a wake event. 1=The pin is a wake source. Wake status.

field.name: InterruptSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin did not generate an interrupt. 1=The pin is an interrupt source. Interrupt status.

field.name: OutputEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Output is disabled on the pin. 1=Output is enabled on the pin. NOTE: I2C buffers are OD only and cannot support push-pull regardless if they are set in GPIO mode or I2C mode.

field.name: OutputValue
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Low. 1=High. When selecting I2C pad, Outputvalue == don't care. NOTE: I2C buffers are OD only and cannot support push-pull regardless if they are set in GPIO mode or I2C mode.

field.name: PullDownEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Pull-down is disabled on the pin. 1=Pull-down is enabled on the pin. Pull-down enable is not applicable to I2C pad.

field.name: PullUpEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Pull-up is disabled on the pin. 1=Pull-up is enabled on the pin. Pull-up enable is not applicable to I2C pad.

field.name: DrvStrengthSel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb. 3.3V PAD: x0: Z=40ohms x1: Z=80ohms; 1.8VPAD. NOTE: Drive strengths of 40/60/80 ohms using DrvStrengthSel bit of this GPIO Bank Control Register are not applicable to I2C pad. I2C pad parameters are controlled by FCH::MISC::I2C3_PadCtrl and FCH::MISC::I2C2_PadCtrl. For example, Drive strength is defined by bits[3:0].

field.name: PinSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 0=The pin is low. 1=The pin is high. This bit is not affected by the debounce logic.

field.name: WakeCntrl[2:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXb. Wake control.

field.name: InterruptEnable[1:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb. Enable interrupt status and delivery.

field.name: ActiveLevel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: LevelTrig
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Edge trigger. 1=Level trigger.

field.name: DebounceTmrLarge
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. Combined with DebounceTmrOutUnit, this bit changes the unit and max debounce time for the debounce timer. See Table 86 [Debounce Timer Definition].

field.name: DebounceCntrl
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: DebounceTmrOutUnit
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. DebounceTmrLarge and DebounceTmrOutUnit defines the unit and max debounce time for the debounce timer. See Table 86 [Debounce Timer Definition].

field.name: DebounceTmrOut
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXXb. Specifies the debounce timer out number.

field.name: WakeStatusIndex[31:16]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. When bit[N] is1, at least one wake status of GPIO N*4 ~ N*4+3 is 1.

field.name: WakeStatusIndex[15]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=None of the GPIO[62:60] wake status are 1. 1=At least one wake status of GPIO[62:60] is 1. When this bit is 1, at least one wake status of GPIO[62:60] is 1.

field.name: WakeStatusIndex[14:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. When bit[N] is1, at least one wake status of GPIO N*4 ~ N*4+3 is 1.

field.name: NBGppPmeWake
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No NBGPP PME wake event. 1=NBGPP has sent PME to wake the system. One wake status is set in GPIO Bank3 register.

field.name: WakeStatusIndex[13:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. For each bit, 1=At least one of the wake status of GPIO N*4 ~ N*4+3 is 1.

field.name: InterruptStatusIndex[31:16]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. When bit[N] is 1, at least one interrupt status of GPIO N*4 ~ N*4+3 is 1.

field.name: InterruptStatusIndex[15]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=None of the GPIO[62:60] interrupt status are 1. 1=At least one interrupt status of GPIO[62:60] is 1. When this bit is 1, at least one of the interrupt status of GPIO[62:60] is 1.

field.name: InterruptStatusIndex[14:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. When bit[N] is 1, at least one interrupt status of GPIO N*4 ~ N*4+3 is 1.

field.name: MaskStsEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable hardware to block all wake/interrupt status generation when software writes to any debounce registers. The length of blocking depends on MaskStsLength[3:0].

field.name: MaskStsLength[3:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Fh. See also MaskStsEn and MaskStsLength[11:4]. The length of blocking = {MaskStsLength[11:0], 14'h3FFF}.

field.name: MaskStsLength[11:4]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. See MaskStsEn and MaskStsLength[3:0]. MaskStsLength[11:0] = {MaskStsLength[11:4],MaskStsLength[3:0]}.

field.name: NBGppPmeIntr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No NB GPP PME event. 1=NB GPP has sent PME (one of the interrupt status bits are set in the GPIO Bank3 register).

field.name: InterruptStatusIndex[13:0]
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. For each bit, at least one interrupt status of GPIO N*4 ~ N*4+3 is 1.

register.name: GPIOBank3Ctl
register.desc: GPIO Bank 3 Control Register. Each GPIO pin is controlled by 4 bytes. These registers control GPIO bank 3 pins: GPIO[224:193]. GPIOx003[FC,F8,F4,F0,EC,E8,E4,E0,DC,D8,D4,D0,CC,C8,C4,C0,BC,B8,B4,B0,AC,A8,A4,A0,9C,98,94,90,8C,88,84,80,7C,78,74,70,6C,68,64,60,5C,58,54,50,4C, 48,44,40,3C,38,34,30,2C,28,24,20,1C,18,14,10,0C,08,04,00]; GPIO=FED8_1500h

field.name: WakeSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin did not generate a wake event. 1=The pin is a wake source. Wake status.

field.name: InterruptSts
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: X. 0=The pin did not generate an interrupt. 1=The pin is an interrupt source. Interrupt status.

field.name: PinSts
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: X. 0=The pin is low. 1=The pin is high. This bit is not affected by the debounce logic.

field.name: WakeCntrl[2:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXXb. Wake control.

field.name: InterruptEnable[1:0]
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb. Enable interrupt status and delivery.

field.name: ActiveLevel
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: XXb.

field.name: LevelTrig
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: X. 0=Edge trigger. 1=Level trigger.

field.name: DEV_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 7906h. Device ID.

field.name: VEND_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1022h. Vendor ID.

field.name: Det_Perr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. This bit is set by the device whenever it detects a parity error, even if parity error handling is disabled (as controlled by Parity_EN bit).

field.name: Sig_SysErr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=SERR# not asserted. 1=SERR# asserted. Set whenever the device asserts SERR#.

field.name: Rec_Mabort
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Cycle not terminted with Master Abort. 1=Cycle terminted with Master Abort. This bit is set by a master device whenever its transaction (except for Special Cycle) is terminated with Master Abort.

field.name: Rec_Tabort
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=PCI cycle not aborted. 1=PCI cycle is aborted by a PCI terget. This bit is set by a master device whenever its transaction is terminated with Target-Abort.

field.name: Sig_Tabort
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Target Abort not signaled. 1=Target Abort signaled. This bit is set by a target device whenever it terminates a transaction with Target Abort.

field.name: DEVSEL_Timing
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1h. Medium timing selected.

field.name: Master_DPerr
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No data parity error. 1=Detects PERR# asserted while acting as PCI master. Master Data Parity error.

field.name: Fast_B2B_Cap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allows Fast Back-to-Back capability.

field.name: PCI_ST_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: En_66MHz
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. indicating 66MHz capable.

field.name: Cap_List
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. indicating no Capabilities linked list available.

field.name: Int_status
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Reflects the state of the interrupt in the device/function.

field.name: PCI_ST_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: PCI_CMD_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: Fixed,00h. Reserved.

field.name: Int_Dis
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enables the assertion of the device/function's INTx# signal. 1=Disable. Interrutp disable.

field.name: Fast_B2B_En
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Fast back-to-back transactions allowed only to the same agent. 1=Fast back-to-back transactions not allowed. Hard-wired to 0, indicating fast back-to-back transactions to the same agent only are allowed.

field.name: SERRB_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable the SERR# driver. 1=Enable the SERR# driver. SERR# driver enable.

field.name: PCI_CMD_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: Parity_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Parity check disabled. 1=Device must take action when a parity error is detected. Parity error detect.

field.name: VGA_Pal_Access
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow snoop VGA palette cycles.

field.name: MemWr_Inv_Cmd
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow Memory Write and Invalidate command.

field.name: Special_Cycle
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Special cycle recognition disable. 1=Special cycle recognition enable. Special cycle recognition.

field.name: Bus_Master
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disallow. 1=Allow. Allow the device to behave as a bus master.

field.name: Mem_Space_Access
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Memory Space access enable.

field.name: IO_Space_Access
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. IO Space access enable.

field.name: BC
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 08h. Base Class Code. Hard-wired to 08h, indicating general peripheral.

field.name: SC
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 05h. Sub Class Code. Hard-wired to 05h, indicating SD host controller.

field.name: PI
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 01h. Programming Interface Code. Hard-wired to 01h for Standard host supporting DMA.

field.name: Revision_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,01h. Revision ID.

field.name: BIST
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Hard-wired to 00h, indicating no build-in BIST support.

field.name: Header_Type
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,80h. Bit[23] hard-wired to 1, indicating a single-function device. Bit[22:16] hard-wired to 00h.

field.name: Latency_Timer
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Latency_timer_HW bits[10:8] hard-wired to 000b, resulting in a timer granularity of at least eight clocks. This field specifies, in units of PCI bus clocks, the value of the Latency Timer for this PCI bus master.

field.name: Latency_Timer_HW
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Specifies the value of the Latency Timer in units of PCICLKs.

field.name: Cache_Size
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This Read/Write field specifies the system cacheline size in units of DWORDs and must be initialized to 00h.

field.name: BAR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00_0000h. Base Address. Specifies the 64-bit starting base address.

field.name: BAR_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: PM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Prefetch memory. A constant value of 0 indicates that there is no support for memory prefetch.

field.name: TP1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1h. 2'b1 indicates that the base register is 64-bit width

field.name: TP0
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Reserved.

field.name: IND
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Resource Type Indicator. A constant value of 0 indicates that the operational registers of the device are mapped into memory space of the main memory of the PC host system.

field.name: BAR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00_0000h. Base Address. Specifies the upper 15 bits of the 32-bit starting base address.

field.name: BAR_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: PM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Prefetch memory. A constant value of 0 indicates that there is no support for memory prefetch.

field.name: TP
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 2h. 2'b10 indicates that the base register is 64-bit width

field.name: IND
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Resource Type Indicator. A constant value of 0 indicates that the operational registers of the device are mapped into memory space of the main memory of the PC host system.

field.name: UBAR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Upper 32 bits of Base Address.

field.name: Sub_System_ID
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 7806h. Can only be written once by software.

field.name: Sub_Vendor_ID
field.desc: Read,Write-once. Reset: 1022h. Can only be written once by software.

field.name: CAP_PTR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 80h. The first pointer of the Capability block. To the Function Level Reset (FLR) register.

field.name: MAX_LAT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Hardwired to 00h to indicate no major requirements for the settings of the Latency Timers.

field.name: MIN_GNT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Hardwired to 00h to indicate no major requirements for the settings of the Latency Timers.

field.name: Int_Pin
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 01h. Hard-wired to 01h, corresponding to using INTA#

field.name: Int_Line
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. The Interrupt Line register used to communicate interrupt line routing information.

field.name: Slot_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: Num_Of_Slot
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Hardwired to 000h to indicate only 1 slot.

field.name: Slot_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: First_BAR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. Hardwired to 000b to indicate BAR0 (Base address 10h).

field.name: CAP_NXT_PTR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 90h. Pointer to the next item in the capabilities list.

field.name: CAP_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 05h. 05h indicates MSI.

field.name: MSI_CTRL_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Reserved.

field.name: Extend_Addr_En
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Not capable. 1=Capable. 64-bit Address Capable.

field.name: Mul_Msg_En
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Multiple Message Enable.

field.name: Mul_Msg_Cap
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Multiple Message Capable.

field.name: MSI_Enable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. MSI Enable.

field.name: Msg_Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Message Address.

field.name: MSI_ADDR_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: Msg_Upper_Addr
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. Message Upper Address.

field.name: Msg_Data
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Message Data.

field.name: CAP_NXT_PTR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Pointer to the next item in the capabilities list.

field.name: CAP_ID
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 01h. Power Management.

field.name: PME_Support
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,10h. This 5-bit field indicates the power states in which the function may assert PME#. A value of 0 for any bits indicates that the function is not capable of asserting the PME# signal while in that power state.

field.name: D2_Support
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. D2 Power Management State.

field.name: D1_Support
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. D1 Power Management State.

field.name: Aux_Current
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. 3.3V auxillary current requirements.

field.name: DSI
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Device Specific Initialization.

field.name: PMC_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: PME_Clock
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. If PME depends on PCI clock.

field.name: PMC_Version
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,3h. 011b indicates compliance to revision 1.2 of the PCI Power Management Interface Spec.

field.name: PME_Status
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Set when the function normally asserts the PME# signal independent of the state of PME# Enable

field.name: Data_Scale
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Indicates the scaling factor to be used when interpreting the value of the Data register. The value and meaning of this field varries depending on which data value has been selected by the Data_Select field.

field.name: Data_Select
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Selects which data is to be reported through the Data register and Data_Scale field.

field.name: PME_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=PME# assertion is disabled. 1=Enable the function to assert PME#. PME# Enable.

field.name: PMCSR_Reserved2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0h. Reserved.

field.name: No_Soft_Reset
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,1. 1=Indicates that devices transitioning from D3hot to D0 because of PowerState commands do not perform an internal reset.

field.name: PMCSR_Reserved1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Reserved.

field.name: PowerState
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Initiates Power State.

field.name: BPCC_En
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. Bus Power/Clock Control enable.

field.name: B2_B3
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,0. B2/B3 support for D3hot

field.name: PMC_BSE_Reserved
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: Fixed,00h. Reserved.

field.name: PMC_Data
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Reports the state dependent data requested by the Data_Select field. The value of this register is scaled by the value reported by the Data_Scale field.

field.name: SYS_ADDR1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Upper bits. By updating this register, DMA_WAIT will be cleared. System Address. It indicates system memory address for the DMA. When DMA transfer detects the DMA Buffer Boundary specified by FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_BLK_CS[DMA_BUF_BNDRY], the SD controller asserts DMA_WAIT. Also, the SD controller generates a DMA interrupt at this time in the case that corresponding bits in the Normal Interrupt Status Enable register and Normal Interrupt Signal Enable register are set. While ADMA is enabled, this regiseter will not be used.

field.name: SYS_ADDR0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Lower bits. By updating this register, DMA_WAIT will be cleared.

field.name: BLK_CNT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Block count. It indicates block count of multiple data transfer. It is enabled when FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CMD_TRN[BLK_CNT_EN] == 1. It is decremented after each block data transmission. During infinite data transmission, the setting of this bit is meaningless.

field.name: DMA_BUF_BNDRY
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Host DMA buffer boundary. Indicates the contiguous buffer size in the system memory. When this boundary is reached internally, a DMA interrupt will be generated.

field.name: BLK_SIZE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 000h. Transfer data length (Max. block size is 2K bytes). When FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CE_ATA_CTRL[CE_ATA_EN] == 1, a value of 0x000 indicates a block size of 4K bytes.

field.name: ARGUMENT1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Upper bits. Command Argument. Command arguments specified as bits[39:8] of the command format.

field.name: ARGUMENT0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Lower bits.

field.name: CMD_IDX
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. Command index.

field.name: CMD_TYPE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Command type.

field.name: DATA_PRSNT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No data. 1=Data. Data present select. Indicates that data is present and will be transferred on the DAT line. When a command is issued with this bit enabled, the internal buffer will be cleared.

field.name: CMD_IDX_CHK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Command index check enable.

field.name: CRC_CHK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Command CRC check enable.

field.name: RESP_TYPE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Response type select.

field.name: MULTI_BLK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Single block. 1=Multiple blocks. Multiple/Single block select.

field.name: DATA_DIR
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Write. 1=Read. Data transfer direction.

field.name: ACMD12_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Auto CMD12 enable. It is not valid when FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CMD_TRN[BLK_CNT_EN] == 0.

field.name: BLK_CNT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Block count enable.

field.name: DMA_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. DMA enable.

field.name: RESPONSE1
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. Response. R[39:24] of the response is saved in this field. The value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE0
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[23:8] of the response is saved in this field.

field.name: RESPONSE3
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. Response. R[71:56] of response is saved in this field. The value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE2
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[55:40] of response is saved in this field.

field.name: RESPONSE5
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. Response. R[103:88] of response is saved in this field. The value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE4
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[87:72] of response is saved in this field.

field.name: RESPONSE7
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. Response. R[127:120] of response or R[39:24] of Auto CMD12 response is saved in this field. The value is preseved until the next response.

field.name: RESPONSE6
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0000h. R[119:104] of response or R[23:8] of Auto CMD12 response is saved in this field.

field.name: BUFF_DATA1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Data buffer. Upper bits. Data will be accessed through this register. Data which exceeds the size designated by FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_BLK_CS[BLK_SIZE] will not be written in the data buffer.

field.name: BUFF_DATA0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Lower bits.

field.name: WP_LEVEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Write protected. 1=Write enable. Write Protect switch Level.

field.name: CD_LEVEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No card present. 1=Card present. Card Detect pin level. This bit is used for testing.

field.name: CARD_INS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No card inserted or debouncing state or resetting. 1=Card inserted. Card inserted.

field.name: BUF_RD_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Read disable. 1=Read enable. Buffer Read enable. Indicates buffer is ready for reading.

field.name: BUF_WR_EN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Write disable. 1=Write enable. Buffer Write enable. Indicates buffer is ready for writing.

field.name: RD_TX_ACTIVE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No data transferring. 1=Read data transferring. Read Transfer active. Indicates duration of read data transfer.

field.name: WR_TX_ACTIVE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No data transferring. 1=Write data transferring. Write Transfer active. Indicates duration of write data transfer.

field.name: DAT_LINE_ACTIVE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=DAT line inactive. 1=DAT line active. DAT Line Active. Indicates DAT line on SD Bus is active.

field.name: CMD_INHIB_DAT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Can issue commands which uses the DAT line. 1=Cannot issue any commands which uses the DAT line. Command inhibit (DAT). Indicates that commands which use also use the DAT line can be issued.

field.name: CMD_INHIB_CMD
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Can issue commands which use CMD line. 1=Cannot issue any commands. Command Inhibit (CMD). Indicates that commands which use only the CMD line can be issued.

field.name: SD_REM_WAKE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Card removal wakeup.

field.name: SD_INS_WAKE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Card insertion wakeup.

field.name: SD_INT_WAKE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD Card interrupt wakeup.

field.name: BG_INT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Interrupt at Block Gap. Enable interrupt detection during 4-bit block transmission.

field.name: READ_WAIT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Read Wait Control. Indicates Read Wait will be inserted when needed.

field.name: CONT_REQ
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=No effect. 1=Restart. Continue request. Writing 1 to this bit triggers a restart of halted data transaction with the current register setting. Once this bit is 1, the internal buffer is cleared and the data transfer sequence will be restarted.

field.name: BG_STOP_REQ
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Transfer. 1=Stop. Stop at Block Gap request. Writing 1 to this bit triggers the halting of the current data transfer after the next block gap. For using this request, the Read Wait function is necessary in the Read transaction. Even if FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CMD_TRN[ACMD12_EN] == 1, Auto CMD12 is not issued in the case of this bit being set to 1. This bit is cleared by not only Writing 0 to this bit, but also issuing abort commands.

field.name: SD_BUS_VOLTAGE
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. SD bus voltage.

field.name: SD_BUS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Off. 1=On. SD bus power. When card is removed, this bit is cleared automatically.

field.name: MMC_WIDTH
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Use width set by FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CTRL1[DAT_TX_WIDTH]. 1=8-bit. Extended data transfer width (MMC).

field.name: DMA_SELECT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. DMA select. Valid only when DMA is enabled.

field.name: HIGH_SPEED_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Normal speed. 1=High speed. High Speed enable. When disabled, SD controller outputs commands and data on the falling edge of the SD clock (Up to 25MHz SD clock can be supported). When enabled, SD controller outputs commands and data on the rising edge of the SD clock (Up to 50MHz SD clock can be supported).

field.name: DAT_TX_WIDTH
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=1-bit. 1=4-bit. Data transfer width.

field.name: LED_CTRL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Off. 1=On. LED control. Drives the LED_ON output.

field.name: SOFT_RST_DAT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0.

field.name: SOFT_RST_CMD
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0.

field.name: SOFT_RST_ALL
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0.

field.name: DATA_TO_CNT
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Data Timeout Counter Value. By using this counter value, DAT line timeouts are detected.

field.name: SDCLK_DIV
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. SDCLK frequency select. If multiple bits are set, the most significant bit will be selected.

field.name: SDCLK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. SD clock enable. SDCLK frequency select can be changed when this bit is 0. When card is removed, this bit is cleared to 0 automatically.

field.name: SYSCLK_STABLE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Unstable. 1=Stable. Internal clock stable.

field.name: SYSCLK_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Internal clock enable.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. CE-ATA error.

field.name: SDMA_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. SDMA error.

field.name: ADMA_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. ADMA error.

field.name: ACMD12_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 error. Logical OR of Auto CMD12 Error Status Register.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Data End error.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Data CRC error.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Data Timeout error.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Command Index error. Mismatch of Command Index and index of response.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Command End Bit error.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Command CRC Error. If (CMD_TO_ERR && CMD_CRC_ERR) == 1, this indicates a Command Conflict Error.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Command Timeout error. Response not returned within 128 SDCLK cycles.

field.name: ERROR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Error interrupt.

field.name: SDIO
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. SDIO Card interrupt. Writing 1 to this register does not clear this bit. For clearing this bit, the interrupt factor of SDIO cards should be cleared. The value of this bit is latched internally as long as the Card Interrupt bit (D08) in the Normal Interrupt Status Enable Register is 1.

field.name: CARD_REM
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Card removal.

field.name: CARD_INS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Card insertion.

field.name: BUF_RD_RDY
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Buffer Read Ready. In case FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CMD_TRN[ACMD12_EN] == 1 and last block has been transferred, Auto CMD12 will be issued prior to this bit being set to 1. Clearing this bit should be done before Reading the buffer because the SD controller has a dual buffer and the next Buffer Read Ready interrupt may occur immediately.

field.name: BUF_WR_RDY
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Buffer Write Ready. Clearing this bit should be done before writing to the buffer because the SD controller has a dual buffer and the next Buffer Write Ready interrupt may occur immediately.

field.name: DMA_EVT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. DMA interrupt. It is set when the internal counter reaches the value designated by the Host DMA Buffer Boundary. It should be cleared by the Host Driver after the System Address Register is updated.

field.name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Block gap event. It indicates the timing of next block gap, which was requested by the Stop At Block Gap Request. In the case of a Write transaction, this interrupt will be generated before busy completion.

field.name: DAT_DONE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Data not done. 1=Data done. Data transfer complete. Indicates the timing for completion of data transaction, which includes the completion at the block gap by the Stop At Block Gap Request. When some errors are detected during data transaction, this bit will not be set. In case that FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CMD_TRN[ACMD12_EN] == 1, Auto CMD12 will be issued prior to this bit being set to 1.

field.name: CMD_DONE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Command not done. 1=Command done. Command complete. The end bit of the command response is received. In the case of commands with no response, the end of the command.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. CE-ATA Error interrupt mask.

field.name: SDMA_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. SDMA Error interrupt mask.

field.name: ADMA_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. ADMA Error interrupt mask.

field.name: ACMD12_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Auto CMD12 Error interrupt mask.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Current Limit Error interrupt mask.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Data End Bit Error interrupt mask.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Data CRC Error interrupt mask.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Data Timeout Error interrupt mask.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command Index Error interrupt mask.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command End Bit Error interrupt mask.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command CRC Error interrupt mask.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command Timeout Error interrupt mask.

field.name: SDIO_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Card interrupt mask.

field.name: CARD_REM_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Card Removal interrupt mask.

field.name: CARD_INS_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Card Insertion interrupt mask.

field.name: BUF_RD_RDY_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Buffer Read Ready interrupt mask.

field.name: BUF_WR_RDY_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Buffer Write Ready interrupt mask.

field.name: DMA_EVT_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. DMA Interrupt interrupt mask.

field.name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Block Gap Event interrupt mask.

field.name: DAT_DONE_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Transfer Complete interrupt mask.

field.name: CMD_DONE_MASK
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command Complete interrupt mask.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. CE-ATA error.

field.name: SDMA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. SDMA error.

field.name: ADMA_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. ADMA error.

field.name: ACMD12_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Current Limit error.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Data End Bit error.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Data CRC error.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Data Timeout error.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command Index error.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command End Bit error.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command CRC error.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command Timeout error.

field.name: SDIO_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Card Interrupt.

field.name: CARD_REM_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Card Removal.

field.name: CARD_INS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Card Insertion.

field.name: BUF_RD_RDY_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Buffer Read Ready.

field.name: BUF_WR_RDY_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Buffer Write Ready.

field.name: DMA_EVT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. DMA Interrupt.

field.name: BLOCK_GAP_EVT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Block Gap Event.

field.name: DAT_DONE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Transfer Complete.

field.name: CMD_DONE_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Masked. 1=Enabled. Command Complete.

field.name: CMD_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Command not issued by Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: INDEX_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 Index error.

field.name: END_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 End Bit error.

field.name: CRC_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 CRC error.

field.name: TO_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 Timeout error.

field.name: EXE_ERR
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Auto CMD12 Not Executed error.

field.name: SUPPORT_1_8V
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. Voltage support for 1.8V.

field.name: SUPPORT_3_0V
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. Voltage support for 3.0V.

field.name: SUPPORT_3_3V
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. Voltage support for 3.3V.

field.name: SUS_RES_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. Suspend and Resume support.

field.name: DMA_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. DMA support.

field.name: HISPEED_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. High Speed support.

field.name: ADMA_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. ADMA support.

field.name: SYS_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. Fixed to 0 in this release.

field.name: MMC8_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Not supported. 1=Supported. Extended Media Bus Support (MMC).

field.name: MAX_BLK_LEN
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 2h. Max block length.

field.name: BASE_CLK_FREQ
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 18h. Base clock frequency for SD clock.

field.name: TO_CLK_UNIT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Clock units are in KHz. 1=Clock units are in MHz. Timeout clock Unit.

field.name: TO_CLK_FREQ
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 18h. Timeout clock frequency. See also TO_CLK_UNIT to get the units.

field.name: MAX_CURR_1_8V
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Max current for 1.8V.

field.name: MAX_CURR_3_0V
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Max current for 3.0V.

field.name: MAX_CURR_3_3V
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 64h. Max current for 3.3V.

field.name: CE_ATA_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force CE-ATA error.

field.name: SDMA_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force SDMA error.

field.name: ADMA_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force ADMA error.

field.name: ACMD12_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: CUR_LIM_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force current limit error.

field.name: DAT_END_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force data end bit error.

field.name: DAT_CRC_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force data CRC error.

field.name: DAT_TO_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force data timeout error.

field.name: CMD_IDX_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force command index error.

field.name: CMD_END_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force command end bit error.

field.name: CMD_CRC_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force command CRC error.

field.name: CMD_TO_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force command timeout error.

field.name: ACMD12_CMD_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force command not issued by Auto CMD12 error.

field.name: ACMD12_IDX_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force Auto CMD12 index error.

field.name: ACMD12_END_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force Auto CMD12 end bit error.

field.name: ACMD12_CRC_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force Auto CMD12 CRC error.

field.name: ACMD12_TO_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force Auto CMD12 timeout error.

field.name: ACMD12_EXE_ERR_FRC
field.desc: Write-only. Reset: 0. 0=No Interrupt. 1=Interrupt is generated. Force Auto CMD12 not executed error.

field.name: ADDR_LEN_MISMATCH
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No error. 1=Error.

field.name: ADMA_STATE
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0h. ADMA states when an error occured.

field.name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Upper bits of ADMA system address. Before the ADMA data transfer, the descriptor address should be set by the Host driver. This address needs to be set with 4-byte alignment, since the descriptor table is formatted for 32-bit (4 bytes) information.

field.name: ADMA_SYS_ADDR0
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0000h. Lower bits of ADMA system address.

field.name: CE_ATA_SUPPORT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 1. 0=Unsupported. 1=Supported. CE-ATA support capability. When supported, bits[3:0] can be written.

field.name: CE_ATA_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. CE-ATA enable. When enabled bits[2:0] can be written.

field.name: P_DRIVE_DIS
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Enable. 1=Disable. P-Drive disable.

field.name: CMD_COMP_DIS_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Wait after command. 1=Issued after command. Command Completion Signal Disable enable.

field.name: CMD_COMP_SIG_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Command Completion Signal enable. When the Command Completion Signal is enabled, the FCH::SD::MMIO::SDHC_CMD_TRN[ACMD12_EN] bit in the Transfer Mode register becomes of no use.

field.name: DEBOUNCING_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. Debouncing enable. This bit should be cleared before starting command or data transfer if debouncing state is not needed in the error cases.

field.name: DEBOUNCING_STATUS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Not debouncing. 1=Debouncing. Debouncing State status. Indicates the card is debouncing. Should not issue any commands during debouncing.

field.name: CARD_DETECT_SEL
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=Standard Card Detect mode. 1=DAT3 Card Detect mode. Card Detct Select status.

field.name: DAT3_DETECT_EN
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 0=Disable. 1=Enable. DAT3 Card Detect control. Disable this bit before writing to the Command Register. After Command or Transfer complete, this bit can be re-enabled. During command and data transfer, enabling DAT3 Card Detection is prohibited. This bit is fixed to 1 in Standard Card Detect mode.

field.name: DAT3_CARD_INS
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 0. 0=No card inserted. 1=Card inserted. DAT3 Card inserted.

field.name: VENDOR_VERSION
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: C3h. Vendor Version.

field.name: SPEC_VERSION
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 02h. Specification Version.

field.name: SLOT_INTRPT
field.desc: Read-only. Reset: 00h. Interrupt signal for each slot. The value of XSLT_INT[7:0] inputs, which indicates the logical OR of Interrupt signal and Wakeup signal, are inverted and referred by this register. In case of multiple slots, Interrupt signal and Wakeup signal should be logical ORed externally and should be inputted to each of XSLT_INT[7:0].

register.name: HceControl
register.desc: HCE Control. Used to enable and control the emulation hardware and report various status information.

field.name: A20State
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Indicates current state of Gate A20 on keyboard controller.

field.name: IRQ12Active
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Indicates that a positive transition on IRQ12 from the keyboard controller has occurred. Software may write a 1 to this bit to clear it (set it to 0). Software write of a 0 to this bit has no effect.

field.name: IRQ1Active
field.desc: Read,Write-1-to-clear. Reset: 0. Indicates that a positive transition on IRQ1 from the keyboard controller has occurred. Software may write a 1 to this bit to clear it (set it to 0). Software write of a 0 to this bit has no effect.

field.name: GateA20Sequence
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Set by the Host Controller (HC).

field.name: ExternalIRQEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=IRQ1 and IRQ12 from the keyboard controller causes an emulation interrupt. The function controlled by this bit is independent of the setting of the EmulationEnable bit in this register.

field.name: IRQEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=The HC generates IRQ1 or IRQ12 as long as the FCH::USBLEGACY::HceStatus[OutputFull] == 1. If FCH::USBLEGACY::HceStatus[AuxOutputFull] == 0, then IRQ1 is generated, else if it is 1, then an IRQ12 is generated.

field.name: CharacterPending
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=An emulation interrupt is generated when FCH::USBLEGACY::HceStatus[OutputFull] = 0.

field.name: EmulationInterrupt
field.desc: Read-only. This bit is a static decode of the emulation interrupt condition.

field.name: EmulationEnable
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 0=Disabled. 1=The HC is enabled for legacy emulation. The HC decodes accesses and generates IRQ1 and/or IRQ12 when appropriate. Additionally, the HC generates an emulation interrupt at appropriate times to invoke the emulation software.

register.name: HceInput
register.desc: HCE Input. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. This register may be Read or Written directly by accessing it with its memory address in the Host Controller's operational register space. When accessed directly with a memory cycle, Reads and Writes of this register have no side effects.

field.name: InputData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register holds data that is written.

register.name: HceOutput
register.desc: HCE Output. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. The data placed in this register by the emulation software is returned when I/O port 60h is Read and emulation is enabled (FCH::USBLEGACY::HceControl[EmulationEnable] == 1). On a Read of this location, FCH::USBLEGACY::HceStatus[OutputFull] = 0 is set.

field.name: OutputData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 00h. This register hosts data that is returned when an IO Read of port 60h is performed by application software.

register.name: HceStatus
register.desc: HCE Status. Read-write. Reset: 0000_0000h. The contents of the HceStatus Register are returned on an IO Read of port 64h when emulation is enabled. Reads and Writes of port 60h and Writes to port 64h can cause changes in this register. Emulation software can directly access this register through its memory address in the Host Controller's operational register space. Accessing this register through its memory address produces no side effects.

field.name: Parity
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Indicates parity error on keyboard/mouse data.

field.name: TimeOut
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Used to indicate a time-out.

field.name: AuxOutputFull
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. IRQ12 is asserted whenever this bit is set to 1 and (OutputFull == 1 && FCH::USBLEGACY::HceControl[IRQEn] == 1).

field.name: InhibitSwitch
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. This bit reflects the state of the keyboard inhibit switch and is set if the keyboard is NOT inhibited.

field.name: CmdData
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. The HC sets this bit to 0 on an IO Write to port 60h and to 1 on an IO Write to port 64h.

field.name: Flag
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Nominally used as a system flag by software to indicate a warm or cold boot.

field.name: InputFull
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. Except for the case of a Gate A20 sequence, this bit is set to 1 on an IO Write to address 60h or 64h. While this bit is set to 1 and FCH::USBLEGACY::HceControl[EmulationEnable] == 1, an emulation interrupt condition exists.

field.name: OutputFull
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. The HC sets this bit to 0 on a Read of IO port 60h. If (FCH::USBLEGACY::HceControl[IRQEn] == 1 && AuxOutputFull == 0), then an IRQ1 is generated as long as this bit is set to 1. If (FCH::USBLEGACY::HceControl[IRQEn] == 1 && AuxOutputFull == 1), then an IRQ12 is generated as long as this bit is set to 1. While this bit is 0 and FCH::USBLEGACY::HceControl[CharacterPending] == 1, an emulation interrupt condition exists.

field.name: A20State_inv
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Use inverted version of A20State.

field.name: SOFSrc
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0h. Indicates which HCI_MSofN source is used in USB Legacy.

field.name: SOFCounter
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 5h. The amount of SOF number that emulation interrupt has to wait before SMI is sent.

field.name: EmulationSmiEn
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Generate SMI if emulation interrupt happens.

field.name: BlockIRQ12
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Block IRQ12.

field.name: BlockIRQ1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 0. 1=Block IRQ1.

field.name: EnIRQ12
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable IRQ12Active.

field.name: EnIRQ1
field.desc: Read-write. Reset: 1. 1=Enable IRQ1Active.
